They gained an unfair moral advantage for themselves by pointing at Germany’s honest professions of the power- political principles which they themselves covertly followed. Meinecke traces the origin of this situation to the realization by German thought of the inevitable sinfulness of power and the bold attempt of German philosophy to overcome this antinomy by conceiving of morality as immanent in the rise of an intrinsically superior power. He admits that the Germans were misguided by a brutalization of this philosophy to which it is liable, but believes that the Anglo-Saxons avoided a similar outcome only by turning a blind eye on the contradictions between their professions and their practice.256

迈内克对政治非道德主义的论述或许堪称里程碑。他认为第一次世界大战是第一次受暴力教条所鼓舞的群众运动，它自以为在思想和道德上优于那些道德说教的对手。然而，他没有意识到这场战争不过是暴风雨来临前的涟漪。在追溯现实政治思想的演变时，他甚至没有提及马克思主义。因此，他无法预料到政治中道德原则的彻底不稳定性，而这种不稳定性在二十世纪的革命中得到了充分体现。

Meinecke’s account of political immoralism may serve as a landmark. He saw the First World War as the first mass movement inspired by a doctrine of violence and believing in its own intellectual and moral superiority over its moralizing opponents. Yet he did not see that this war was but a ripple before the approaching storm. In tracing the growth of the ideas of Realpolitik he does not even mention Marxism. So he could not suspect the total instability of moral principles in politics which was to manifest itself in the revolutions of the twentieth century.

 

 

  1. 马克思主义的魔力
  2. THE MAGIC OF MARXISM

马克思主义的宣传号召力，是（或许可以称之为）不道德的道德力量最有趣的例证。因为它是最精确表述的体系，却拥有如此悖论式的号召力，而这种自相矛盾性实际上似乎构成了马克思主义运动的主要动力。以赛亚·伯林在其马克思传记中，展现了马克思如何运用这种自相矛盾的原则——一种摒弃一切理想论的预言式理想主义——来施展其宣传天赋：

The propagandistic appeal of Marxism is the most interesting case of (what might be called) the moral force of immorality. For it is the most precisely formulated system having such a paradoxical appeal, and this self-contradiction actually seems to supply the main impulse of the Marxian movement. Isaiah Berlin, in his biography of Marx, shows him in the act of exercising his propagandistic genius by means of this self- contradictory principle—a prophetic idealism spurning all reference to ideals:

 

 

他署名的众多宣言、信仰告白和行动纲领的手稿上仍然留有笔迹和激烈的页边评论，他试图用这些评论抹去所有关于永恒正义、人类平等、个人或国家的权利、良心自由、为文明而战等言论，而这些言论是他那个时代民主运动的常用词汇……他认为这些都是毫无价值的空话，表明思想混乱、行动无效。257

The manuscripts of the numerous manifestos, professions of faith and programmes of action to which he appended his name, still bear the strokes of the pen and the fierce marginal comments, with which he sought to obliterate all references to eternal justice, the equality of man, the rights of individuals or nations, the liberty of conscience, the fight for civilization, and other such phrases which were the stock in trade…of the democratic movements of his time; he looked upon these as so much worthless cant, indicating confusion of thought and ineffectiveness in action.257

 

 

事实上，正因为如此，苏维埃俄国才被许多人视为这些理想的真正捍卫者，并与其公开宣扬这些理想的国家进行斗争。正如汉娜·阿伦特所言：“布尔什维克在俄罗斯国内外声称他们不承认普通的道德标准，这已成为共产主义宣传的支柱……” 258

And indeed, it is not in spite of this contempt for justice, equality and liberty, but because of it that Soviet Russia is accepted by many as the true champion of these same ideals in the fight against the very nations openly professing them. As Hannah Arendt has rightly observed ‘Bolshevik assurances inside and outside Russia that they do not recognize ordinary moral standards, have become a mainstay of Communist propaganda….’258

为什么如此矛盾的学说竟具有如此强大的说服力？我认为，答案是，它使饱受道德自我怀疑折磨的现代人能够放纵其道德激情，而这种激情同时也满足了其对无情客观性的追求。马克思主义通过其“辩证唯物主义”哲学，化解了我们时代高昂的道德活力与严苛的批判激情之间的矛盾，这种批判激情要求我们客观地看待人类事务，即以拉普拉斯的方式将其视为一个机械过程。这些让自由主义者感到踉踉跄跄、摸不着头脑的矛盾，正是马克思主义的魅力和力量所在：因为我们的道德追求越是无节制，我们的客观主义观点越是彻底地不道德，这些相互矛盾的原则相互强化的结合就越有力量。

Why should so contradictory a doctrine carry such supreme convincing power? The answer is, I believe, that it enables the modern mind, tortured by moral self-doubt, to indulge its moral passions in terms which also satisfy its passion for ruthless objectivity. Marxism, through its philosophy of ‘dialectical materialism’, conjures away the contradiction between the high moral dynamism of our age and our stern critical passion which demands that we see human affairs objectively, i.e. as a mechanistic process in the Laplacean manner. These antinomies, which make the liberal mind stagger and fumble, are the joy and strength of Marxism: for the more inordinate our moral aspirations and the more completely amoral our objectivist outlook, the more powerful is a combination in which these contradictory principles mutually reinforce each other.

马克思主义通过列维·布吕尔称之为“参与”的原始心理运作实现了这种复杂的结合。259在原始思想中，狮子把村民撕成碎片，这其中就包含着村民嫉妒的邻居；瘟疫和死亡总是带有邪恶的意图。

Marxism achieves this sophisticated union by a primitive mental operation which Levy Brühl has called ‘participation’.259 For primitive thought, in a lion tearing a villager to pieces there participates the man’s envious neighbour; plagues and fatalities are always endowed with the evil inten-

派遣他们的人的旨意。高级宗教有时将不幸解释为上帝对过去罪孽的报应。近代以来，历史主义用历史必然性取代了上帝，认为历史必然性更容易（甚至更难以捉摸）地完成了历史上合适的任务。在每种情况下，我们都拥有一个内在于显性事件的能动原则；内在于与显性之间的关系，如同目的与其实现之间的关系，只不过这种联系在这里要么是超自然的，要么是未定义的。

tions of someone who sent them. The higher religions sometimes interpret misfortunes as God’s retribution for past offences. More recently, historicism has replaced God by an Historic Necessity, credited with the easier (if even more inscrutable) role of achieving what is historically fitting. In each case we have an active principle immanent in a manifest event; the relation between the immanent and the manifest being the same as between a purpose and its fulfilment, except that the connection is here either supernatural or otherwise left undefined.

马克思主义为这种普遍运作方式——尤其是其现代变体——增添了两个特征，极大地扩展了其范围和说服力。首先，在这种情况下，积极原则是无限道德诉求的集合，这些诉求突然席卷全球，甚至在数百万此前一直生活在对剥削和肮脏的屈从中的人中也得到了响应——与此同时，严格的“科学”裁决被用来确定将要实现和满足这些诉求的事件。其次，马克思主义的机制通过在两个相反但又相互关联的方向上运作而得到扩展。在阶级社会中，物质利益被视为内在于道德愿望之中；而在社会主义国家中，情况则相反：道德内在于无产阶级的物质利益之中。

To this general type of operation—and in particular its modern variant, historicism—Marxism adds two features which greatly enhance its scope and convincing power. First, the active principle in this case is an aggregate of limitless moral demands, demands which have suddenly spread all over the globe, finding response even among millions of people who hitherto had lived in immemorial acceptance of exploitation and squalor—while at the same time, a strictly ‘scientific’ verdict is invoked to identify the events which are to realize and fulfil these demands. Secondly, the mechanism of Marxism is amplified by working in two opposite and yet mutually correlated directions. In a class society it is material interests which are regarded as immanent in moral aspirations: while in a socialist state the opposite holds: morality is immanent in the material interests of the proletariat.

这种二元性或许看起来像是马克思主义的另一个悖论特征，但实际上，它直接源于内在原则被注入显而易见的事件的过程。要理解这一点，你必须想象自己从一开始就——就像马克思一样——对社会主义充满热情，对资本主义深感恐惧。从这个角度审视自由、正义、博爱的理想，你会发现，例如，基于这些原则的《拿破仑法典》在摧毁封建秩序，并为资产阶级及其私营企业制度在整个欧洲的扩张开辟道路方面发挥了极其重要的作用。你还会注意到，自那以后，它一直是资本主义秩序的守护者。因此，资产阶级理想将表现为资本主义的纯粹上层建筑，它既反对它所颠覆的封建制度，也反对它试图使无产阶级永久奴役的无产阶级。资产阶级利益将似乎内在于资产阶级的道德理想之中。这是第一种内在性，是马克思主义的否定分支。

This duality may look like yet another paradoxical feature of Marxism, but actually it can be seen to arise directly from the process by which immanent principles are injected into manifest events. To see this happening you must imagine that you are filled from the start—as Marx was—with a passion for Socialism and a horror of Capitalism. Looking in this light on the ideals of liberty, justice, brotherhood, you will observe, for example, that the Code Napoléon, based on these principles, was supremely effective in destroying the feudal order and in opening the way for the bourgeoisie with its system of private enterprise throughout Europe. You will also note that it has remained the guardian of the capitalist order ever since. Bourgeois ideals will appear, therefore, as a mere superstructure of capitalism, in its opposition both to a feudalism whose rule it has subverted and to the proletariat, whose enslavement it tries to perpetuate. Bourgeois interests will appear to be immanent in bourgeois moral ideals. This is the first kind of immanence, the negative branch of Marxism.

另一方面，现在想想社会主义的革命行动。你满怀热切的愿望，希望看到工人们推翻资本主义，建立一个自由、正义和博爱的王国。但你不能以自由、正义和博爱的名义提出这一要求，因为你鄙视这种情绪化的词句。所以你必须把社会主义从乌托邦变成一门科学。你通过断言“无产阶级”对生产资料的占有将释放出现在被资本主义束缚的新的财富流来做到这一点。这一断言满足了社会主义的道德愿望，因此被那些充满这些愿望的人视为科学真理。道德激情因此以科学肯定的形式出现。这是第二种内在性，是马克思主义的实证分支。通过用科学的伪装掩盖它们，它保护道德情操不被贬低为单纯的情绪化，同时赋予它们一种科学的确定性；另一方面，它又使物质目的充满道德激情。

Think now, on the other hand, of Socialist revolutionary action. You are filled with a passionate desire to see the workers overthrow Capitalism and establish a realm of liberty, justice and brotherhood. But you cannot demand this in the name of liberty, justice and brotherhood, for you despise such emotional phrases. So you must convert Socialism from a Utopia into a Science. You do so by affirming that the appropriation of the means of production by ‘the proletariat’ will release a new flow of wealth now entrammelled by Capitalism. This affirmation satisfies the moral aspirations of Socialism, and is accepted therefore as a scientific truth by those filled with these aspirations. Moral passions are thereby cast in the form of a scientific affirmation. This is the second kind of immanence, the positive branch of Marxism. By covering them with a scientific disguise it protects moral sentiments against being deprecated as mere emotionalism and gives them at the same time a sense of scientific certainty; while on the other hand it impregnates material ends with the fervour of moral passions.

现在我们可以看出，马克思主义的两个分支都否认道德本身具有任何内在力量，然而，它们却都诉诸道德激情。在第一种情况下，我们看到的是从内在的资产阶级利益角度对资产阶级理想的分析，由于这种分析的隐秘动机是对资本主义的谴责，这种分析最终变成了对资产阶级虚伪的揭露。由于这种从物质利益角度对道德主张的分析具有相当的普遍性，它或许会被认为也损害了那些揭露真相的人的道德动机。但这些动机是安全的，因为它们并未公开表述。事实上，通过揭露资产阶级意识形态，它们在他人心中激起了强烈的道德激情——而从未做出任何道德判断。它们的宣传效果正是通过用纯科学的术语来阐明这种揭露，从而避免了被怀疑具有道德目的。

One can now see that both branches of Marxism operate by denying to morality any intrinsic force of its own and that they yet both appeal in this very act to moral passions. In the first case we are presented with an analysis of bourgeois ideals in terms of immanent bourgeois interests, and because the hidden motivation of this analysis is a condemnation of capitalism, the analysis turns into an unmasking of bourgeois hypocrisy. Since this analysis of moral claims in terms of material interests applies quite generally, it might be thought to discredit also the moral motives of those who do the unmasking. But these motives are safe against unmasking, since they remain undeclared. Indeed, acting through the unmasking of bourgeois ideologies, they arouse powerful moral passions in others—without ever pronouncing any moral judgment. Their propagandistic effect is achieved precisely by enunciating the unmasking in purely scientific terms, which are thus immune against suspicion of a moralizing purpose.

当然，这些所谓的科学论断之所以被接受，仅仅是因为它们满足了某些道德激情。我们在此看到的是资产阶级意识形态理论与其背后隐藏的动机之间一种自我证实的回响。这就是我称之为“动力-客观”耦合的典型结构。所谓的科学论断，因其满足道德激情而被接受，会进一步激发这些激情，从而增强相关科学论断的说服力——如此循环往复，永无止境。此外，这种动力-客观的耦合在自身防御方面也具有强大的力量。任何对其科学部分的批评都会被其背后的道德激情所驳斥，而任何针对它的道德反对意见都会被其科学发现的无情裁决所冷漠地驳回。动力和客观这两个组成部分，在受到攻击时，会轮流转移人们对对方的注意力。

These supposedly scientific assertions are, of course, accepted only because they satisfy certain moral passions. We have here a self- confirmatory reverberation between the theory of bourgeois ideologies and the concealed motives which underlie it. This is the characteristic structure of what I shall call a dynamo-objective coupling. Alleged scientific assertions, which are accepted as such because they satisfy moral passions, will excite these passions further, and thus lend increased convincing power to the scientific affirmations in question—and so on, indefinitely. Moreover, such a dynamo-objective coupling is also potent in its own defence. Any criticism of its scientific part is rebutted by the moral passions behind it, while any moral objections to it are coldly brushed aside by invoking the inexorable verdict of its scientific findings. Each of the two components, the dynamic and the objective, takes it in turn to draw attention away from the other when it is under attack.

我们可以看到，这种结构也隐藏着马克思主义学术批评者所揭露的一个逻辑谬误，并解释了为何该谬误即便被揭露也依然存在。批评者认为，马克思关于资本主义必然被无产阶级毁灭的预言，不可能从中衍生出任何政治纲领。因为，为一场据说已经分出胜负的战斗招募战士是毫无意义的；而如果战斗尚未分出胜负，你就无法预测其结果。260但在动力与客观的结合中，反对用历史预测来呼吁为历史的必然结果而奋斗的逻辑理由已不复存在。因为，我们之所以接受这一预测，只是因为我们相信社会主义事业是正义的；而这意味着社会主义行动是正确的。因此，这一预测意味着行动的号召。

We can see that this structure underlies also a logical fallacy exposed by the academic critics of Marxism, and explains why the fallacy survives its exposure. The critics say that no political programme can be derived from the Marxian prediction of the inevitable destruction of Capitalism at the hands of the proletariat. For it is senseless to enlist fighters for a battle which is said to be already decided; while if the battle is not yet decided, you cannot predict its issue.260 But within a dynamo-objective coupling, the logical objection against using a historical prediction as an appeal to fight for the certain outcome of history no longer arises. For the prediction is accepted only because we believe that the Socialist cause is just; and this implies that Socialist action is right. The prediction implies therefore a call to action.

但这里还有更多需要补充。如果我们的不诚信感仅仅导致我们用似是而非的社会学的博学术语来掩盖我们对正义的渴望，那么这种伪装或许只是可怜的。不幸的是，道德激情在被包装成科学陈述时会发生致命的变化。我在说过任何针对马克思主义行动的道德反对意见都可以通过指出其“科学”正确性而被驳回时，已经暗示了这种变化。我们可以看到这里发生了什么：当社会主义的道德动机被转化为等同的科学论断时，它就脱离了其原有的道德语境。它变成了一种孤立的激情，无法被道德考量所触及。这就是狂热——一种执着于原始道德激情的物质等价物的狂热，也就是执着于“工人阶级的利益”，或者更准确地说，执着于那些被认为代表工人阶级利益的人的强制权力。这是一种狂热的权力崇拜。

But there is more to be added here. If our sense of bad faith merely caused us to disguise our thirst for righteousness in the erudite terms of a specious sociology, the masquerade would perhaps be merely pitiful. Unfortunately, moral passions undergo a fateful change when decked out as scientific statements. I have hinted at this change already when saying that any moral objection against Marxist action can be brushed aside by pointing to its ‘scientific’ correctness. We can see what has happened here: when transposed into equivalent scientific affirmations, the moral motive of Socialism was torn from its original moral context. It became an isolated passion, inaccessible to moral considerations. This is fanaticism—a fanaticism fixed upon the materialistic equivalents of the original moral passion, that is upon ‘the interests of the working class’ or, more precisely, upon the coercive powers of those who are held to represent the interests of the working class. It is a fanatical cult of power.

这不仅解释了现代极权主义蓄意肆无忌惮的本质，也解释了其宣称不择手段的决心在道德上的吸引力。因为这种决心被视为证明其权力体现了正义，因此它不承认任何比捍卫自身至高无上地位更高的义务，而它必须不惜一切代价捍卫这一至高无上的地位。以极权主义名义统治的人有权蔑视仁慈和诚实，这不仅仅是出于权宜之计（马基雅维利早已允许他们这样做），还因为他们在道德上比那些充满感情、虚伪和空洞无物、充满道德说教的对手更胜一筹。因此，那些轻蔑地否认所有道德动机真实性的怀疑论者，会狂热地支持赤裸裸的权力。

This explains not only the deliberate unscrupulousness of modern totalitarianism, but also the moral appeal of its declared resolve to act unscrupulously. For this resolve is taken to certify that its power embodies righteousness, and may therefore acknowledge no higher obligation than that of defending its own supremacy, which it must do at all costs. Those who rule in its name are entitled to scorn mercy and honesty, not simply for reasons of expediency (as Machiavelli would already have allowed them to do) but on account of their moral superiority over the emotionalism, hypocrisy, and general woolliness of their moralizing opponents. Thus sceptics who deny with contempt the reality of all moral motivations will rally fanatically to the moral support of naked power.

一旦被接受，马克思主义就消除了普遍主义道德主张与其对权力和利益的实际依赖之间永恒而危险的差异。马克思主义做到这一点，是通过否定道德作为道德的主张，而为其提供一种在特定政治力量中内在运作的形式。普遍性将由这种天生正义的力量通过其对世界的必然征服来实现。

Once accepted, Marxism eliminates the eternally menacing discrepancy between the universalist claims of morality and its actual dependence on power and profit. Marxism does so by denying to morality its claims qua morality, while offering it instead an immanent form of operation within a specified political force. Universality is to be achieved by this inherently righteous force through its inevitable conquest of the world.

由此可见，马克思主义被错误地指责为唯物主义：它的唯物主义是其道德目的的伪装。诚然，这些愿望被唯物主义的伪装所撕裂，脱离了其道德背景，并被利用来服务于物质扩张和政治暴力。但这并没有将社会主义的根本动力转化为对舒适的渴望。对社会事业的热情一直是共产主义政府情感上的辩护。因此，他们坚持不懈地为所有经​​济活动赋予崇高的道德意义；因此，他们变得狂妄自大，忽视民众最迫切的需求——例如，对更优厚住房的渴望——而热衷于华丽的摩天大楼和地下的大理石大厅；因此，他们整个古怪的经济体系都沉迷于生产，回避消费。我们西方人满怀希望地关注着苏联俄国每一个真正唯物主义的迹象。因为，如果这个政权曾经真正同意追求物质利益，它就会失去它的狂热；对舒适的热爱或许是不光彩的，但人们可以相信它会通情达理。

We see then that Marxism is falsely accused of materialism: its materialism is a disguise for its moral purpose. It is true that by their materialistic disguise these aspirations are torn out of their moral context, and are harnessed to the service of material aggrandizement and political violence. But this does not transform the underlying Socialist dynamics into a desire for comfort. The fervour of social enterprise has remained the emotional justification of Communist governments. Hence their persistent efforts to fill all economic activities with high moral significance; hence their gigantomania, their neglect of the most desperate popular needs—e.g. for better housing—in favour of ornate skyscrapers and underground marble halls; hence their whole curious economic system which revels in production and shies away from consumption. We in the West watch hopefully for every sign of true materialism in Soviet Russia. For if the regime once really consented to pursue material advantages, it would have lost its fanaticism; love of comfort may be ignoble, but one may trust it to be accommodating.

不道德的道德诉求在我们这个时代的其他群众运动中也发挥了作用。迈内克在泛日耳曼主义中发现了这种诉求的早期形式，而希特勒的崛起则以一种极其邪恶的方式彻底证实了这一诊断。希特勒从布尔什维克的榜样中获益良多，但他的运动主要根植于德国浪漫主义虚无主义。这种学说认为，杰出的个人是他自己的法律，作为政治家，他可以肆无忌惮地将自己的意志强加于世界其他国家；同样，一个国家也有权利和义务去实现其“历史命运”，而不论其是否承担道德义务。这种教条与道德的普遍主张相矛盾，正如马克思主义机械论的人性形象所言。它们将道德与个人或国家的自我实现等同起来，这种充满情感的功利主义能够将我们这个时代所有过度的社会希望与强烈的爱国主义结合在一起。因此，它最终能够将这两者体现在希特勒领导下的德国世界政府的目标中。

The moral appeal of immorality has been effective also in other mass movements of our time. Meinecke had detected an early form of it in PanGermanism, and Hitler’s rise has confirmed that diagnosis in a diabolically complete way. Hitler greatly profited from the Bolshevik example, but his movement was rooted primarily in German Romantic nihilism. This doctrine taught that an outstanding individual is a law unto himself and may, as a statesman, unscrupulously impose his will on the rest of the world, and that a nation has likewise the right and the duty to fulfil its ‘historic destiny’ irrespective of moral obligations. Such teachings contradict the universal claim of morality, just as the Marxist- mechanistic image of man does. They identify morality with the self- fulfilment of the individual or the nation, and this emotionally charged utilitarianism can unite with a fierce patriotism all the inordinate social hopes of our age. It was able eventually, therefore, to embody both in the aim of a German world government under Hitler.

希特勒纲领中蕴含着强烈的道德激情，这解释了它为何因其肆无忌惮而具有强大的道德号召力——例如对德国青年运动的许多成员而言。1每当狂热与犬儒主义相结合时，我们都必须怀疑其中存在着动力与客观的结合，而如果我们发现犬儒主义正在发出道德号召，则这种结合的存在就得到了证实。希特勒的狂热首先是邪恶的，但它对德国青年的号召力却是道德的：他们将邪恶行为视为道德责任。他们的反应与马克思对公共生活中道德动机本质的信念相同。他们认为，这些动机仅仅是权力的合理化，而只有权力才是真实的。因此，他们厌恶道德说教，却对不择手段的暴力行为抱有道德热情。

The immanence of great moral passions in Hitler’s programme explains the strong moral appeal which it made by its very unscrupulousness—for example to many members of the German Youth Movement.1 Whenever fanaticism combines with cynicism we must suspect a dynamo-objective coupling, and its presence is confirmed if we find that cynicism is making a moral appeal. Hitler’s frenzy was primarily evil, but its appeal to the German youth was moral: they accepted evil actions as a moral duty. Their response was determined by the same convictions which Marx had held about the nature of moral motives in public life. They believed that such motives were mere rationalizations of power, and that power alone was real. Hence their disgust of moralizing, and their moral passion for unscrupulous violence.

在几年前发表的一项尝试性研究中，我把这一原则称为“道德颠倒”。261当然，这种颠倒永远无法完全实现。任何政权，无论多么狂热，都无法在不接受任何公开的道德约束的情况下行事。我在描述赤裸裸的权力必然会通过说服来支持自身——同时也会限制自身——时已经提到了这一点。另一方面，人们可以认为，在每一次严厉的权力行使中，都存在着道德颠倒的因素。如果“棘手的案件会造就恶法”，那么似乎最好的政府也必然会偶尔犯下不公正的罪行。这的确没错，但偶尔对权宜之计的让步，并不会损害其所背离的道德原则——正如道德颠倒的原则不会仅仅因为偶尔对公开的道德做出让步而被否定一样。

In a tentative study published some years ago, I called this principle a ‘moral inversion’.261 Such inversion can, of course, never be completely realized. No regime, however fanatical, can act without accepting any overt moral restraints. I have referred to this already in describing the way naked power is bound to support—and at the same time to limit—itself by the exercise of persuasion. On the other hand, an element of moral inversion may be thought to be operating in every harsh exercise of power. If ‘hard cases make bad law’, then it would seem that the best government must occasionally commit injustices. This is true, but occasional concessions to expediency leave unimpaired the moral principles from which they deviate—just as the principles of moral inversion are not denied by the mere fact that occasional concessions are made to overt morality.

 

 

  1. 虚假的道德颠倒形式
  2. SPURIOUS FORMS OF MORAL INVERSION

我们还必须警惕，不要想当然地认为对道德动机的唯物主义解读必然会导致道德颠倒。事实远非如此。虚假的道德颠倒形式相当普遍。人们或许多年来一直在谈论实证主义、实用主义和自然主义的语言，却仍然尊重那些被他们的词汇焦虑地忽视的真理和道德原则。

We must guard also against assuming that a materialistic interpretation of moral motives must always result in moral inversion. Far from it. Spurious forms of moral inversion are quite common. Men may go on talking the language of positivism, pragmatism, and naturalism for many years, yet continue to respect the principles of truth and morality which their vocabulary anxiously ignores.

以弗洛伊德的文本为例，他根据心理学来解释文化。262最后他强调地写道：“只有这一点我可以肯定，那就是人类的价值判断完全受其对幸福的渴望所引导，因此仅仅是试图通过论据来支持他们的幻想。”263但在同一篇文章的开头，他表达了对罗曼·罗兰的深深敬意，因为他摒弃了那些追求权力、成功和财富的人普遍采用的错误标准，他们羡慕别人的这些成就，却未能体会到生活的真正价值；264他又一次宣称自己崇尚一种慷慨的社会理想，即“大家为了大家的幸福而共同努力”。265

Take for example the text of Freud, in which he interprets culture in the light of his psychology.262 Towards the end he writes emphatically: This alone I know with certainty, namely that man’s value judgments are guided absolutely by their desire for happiness, and are therefore merely an attempt to bolster up their illusions by arguments.’263 But at the opening of the same essay he had expressed his deep respect for Romain Rolland, for spurning the false standards commonly applied by men who seek power, success and wealth, and who admire these achievements in others, while they fail to appreciate the true values of life;264 and again at another point he had declared himself for the ideal of a generous society in which ‘all work together for the happiness of all’.265

我们可以看到，动力与客观的结合在此与马克思主义的运作方式如出一辙。功利主义的道德诠释指责所有道德情感都是虚伪的，而作者如此表达的道德义愤却被安全地伪装成科学论断。而在其他场合，这些隐藏的道德激情又会再次出现，要么以对社会异见者的冷嘲式赞扬来间接肯定伦理理想，要么以功利主义的名义进行伪装。

We can see the dynamo-objective coupling operating here on the same lines as in Marxism. A utilitarian interpretation of morality accuses all moral sentiments of hypocrisy, while the moral indignation which the writer thus expresses is safely disguised as a scientific statement. And on other occasions, these concealed moral passions reassert themselves, affirming ethical ideals either backhandedly as a tight-lipped praise of social dissenters, or else disguised in utilitarian terms.

批判性思维在与道德相遇时，这种搪塞之语可以追溯到古代。修昔底德无意中记录了雅典人如何时而宣称神与人只有一条法则，那就是“尽己所能，统治一切”；时而嘲笑斯巴达人的虚伪，斯巴达人同样追求自身利益，却披着正义与荣誉的外衣——而后又将通往安全的私利之路与充满危险的正义与荣誉之路进行了鲜明对比。伟大的雅典人可怜地摸索着具体的术语，对雅典伟大的热爱最终（在葬礼演说中）落到了吹嘘其无与伦比的事业规模上。

This prevarication of the critical mind in its encounter with morality can be traced back to antiquity. Thucydides records unwittingly how the Athenians at one moment affirm that there is only one law of God and man which is ‘to rule wherever one can’; how they sneer at the hypocrisy of the Spartans who likewise pursue their self-interest, but cloak it with the mantle of justice and honour—while at the next moment the same Athenians draw a sharp contrast between the path of self-interest which leads to safety, and the path of justice and honour which involves danger. Pitifully groping for tangible terms, the great Athenian’s love of Athens’ greatness falls back (in the Funeral Oration) on vaunting the unrivalled size of its enterprises.

自十八世纪以来，我们再次看到许多顽固的功利主义者高尚地维护着他们逻辑上无法解释的道德信念——但直到二十世纪，这种内在矛盾才渗透到大众思想中。如今，我们的道德判断普遍缺乏理论支撑。它们或许会伪装成“侵略性”或“竞争性”或“社会稳定”等社会学，并以此为幌子，鼓吹人与人之间应更加友善、慷慨、宽容和友爱。公众被社会学家教导怀疑其传统道德，如今却欣然接受他以科学的包装重新包装传统道德。事实上，一位通过否定道德的存在来证明其冷静洞察力的作家，即使不顾道德的存在，当他进行道德说教时，总会受到格外的尊重。因此，我们道德愿望的科学伪装不仅可以保护其本质免遭虚无主义的毁灭，甚至还能使其在潜移默化中有效运作。这正是边沁和杜威等伟大的改革家能够将其功利主义运用于道德目的的原因。

Since the eighteenth century we have again seen many hardened utilitarians nobly upholding their logically unaccountable moral convictions—but only in the twentieth century has popular thought been permeated by this internal contradiction. Today our moral judgments are quite generally without theoretical protection. They may disguise themselves as a sociology of ‘aggressiveness’ or ‘competitiveness’ or of ‘social stability’, etc., and may advocate in these terms more kindness, generosity, tolerance, and brotherhood among men. The public, taught by the sociologist to distrust its traditional morality, is grateful to receive it back from him in a scientifically branded wrapping. Indeed, a writer who has proved his hard-headed perspicacity by denying the existence of morality will always be listened to with especial respect when he does moralize in spite of this. Thus the scientific disguise of our moral aspirations may not only protect their substance against destruction by nihilism, but even allow them to operate effectively by stealth. This is how great reformers like Bentham or Dewey have been able to use their utilitarianism for moral purposes.

承认道德倒错的存在，就等于承认道德力量是人类的主要动机；就等于否认“升华”是文化创造的基础（正如弗洛伊德所认为的那样）。当然，道德力量是由教育引出和塑造的，就像人的智力或艺术天赋是由教育激发的一样。但这并不意味着道德仅仅是对自身利益的合理化，也不意味着科学是性好奇心的“升华”。相反，弗洛伊德式的道德解读本身就是一种虚假的道德倒错。它构成了对现代语言的清洗，用客观主义的——最好是欲望性的——术语取代了坦率的道德术语。

To recognize the existence of moral inversion is to acknowledge moral forces as primary motives of man; it is to deny that ‘sublimation’ underlies (as Freud thought) the creation of culture. Of course, moral forces are elicited and shaped by education, even as man’s intelligence or artistic talent is evoked by education. But this does not imply that morality is a mere rationalization of self-interest, or that science is a ‘sublimation’ of sexual curiosity. On the contrary, the Freudian interpretation of morality is itself but a spurious form of moral inversion. It forms part of the expurgation of modern language which substitutes objectivist—and preferably appetitive—terms for candidly moral ones.

但指望人们会无限期地在否定现实的思想体系中追求其道德理想，却是危险的。这并非因为他们可能会失去理想——这种情况很少见，通常也不会造成严重的公共后果——而是因为他们可能会陷入逻辑上更稳定的道德彻底颠倒状态。客观主义的伪装只有在其所支撑的道德信念（其内在的不稳定性）保持相对和平的情况下才能持续下去。社会生活中道德诉求的强烈涌现，例如十八世纪末兴起并席卷全球的那种，必须寻求一种更有力的表达方式。当它被注入功利主义的框架时，它自身和这个框架都会发生改变。它变成了暴力机器的狂热力量。道德颠倒就是这样完成的：伪装成野兽的人变成了牛头怪。

But it is dangerous to rely on it that men will continue indefinitely to pursue their moral ideals within a system of thought which denies reality to them. Not because they might lose their ideals—which is rare, and usually without serious public consequence—but because they might slip into the logically stabler state of complete moral inversion. For the objectivist masquerade can go on only so long as the moral convictions whose internal instability it bolsters up, remain comparatively peaceable. A great upsurge of moral demands on social life, such as arose at the end of the eighteenth century and has since flooded the whole world, must seek a more forcible expression. When injected into a utilitarian framework it transmutes both itself and this framework. It turns into the fanatical force of a machinery of violence. This is how moral inversion is completed: man masked as a beast turns into a Minotaur.

 

 

  1. 知识分子的诱惑
  2. THE TEMPTATION OF THE INTELLECTUALS

公开蔑视道德顾虑的道德诉求在此被解释为一种道德颠倒。类似的解释可以解决另一个悖论：斯大林政权受到西方杰出作家和画家的赞扬，而他们的作品却遭到该政权的谴责和压制。事实上——正如切斯瓦夫·米沃什所表明的——它的吸引力实际上部分源于其公开宣称的对现代艺术和文学的厌恶，以及其使所有文化活动都服从于国家的决心。米沃什根据自己在波兰的经历记录道，这些情绪和政策构成了马克思主义对波兰知识分子的诱惑的一部分。266

The moral appeal of a declared contempt for moral scruples is explained here in terms of a moral inversion. An analogous explanation will resolve yet another paradox: the fact that Stalin’s regime was acclaimed by eminent Western writers and painters whose very works were condemned and suppressed by that regime. And indeed—as Czeslaw Milosz has shown—its appeal was actually due in part to its proclaimed disgust with modern art and literature, and to its determination to make all cultural pursuits subservient to the state. Milosz records from his own experience in Poland that these sentiments and policies formed part of the temptation offered by Marxism to the Polish intellectuals.266

要理解这一点，首先必须考虑到，揭露与灌输——马克思主义的消极和积极运作——可以应用于从资本主义向社会主义过渡过程中的每一种思想形式。正如资产阶级的自由民主理想被揭露，而政党专政却被赋予了本质上自由和民主的特质一样，资产阶级的艺术和文学也被揭露，而对社会主义的颂扬则被赋予了艺术和文学的价值。所有文化生活都经历了类似的转变，使其完全屈服于社会主义国家的利益，由其绝对统治者随意支配。这一过程符合颠倒的逻辑。但这一事实并不能完全解释为什么这种颠倒吸引了自由国家中相当数量的知识分子，去追求极权主义所抹黑和压制的职业。

To understand this we must consider, first, that unmasking and impregnating—the negative and positive operations of Marxism—can be applied to every form of thought in the transition from Capitalism to Socialism. Just as the bourgeois ideals of freedom and democracy are unmasked, while a party-dictatorship is endowed instead with the quality of being intrinsically free and democratic, so also bourgeois art and literature are unmasked, and the glorification of Socialism is endowed instead with the values of art and literature. All cultural life is subjected to a similar transformation, which surrenders it totally to the interests of the Socialist state at the discretion of its absolute rulers. This process accords with the logic of inversion. But this fact does not explain altogether why such an inversion has appealed to a notable number of intellectuals in free countries, pursuing vocations which totalitarianism discredits and suppresses.

“揭露”一词为这一谜题提供了第一条线索。在十九世纪，社会主义并非唯一反抗资产阶级统治的势力，科学主义也并非攻击资产阶级理想的唯一武器。与此同时，知识分子普遍的疏离感也随之而来。浪漫主义运动和科学运动的共同作用催生了一种现代文化虚无主义，它像马克思主义一样全面地批判现存社会。这种文化虚无主义的出现，源于现代人过高的道德期望因人性中常见的自满、自私和虚伪而落空，而这些缺陷被解释为人们只有在无法逃避时才会遵守的东西。再次强调——正如马克思主义所言——道德虚无主义在此是异常强烈的道德激情的标志。屠格涅夫在学生巴扎罗夫身上刻画了这种文化虚无主义，他是哲学虚无主义的文学原型。

A first clue to this enigma is suggested by the word ‘unmasking’. Socialism was not alone in rebelling against bourgeois domination in the nineteenth century, nor was scientism the only weapon for attacking bourgeois ideals. Allied to these was a general alienation of the intellectuals. The joint effects of the romantic and scientific movements engendered a modern cultural nihilism which repudiated the existing society as comprehensively as Marxism did. This happened when the excessive moral aspirations of modern man were disappointed by the normal complacency, selfishness and hypocrisy of man, and these shortcomings were accounted for by interpreting morality as something which people obey only if they cannot evade it. Once more—as in Marxism—moral nihilism is the mark here of exceptionally strong moral passions. Turgenev portrayed this in the student Bazarov, the literary archetype of philosophic nihilism.

尽管哲学虚无主义者是激进的个人主义者，但他们自然倾向于同情那些旨在彻底摧毁社会的革命运动。即便如此，他们中的许多人竟然会狂热地支持那些敌视他们知识分子职业的极权政府，这一事实仍有待解释。只有在当时的历史背景下才能理解。

Though philosophic nihilists were radical individualists, they naturally tended to sympathize with revolutionary movements aiming at the total destruction of society. Even so, the fact that many of them would go so far as to give their fervent support to totalitarian governments hostile to their own vocation as intellectuals, still remains to be explained. It can be understood only in its historical setting.

我们必须承认，一个世纪以来，个人虚无主义一直激励着文学和哲学，它不仅自身存在，也引发了人们对自身的反抗。自十九世纪中叶以来，对资产阶级社会的厌恶、反抗性的不道德主义和绝望，一直是欧洲大陆伟大小说、诗歌和哲学作品的主流主题。反庸俗主义孕育了现代波西米亚人，也激发了他们强烈的原创力，使美术焕然一新，涌现出大量前所未见的杰作。

We must acknowledge that personal nihilism has served for a century as an inspiration to literature and philosophy, both by itself and by provoking a reaction to itself. A loathing of bourgeois society, a rebellious immoralism and despair, have been prevailing themes of great fiction, poetry and philosophy on the continent of Europe since the middle of the nineteenth century. Anti-philistinism, which bred the modern bohemian, has also stimulated in him a fierce originality which has renewed the fine arts by a profusion of masterpieces unsurpassed in any previous period of history.

但这些胜利却让作者们因自我怀疑而感到羞愧。他们对既有文化的憎恨（就像在马克思主义中一样）蔓延成对人的地位和人类思想本身的攻击。培尔·金特在虚伪的朝圣之旅结束时，认出自己就像一颗洋葱：一层又一层的自我戏剧化叶子被剥去，核心空空如也。资产阶级百科全书家布瓦尔和佩居歇迷失在空洞的迷宫中。穆齐尔的“无产者”已不复存在，因为他思考的是生活，而不是生活。“思想，思想，关于思想，关于思想关于思想的思想”这种徒劳的倒退​​，耗尽了萨特在《理性时代》中塑造的马蒂厄；然而，像加缪笔下的“局外人”一样，一个完全不加思考的人也同样与现实隔绝，被囚禁在自己的私人世界中。《恶心》中所有意义的毁灭是这一进程的最终点。

But these triumphs left their authors mortified by self-doubt. Their hatred of the established culture had spread (as in Marxism) into an attack on the very status of man and of human thought. Peer Gynt, at the end of his pilgrimage of pretences, recognizes himself in the image of an onion: leaf after leaf of self-dramatization is peeled off, leaving nothing at the core. The bourgeois encyclopaedists Bouvard and Pécuchet lose themselves in a labyrinth of inanities. Musil’s ‘Man Without Properties’ has ceased to be, for he thinks about life instead of living it. The futile regress of ‘thoughts, thoughts, about thoughts, thoughts about thoughts about thoughts’ exhausts Sartre’s Mathieu in L’Age de Raison; yet a totally unreflecting man like the ‘Stranger’ of Camus is equally cut off from reality, imprisoned in his private world. The destruction of all meaning in La Nausée is the ultimate point of this progression.

如此一来，我们便无法再真诚地表达任何言辞，所有理性的行动都沦为毫无生气的平庸之作；唯有暴力尚且诚实，但唯有无端的暴力才是真正的行动。现代知识分子一旦抵达这一阶段，便会将自己也卷入对其时代道德和文化虚妄的令人作呕的蔑视之中。他已将宇宙彻底置于无意义的境地，自身也消融于宇宙的荒原之中。

We can then no longer say anything in good faith, and all rational action becomes a lifeless banality; violence alone is still honest, but only gratuitous violence is authentic action. Having arrived at this stage, the modern intellectual will include himself in his nauseated contempt for the moral and cultural futility of his time. Having rendered the universe utterly meaningless, he himself dissolves in a universal wasteland.

如果知识分子如今遭到马克思主义揭露者的侧翼攻击，并被他们与资产阶级混为一谈，那么他的处境将岌岌可危。他日益意识到自己生活在精神荒漠之中，这正呼应了马克思主义者对其自身艺术和科学的分析，认为它们不过是卑鄙资本主义的上层建筑。此外，任何对这种攻击的抵抗都可能证明其正当性，迫使他与资产阶级合作，并有可能剥夺他赖以自尊的反资产阶级地位。这种困境本身就足以解释萨特、毕加索和贝尔纳尔等人为何屈服于一种否定其知识追求的哲学；更何况——在他们自己的资产阶级政府的保护下——他们还能欣然地继续从事这些追求。

If the intellectual is now attacked from the flank by Marxist unmaskers, who will lump him together with the bourgeoisie, his position is very precarious. His own growing consciousness of living in a spiritual desert tends to re-echo the Marxian analysis of his own art and science as mere super-structures of a contemptible Capitalism. Moreover, any resistance to this attack would tend to prove its justice by forcing him into partnership with the bourgeoisie, and it would also threaten to deprive him of that anti-bourgeois status on which his self-respect is founded. This dilemma suffices by itself to account for the surrender of men like Sartre, Picasso and Bernal, to a philosophy which denied the very existence of their intellectual pursuits; the more so, since—under the protection of their own bourgeois governments—they could happily continue to cultivate these pursuits for the time being.

转折点就在这里。哲学虚无主义者隐秘的道德激情，如果能够基于虚无主义的假设，就始终可以用于政治行动。他可以安全地放纵自己的道德激情，接受一股不择手段的革命力量的内在正义性。被注入暴力的引擎后，他的人道主义抱负终于可以得到扩展，不再有自我怀疑的危险，他的整个人也欣然回应着如此坚韧的公民家园。最终，他参与其中，他安全了。

And here we reach the turning point. The philosophic nihilist’s hidden moral passions are always available for political action if this can be based on nihilistic assumptions. He can safely indulge his moral passions by accepting the intrinsic righteousness of an unscrupulous revolutionary power. Injected into the engines of violence, his humane aspirations can at last expand without danger of self-doubt and his whole person responds joyfully to a civic home of such acid-proof quality. At last, he is engaged, he is safe.

诚然，艺术家或科学家仍然难以接受共产主义独裁统治下那些沉闷的文化目标，将其视为自身使命的真正实现。然而，他或许会试图克服这种厌恶，理由并非完全站不住脚。因为他因此摆脱了属于“腐朽社会垂死文化”的束缚，或者摆脱了不属于任何社会的束缚。他或许还会觉得，在共产主义社会中扮演从属角色只能是暂时的。因为最终，历史必然性的胜利必然会满足精神和肉体的需求；即便在此期间，他通常也只需偶尔在口头上支持官方文化政策即可。

Admittedly, the artist or scientist will still find it difficult to accept the dreary cultural aims of a Communist dictatorship as the true fulfilments of his vocation. Yet he may try to overcome his revulsion for reasons that are not altogether base. For he is relieved thereby from belonging to ‘the dying culture of a rotten society’ or from not belonging to any society. He may also feel that a subservient role in a Communist society can be only temporary. For ultimately, the triumph of Historic Necessity must fulfil the needs of the mind as those of the body; and even in the meantime, often no more is demanded of him than an occasional lipservice to the official cultural policy.

此外，用内在于历史必然性的客观正确性来取代艺术家自己设定的标准，这种诱惑力极大。这种正确性似乎是不证自明的。因为在动力与客观的结合中，一种力量仅凭其胜利的事实就能证明其历史必然性，而这种力量所规定的文化标准必然显得与生俱来就是正确的。只有打破整个共产主义世界赖以建立的根本动力与客观的结合，才能质疑其教义。因此，这些教义为知识分子对客观标准的渴望提供了一个坚实的框架，使其免于自我怀疑。267

Besides, the temptation is great to replace the standards which the artist has set himself, by an objective rightness immanent in historic necessity. Such rightness will appear self-evident. For within a dynamo-objective coupling, a power may prove its historic necessity by the mere fact of its victory, and a cultural standard ordained by such a power must appear inherently right. Its teachings could be doubted only by breaking up the fundamental dynamo-objective coupling on which the whole Communist universe rests. These teachings, therefore, offer a firm framework to the intellectual’s yearning for objective standards safe against self-doubt.267

 

 

  1. 马克思列宁主义认识论
  2. MARXIST-LENINIST EPISTEMOLOGY

自公元前五世纪希腊哲学兴起以来，人们一直在思考系统地质疑自身信仰的可能性。马克思主义是一个相对稳定的体系，道德追求可以免于自我怀疑，但代价是将其固定在对某些物质目标的追求上。但类似的执着似乎对艺术热情的运作不太奏效。斯大林统治下的苏联人民虽然不缺乏道德使命感，但他们对官方的艺术产品感到厌倦。而试图将对真理的探索与苏联共产主义的进步联系起来，遭遇了更大的困难。这其中有很多原因。

Since the rise of Greek philosophy in the fifth century B.C., men have been considering the possibility of systematically doubting what they believed in. Marxism is a relatively stable structure in which moral aspirations can be saved from self-doubt at the price of fixing them to the pursuit of a certain set of material ends. But a similar fixation seems to operate less successfully for artistic passions. While the people of the Soviet Union under Stalin did not lack a sense of moral purpose, they were bored with the official artistic products. And the attempt to identify the search for truth with the advancement of Soviet Communism has met with even greater difficulties. This had many reasons.

尽管休谟的怀疑主义及其前身可以追溯到古代皮浪主义，但在二十世纪的现代自由社会中，科学家们却没有自我怀疑。相反，对科学的信仰至高无上，成为唯一几乎未受挑战的信念。事实上，根据自孔德以来广为传播的实证主义观点，所有人类思想都被视为谦卑地追求科学的完美，而对马克思和恩格斯来说，自然科学是客观真理的原型：对他们来说，科学绝对不是一种现在就被揭穿，后来又被等同于社会主义胜利的意识形态。但是，一旦道德激情的基本动力与客观性的结合牢固确立，它不可避免地会扩展到科学，就像扩展到艺术追求一样。新马克思主义科学理论在1930年左右首次兴起，并在随后的十年内成为斯大林领导下的苏联的官方学说。起初，它仅限于重新诠释科学史，表明科学进步的每一步都是出于实际需要。宣称纯科学具有独立地位，被嘲笑为势利。268随后，随着科学被揭露为技术的本质，随之而来的是技术被美化为科学。由于技术能够实现物质福利，它被接受为进步和社会主义本身的一部分；因此，对科学的追求最终体现在社会主义的进步中。

In spite of Hume’s scepticism and its antecedents, going back to ancient Pyrrhonism, there was no self-doubt among scientists in the modern free societies of the twentieth century. On the contrary, belief in science stood supreme as the only belief that remained practically unchallenged. Indeed, according to the positivist view widely disseminated since Comte, all human thought was seen engaged in a humble pilgrimage towards scientific perfection, and to Marx and Engels natural science was the archetype of objective truth: to them science was definitely not an ideology to be unmasked now, and to be later identified with the victory of Socialism. But once the fundamental dynamo- objective coupling is firmly established for moral passions, it inevitably tends to become extended to science on the same lines as to artistic pursuits. The neo-Marxian theory of science first rose to importance around 1930 and became within the subsequent decade the official doctrine of the U.S.S.R. under Stalin. At first it was limited to re- interpreting the history of science, showing that each step in its progress occurred in response to practical needs. To claim independent status for pure science was ridiculed as mere snobbery.268 Then, from the unmasking of science as being really technology, there followed the glorification of technology as being really science. And since technology achieves material welfare, it was accepted as part of progress and of Socialism itself; so that the pursuit of science became at last embodied in the advancement of Socialism.

到目前为止，这还只是些无伤大雅的胡言乱语。但很快，揭露真相的行动就愈发激烈。起初，人们零星地批评“资产阶级科学”在相对论、量子力学、天文学、心理学等领域的现代发展，最终发展成反对孟德尔遗传学的运动。1948年8月，李先科得意洋洋地向科学院宣布，他的生物学观点已获共产党中央委员会批准，党员们一致起立欢呼，新的立场才最终确立。

So far this was harmless nonsense. But soon unmasking became more virulent. It began with scattered sniping at the more modern developments of ‘bourgeois science’, in relativity, quantum mechanics, astronomy, psychology, and it culminated in the campaign against Mendelism. The new position was finally established when in August, 1948 Lysenko triumphantly announced to the Academy of Science that his biological views had been approved by the Central Committee of the Communist Party and members rose as one man to acclaim this decision.

科学的普遍性如今被彻底否定。资产阶级科学自称具有普遍有效性的主张被揭露为欺骗性的意识形态，而苏联科学则被要求坦率地依赖其党派性或阶级性。由于马克思主义的双重机制，“一切科学都是阶级科学”这一学说，既抹黑了资产阶级科学，又认可了社会主义科学。此外，在为党服务的过程中，科学以一种新的意义恢复了对普遍性的主张：真理的普遍性被未来共产主义世界政府的固有正义性、因而也是历史必然性的胜利所取代。

The universality of science was now definitely repudiated. The claims of bourgeois science to universal validity were unmasked as deceptive ideology, while Soviet Science was directed to rely frankly on its partisan or class character. Owing to the dual mechanism of Marxism, the doctrine that all science is class science served simultaneously both to discredit bourgeois science and to accredit socialist science. Moreover, in serving the Party, science recovers—in a new sense—a claim to universality: the universality of truth is replaced by the inherently righteous and therefore historically inevitable victory of a future Communist world-government.

在这种认可苏联科学的方法中，“客观性”和“党派性”的双重含义是自洽的。资产阶级科学所宣称的客观性和普遍有效性，被揭露为虚假的借口，理由是任何对科学、历史或哲学的断言都不可能客观，实际上它们始终是党派的武器。与此同时，马克思主义声称已经将政治变成了一门科学，它使一切政治行动都建立在对其所处社会条件的严格客观评估之上，而揭露资产阶级客观性的党派性本身就是这种马克思主义客观性的一个例子。但这种客观性并不声称具有普遍性，因为如果它声称——例如——资产阶级可以被说服接受它是客观的，那就自相矛盾了。因此，马克思主义声称自己是客观的，只是在它是无产阶级党派性武器的意义上。 “客观性”和“党派性”本身无所谓对错，只有社会主义是正确的（即正在崛起），而资本主义是错误的（即正在衰落）。斯大林政权要求苏联学者摒弃客观性（即普遍有效性的客观性），转而以社会主义党派性为指导，这与马克思主义者自身对客观性的主张完全一致。269

The dual meanings of ‘objectivity’ and ‘partisanship’ in this method of accrediting Soviet science are self-consistent. The claims of bourgeois science to objectivity and universal validity are unmasked as false pretences on the grounds that no affirmation of science, history, or philosophy can be objective and that in reality they are always partisan weapons. At the same time, Marxism claims to have made politics into a science that bases every political action on a strictly objective assessment of the social conditions in which it has to operate, and the unmasking of bourgeois objectivity as partisan is itself an example of this Marxist objectivity. But such objectivity does not claim universality, for it would contradict itself if it claimed—for example—that the bourgeoisie could be persuaded to accept it as objective. Marxism claims for itself therefore to be objective only in the sense of being a weapon of proletarian partisanship. Neither ‘objectivity’ nor ‘partisanship’ is either right or wrong, it is only Socialism that is right (i.e. rising) and Capitalism that is wrong (i.e. decaying). The demand made by Stalin’s regime on Soviet scholars to eschew objectivity (in the sense of universal validity) and to be guided instead by Socialist partisanship, is therefore quite consistent with the Marxist’s own claims to objectivity.269

严格应用这种知识理论会压制自然科学，除了纯科学与技术重叠的狭窄领域。我之前曾更笼统地讨论过拉普拉斯纲领的这一结果。现在我们可以看到，客观主义人观所导致的激进功利主义本身并不能产生这种结果。因为它的逻辑常常被仁慈地悬置着。只有当旨在彻底改变社会的伟大道德抱负被注入到机械论的人性观中时，才会产生推动这一逻辑实现的动力引擎。即便如此，这种尝试也可能徒劳无功：科学家的智识激情可能会成功反抗，并将极权主义对科学思想的影响降低到其正确标准的文字伪装。事实上，即使在生物学领域，在苏联，只需简短地念叨几句马克思主义的词句，通常就足以确保一篇科学论文的实质内容不受马克思主义教义的影响。

The strict application of this theory of knowledge would suppress natural science, with the exception of the narrow area in which pure science overlaps with technology. I have spoken of this outcome of the Laplacean programme in more general terms before. We can see now that the radical utilitarianism resulting from an objectivist view of man does not produce this result by itself. For its logic often remains mercifully suspended. Only when great moral aspirations, aiming at the radical transformation of society, are injected into the mechanistic idea of man, are engines of power engendered which press for the fulfilment of this logic. Even so, the attempt may remain abortive: the intellectual passions of scientists may rebel successfully, and reduce the effects of totalitarianism over scientific thought to a verbal disguise of its proper standards. In fact,—even in biology—a brief incantation of Marxist phrases has usually sufficed to secure immunity from Marxist doctrine for the substance of a scientific paper in Soviet Russia.

 

 

  1. 事实问题
  2. MATTERS OF FACT

我们现在看到，在我之前的文字中，我自信地谈到科学和艺术构成我们文化的一部分，以及法律和道德维护正义和体面，但我一直在回避一些关键问题。我指的是“资产阶级”科学、“资产阶级”艺术，以及一般意义上的“资产阶级”文化、法律、道德、正义等等。马克思主义-斯大林主义的批评家们并不承认这些是真正的科学、艺术、文化、法律、道德、正义等等，反而谴责它们是腐败的、客观主义的、唯心主义的、世界主义的、形式主义的或不民主的。他们否定了我在谈论科学、艺术、文化、法律和道德时所奉为理所当然的整套标准，并将维护这些我同意分享的标准的智识和道德激情贬低为一种虚幻的主观性。在批判性反思的光照下，这些标准的不稳定性对他们来说并非焦虑之源，而是胜利的满足。这种不稳定的最终结果，在我看来，是人类心灵的最终自我毁灭，而对他们来说，则无异于最终揭穿我理想主义的谎言。在一个以辩证唯物主义为基础的社会里，以最高权力为核心的强制力量，实际上成为了有效评价的推动者。因此，如果标准被视为由武力维护，这不再使它们显得可疑，反而会给它们打上真实性的烙印。

We see now that throughout my previous text, in which I spoke confidently of such things as science and art as forming part of our culture, and of law and morality preserving justice and decency, I have been begging some decisive questions. I was referring to ‘bourgeois’ science, ‘bourgeois’ art, and generally ‘bourgeois’ culture, law, morality, justice, etc., which are not acknowledged as genuine science, art, culture, law, morality, justice, etc. by their Marxist-Stalinist critics, but are condemned by them as corrupt, objectivist, idealist, cosmopolitan, formalist or undemocratic. They deny the whole set of standards which I took for granted when speaking of science, art, culture, law and morality, and reduce the intellectual and moral passions upholding these standards, which I have agreed to share, to the status of an illusory subjectivity. The instability of these standards in the light of critical reflection is to them no source of anxiety but of triumphant satisfaction. The consummation of this instability, which looms to me as the final self-destruction of the human mind, would be to them but the final unmasking of my idealistic deceptions. Within a society based on Dialectical Materialism, the forces of coercion, anchored to the centre of a supreme power, become in fact the agents of valid appreciation. If, then, standards are seen to be upheld by force, this no longer makes them appear questionable but marks them instead with the stamp of authenticity.

这种思维颠倒的过程远不止于此。它不可避免地会破坏事实的概念——即普通事实。请记住，我们绝大多数的事实信念都是通过信任他人而间接获得的；而且，在大多数情况下，我们的信任寄托在某些人的权威之上，他们要么凭借公职，要么是我们选定的知识领袖。在自由社会中，科学领域之外的公共事实的确立则委托给报纸、议会和法院。他们的事实调查与社会学家、历史学家和科学家的事实调查相辅相成，并受到整个社会的强烈推定，即使总有一些可疑的案例，在这些案例中，竞争对手的论断会争夺公众的认可。与科学领域一样，这种共享信念体系依赖于一系列重叠的领域，在每个领域中，少数权威人士可以相互监督彼此的完整性及其对重要事物的认知。可以说，加入这种相互信任网络的社会维持了一定的“事实性”标准——只要人们接受其事实调查方法。 270

Nor does this process of mental inversion stop here altogether. It inevitably undermines the very conception of facts—of ordinary matters of fact. Remember that the overwhelming part of our factual beliefs are held at second hand through trusting others; and that in the great majority of cases our trust is placed in the authority of certain persons, either by virtue of their public office or as our chosen intellectual leaders. The establishment of public facts outside science is entrusted, in free societies, to newspapers, parliaments, and law courts. Their fact-finding is continuous with that of sociologists, historians, and scientists, and is granted strong presumptive credit also by the whole of society, even though there are always dubious cases in which rival affirmation will compete for public acceptance. As in science, this system of shared beliefs relies on a chain of overlapping areas, within each of which a few authoritative persons can keep watch over each other’s integrity and their sense of what is important. A society affiliated to such a network of mutual confidence may be said to maintain a certain standard of ‘factuality’—provided that one accepts its methods of fact-finding.270

当然，我们知道，即使人们对事物本质的理解在其他方面一致，在某些事实的真实性方面也可能存在根本分歧。在一场重大的科学争论中，双方的对立面并不认为同样的事实是真实且重要的。一个相信魔法、巫术和神谕的社会，会认同一整套现代人视为虚构的事实体系。在欧洲历史的不同时期，盛行的事实性标准之间也可能存在类似的逻辑差距。但在此，我只想探讨当代政治动态对事实认定的影响。

We know, of course, that even people whose conceptions of the nature of things otherwise coincide, may be fundamentally divided in respect to the reality of certain facts. Antagonists on either side of a great scientific controversy do not accept the same facts as real and significant. A society believing in magic, witchcraft and oracles, will agree on a whole system of facts which modern men regard as fictitious. Similar logical gaps could be found between standards of factuality prevailing in different periods of European history. But I will keep here to the effects of contemporary political dynamics on the accrediting of matters of fact.

自由社会赖以达成事实共识的广泛互信网络，本身就脆弱不堪。任何导致民众严重分裂的冲突，都倾向于摧毁他们的互信，并使就冲突相关事实达成普遍共识变得困难。在法国，第三共和国因一个事实问题而动摇了根基：德雷福斯上尉是否撰写了“边界线”（bordereau）。在英国，关于“季诺维也夫信”真实性的争议，以及在美国对阿尔杰·希斯的审判，都引发了民众冲突，使得就这些事实达成普遍共识变得不可能。

The widely extended network of mutual trust, on which the factual consensus of a free society depends, is fragile. Any conflict which sharply divides people will tend to destroy their mutual trust and make universal agreement on facts bearing on the conflict difficult to achieve. In France the Third Republic was shaken to its foundations by a question of fact: the question whether Captain Dreyfus had written the ‘bordereau’. In Britain the dispute over the genuineness of the ‘Zinoviev Letter’, as in the U.S. the trial of Alger Hiss, aroused popular conflicts which made it impossible to agree universally on the facts of these matters.

当然，这种暂时和部分缺乏事实依据的情况，可以理解为政治激情的过度冲动。但在极权主义下，我们可以看到事实依据被贬低到允许国家几乎随心所欲地捏造公共事实的程度，因为这符合其自身利益。这种传播谎言的权力，在某种程度上仅仅源于政府以恐怖手段为后盾，垄断了公共言论；但这种强制手段并不能解释这些谎言在国外的传播。任何对这些事实的自愿接受，都证明了它们本身具有说服力，而且必须假定，这种说服力在被胁迫的地区也能有效地传播。这表明事实证据的原则本身已经腐化，涉及事实调查过程中通常所依据的假设的全面转变。只有当我们的现实感已经被这种转变严重削弱时，我们才会容易接受彻头彻尾的拙劣伪造。

Such temporary and partial failures of factuality may of course be excused as passing excesses of political passion. But under totalitarianism we can see factuality reduced to the extent of allowing the State to fashion public facts almost at will, as it suits its own interests. These powers to spread falsehoods are due to some extent simply to the government’s monopoly of public utterances, backed by terror; but such coercive powers do not account for the currency gained by these falsehoods abroad. Any willing acceptance of these facts is evidence of a persuasiveness of their own, which must be assumed to be effective also in gaining currency for them within the territories under coercion. This indicates a corruption of the very principles of factual evidence, involving a wholesale shift of the usual presumptions which underlie the process of fact-finding. It is only when our sense of reality has already been gravely impaired by such a shift, that we become receptive to downright clumsy falsifications.

一个致力于彻底革新社会的现代革命政府，必然会通过断绝与反对者的一切联系来引发这种变革。任何不无条件支持其的人，都被视为其死敌。独裁统治由此创造了一种局面，任何持不同政见者实际上都必然成为其死敌，这便引发了无限的怀疑。当所有公开的异议都被消除后，不满情绪只会在琐事上表现出来，因此必须允许秘密警察将琐事解读为潜在的阴谋行为。此类调查的前提类似于弗洛伊德对神经症患者进行分析的前提。基于俄狄浦斯情结的假设，患者的一言一行，无论是说出来的还是没说出来的，做过的还是没做过的（甚至是他偶然卷入的事件），都可以被解读为他对父亲隐藏的敌意的表达。同样，一旦你认为任何琐事都可能被解读为叛国行为，进而可能被理解为叛国罪，那么斯大林监狱中实施的事实调查方法似乎完全符合这一目的。甚至近乎酷刑的肉体压力也将不可避免——原因与宗教裁判所不可或缺的酷刑相同。除非被告最终承认，否则有关其隐藏意图的指控不能被视为确凿无疑，为此，他必须在道德、智力和身体上受到摧残。他人被迫做出的供词，对那些仍在抵抗压力的人更具说服力，从而进一步扩展了暴力或诡辩所建立的虚构世界。

A modern revolutionary government aiming at the total renewal of society inevitably sets off this change by severing all ties with its opponents. Whoever is not its unconditional supporter is held to be its mortal enemy. The dictatorship thus creates a situation in which any dissenter must in fact become its mortal enemy, and this justifies unlimited suspicion. When all open dissent is eliminated, disaffection can manifest itself only in trifles, and hence the secret police must be allowed to construe trifles as potential conspiratorial acts. The presuppositions of such investigations become analogous to those governing the Freudian analysis of a neurotic. On the assumption of an Oedipus complex, the patient’s every word and action, whether uttered or unspoken, done or undone (and even events in which he became involved by accident), can be interpreted as expressing his hidden hostility to his father. Similarly, once you assume that any trifles may be interpreted as a sign of disaffection which, in its turn, may be construed into an act of high treason, the methods of fact-finding practised in Stalin’s prisons will appear to have been altogether appropriate to the purpose. Even the exercise of physical pressure bordering on torture will become inevitable—for the same reasons which made torture indispensable to the Inquisition. Accusations concerning a man’s hidden intentions cannot be regarded as firmly established unless the accused eventually admits them, and for this he must be morally, intellectually and physically broken. The extorted confessions of others confront those still resisting pressure with an increased persuasive force and thus extend further the fictitious universe established by violence or sophistry.

这种为了国家利益而捏造公共事实的过程，自然会得到被视为政治武器的学术界的支持。历史学家会通过恰当地重新解读被告在早期历史时期所扮演的角色，来补充对近期颠覆活动的指控。考虑到执政党的阴谋经历，原本看似荒诞的故事也会变得可信。指控一位资深共产党员一直受雇于警方，这并非荒唐，因为马林诺夫斯基，这位列宁多年来最信任的阴谋同谋和杜马布尔什维克党团的领导人，后来可能被证明在那段时间里一直是一名警方间谍。271

This process of fashioning public facts in the interests of the state will naturally receive support from a scholarship conceived as a political weapon. Historians will supplement accusations of recent subversive activities by suitably re-interpreting the part played by the accused at earlier times of history. Stories which otherwise might seem fantastic will be rendered plausible in view of the ruling party’s conspiratorial experience. There is nothing absurd in accusing a veteran communist of having always been in the pay of the police, since a Malinovsky, for many years Lenin’s most trusted fellow conspirator and leader of the Bolshevik fraction in the Duma, could turn out later to have been a police spy during all that time.271

在每个现代国家，民族偏见往往会混淆政治利益相关公共事实的确立。在自由社会中，这种倾向会被观点的竞争所抵消，只要人们能够相互信任，在从相互矛盾的论点中得出结论时，能够保持适度的真实性，就能维持一个充满真实事实的世界。相反，现代革命党的精英们被训练得极尽其所能地发挥其政治偏见。“其成员的全部教育”（汉娜·阿伦特写道）“旨在消除他们区分真相与虚构的能力。他们的优越性在于能够立即将每一个事实陈述化为一个目标宣言。”272这种以恐怖为支撑的活力本身就足以动摇所有官方所谓事实的现实根基，并使革命观点与其反对者的观点之间产生逻辑鸿沟。然而，如果没有恐怖和秘密的并行作用，这种宣传仍然相对无效，它们会创造出一种局势，为所有可以想象到的怀疑增添色彩。此时，与政治相关的事实将完全不复存在，人们只能在两种选择之间做出选择：要么完全不接受任何事实，要么在证据明显不足的情况下随意接受一些事实。

In every modern country, national prejudice tends to obfuscate the establishment of public facts of political interest. In a free society this tendency is counteracted by the rivalry of opinions, which will maintain a universe of true facts so long as people can mutually trust each other to observe a proper level of factuality in drawing their conclusions from contradictory arguments. The élite of a modern revolutionary party is trained, on the contrary, to exercise its political bias to the utmost. ‘Its members’ whole education’ (writes Hannah Arendt) ‘is aimed at abolishing their capacity for distinguishing between truth and fiction. Their superiority consists in the ability immediately to dissolve every statement of fact into a declaration of purpose.’272 Such dynamism, backed up by terror, would suffice by itself to loosen the roots in reality of all officially alleged facts, and to separate revolutionary opinion by a logical gap from that of their opponents. Yet this propaganda would remain comparatively ineffectual, but for the parallel effects of terror and secrecy in creating situations which lend colour to every conceivable suspicion. At this point facts relevant to politics cease altogether to exist, in the sense that one can only choose between either accepting no facts, or accepting some at one’s pleasure on manifestly insufficient evidence.

因此，我本人坚持公共生活中事实的真实性，这意味着我是在一个我效忠的自由社会内部发表言论，273正如我坚持科学的独立地位一样，艺术和道德也意味着这种参与和忠诚。

My own insistence on the reality of facts in public life implies therefore that I am speaking from inside a free society to which I give my allegiance,273 just as my insistence on the independent status of science, art and morality implies such participation and allegiance.

 

 

  1. 后马克思主义自由主义
  2. POST-MARXIAN LIBERALISM

没有任何一个政权能够将现代革命动力的内涵发挥到极致。事实上，甚至将所有思想完全置于某个特定权力中心的统治之下，似乎都难以实现。苏联官方术语所蕴含的人造世界，总是需要用日常语言表达的自然人类情感来补充，有时，这些情感会被大量地重新引入。这种情况发生在20世纪30年代，当时克里姆林宫决定将民族情感及其传统英雄重新纳入俄罗斯的历史意识，从而抛弃了米诺伊·波克罗夫斯基（M.N.Pokrovsky，1868-1932）迄今为止无可争议的学说，后者将史学变成了一种抽象的马克思主义社会学分析。 1950 年，斯大林又一次批判了尼·马尔（1864—1934）的荒谬学说，即所有语言都是阶级语言。独裁者生动地描述了这一正统观念迄今为止如何践踏苏联语言学——他肆意地借用自由主义的词汇，并巧妙地运用其原则来谴责他本人迄今为止所实行的极权主义思想控制。274尽管列宁告诫我们党性是唯一真正的客观性，但真理的概念以及确立真理所必需的思想自由的概念，即使在最严格的意识形态专政时期也没有消失。

No regime has carried out the implications of modern revolutionary dynamism to its logical limits. In fact, it may seem quite impracticable even to approach the complete subordination of all thought to the service of one specific centre of power. The artificial universe encased in the official Soviet jargon had always to be supplemented by natural human sentiments expressed in normal language, and occasionally whole masses of them have been re-introduced. This happened in the 1930’s when the Kremlin decided to restore national sentiments and their traditional heroes into Russian historic consciousness, abandoning thereby the hitherto uncontested doctrine of M.N.Pokrovsky (1868–1932), who had turned historiography into an abstract sociological analysis on Marxist lines. On another occasion, when—in 1950—Stalin repudiated the absurd doctrine of N.Y.Marr (1864–1934), according to which all language was class- language, the dictator gave a vivid picture of how this orthodoxy had hitherto trampled on Soviet linguistics—freely drawing for this purpose on the vocabulary of liberalism, and aptly using its principles for the condemnation of this case of totalitarian thought-control which he had himself imposed until that moment.274 Despite all Lenin’s admonitions that party-spirit is the only true objectivity, the concepts of truth, and of the freedom of thought essential to the establishment of truth, were by no means extinguished even in the period of the strictest ideological dictatorship.

斯大林去世后，苏联政权逐渐人性化，这或许源于马克思主义暴力武器库下那些被活埋的慷慨激情的流露。事实上，通过某种弗洛伊德式的反向反应，这种被束缚的正义热情或许能够逐渐摆脱病态的压抑，重新融入到自觉宣扬的道德诉求之中。

The gradual humanization of the Soviet regime that has occurred since Stalin’s death may be due to the leaking out of the generous passions buried alive under the Marxist armoury of violence. Indeed, by a kind of inverted Freudian ab-reaction this captive zeal for righteousness may yet be gradually released from its pathological repressions and enter once more into the context of consciously declared moral aspirations.

朝着这个方向迈出的第一步是在斯大林去世后立即迈出的，当时他的继任者释放了十三名承认暗杀日斯达诺夫的克里姆林宫医生。1953年3月，这一天，将共产党要员系统性地改造成自认间谍——公开乞求因其臭名昭著的罪行而被绞死——的过程宣告结束。新主人完全不信任斯大林建立的这个充满欺骗和自欺欺人的世界，他们试图通过放弃对真相最恶劣的歪曲来巩固自己的统治；他们希望用说服力来获得他们在强制力中放弃的东西。

The first step in that direction was taken immediately after Stalin’s death, when his successors released the thirteen Kremlin doctors who had confessed to the assassination of Zsdanov. On the day in March, 1953, when this took place, the systematic transmutation of Communist dignitaries into self-confessed spies—publicly begging to be hanged for their infamous crimes—was brought to an end. The new masters did not trust altogether the universe of deception and self-deception erected by Stalin, and tried to consolidate their rule by abandoning its worst distortions of the truth; they hoped to gain in persuasive power what they renounced in coercive force.

思想解放运动自此持续进行，并在1956年匈牙利和波兰十月革命中达到顶峰，被称为“真理革命”。如果将真理的含义理解为一切独立思想的成果，那么这个称谓恰如其分。因为艺术、道德、宗教和爱国主义的权利，以及了解事实的权利，都在一定程度上得到了恢复。

The liberation of thought that has since been going on and has culminated so far in the Hungarian and Polish revolutions of October, 1956, has been called the Revolution of Truth. The designation is apt, if the meaning of truth is taken to comprise the fruits of all independent thought. For the rights of art, morality, religion and patriotism were restored to some extent along with the right to the knowledge of facts.

匈牙利起义者重新唤起1848年的口号，许多作家宣称这场运动重新确立了18世纪的绝对价值信念。另一些人则宣称自由革命必须重新开始。但这种描述具有误导性。将瓦齐克1955年8月发表的《成人诗》与鲁日·德·莱尔1792年4月创作的《马赛曲》进行比较；将裴多菲炽热的情怀与约瑟夫·阿提拉冷峻的洞察力进行比较。1848年的背景是法国大革命，它通过宣扬社会有权按照理性完善自身，挑战了古老的静态秩序，而19世纪的自由主义正是为此目标而战，并反对这种秩序。但当人类欲望的观念否定了公共生活中道德动机的现实性时，自由主义的理想就被颠覆为现代极权主义的教条。自由主义不得不奋力回到一个在现代哲学的光照下已被证明极其不稳定的地位。正因如此，瓦兹克才会说他“吐出”斯大林统治下吞下的谎言；才会说每一位起义的共产党员都会谈到那段时期，他越来越不情愿地纵容着毁灭灵魂的暴政，而他却将暴政视为人类进步的唯一真正工具。

The Hungarian insurgents revived the slogans of 1848, and various writers have declared that the movement re-asserted the belief in absolute values as held in the eighteenth century. Others declared that the liberal revolutions had to be fought all over again. But this description is misleading. Compare Wazyk’s Poem for Adults, published in August, 1955, with the Marseillaise, written by Rouget de Lisle in April, 1792; compare Petöfi’s flaming sentiments with the cold incisiveness of a Jozsef Attila. The background of 1848 was the French Revolution, which had challenged an immemorial static order by proclaiming the right of society to perfect itself according to reason, and the liberalism of the nineteenth century fought for this aim and against that order. But when the appetitive conception of man denied the reality of moral motives in public life, the ideals of liberalism were inverted into the doctrines of modern totalitarianism. Liberalism had then to fight its way back to a position which had proved disastrously unstable in the light of modern philosophies. This is why Wazyk speaks of ‘vomiting’ the lies swallowed under Stalin’s rule; and why every insurgent Communist speaks of a period during which he connived with growing reluctance at a soul- destroying tyranny which he accepted as the only authentic instrument of human progress.

对现代极权主义后果的反感，能否重建一套极权主义信条？极权主义学说本身的逻辑弱点正是建立在其之上。自由主义的信条不再被认为是不言而喻的，它能否从此以正统的形式被维护？我们能否正视这样一个事实：无论一个自由社会多么自由，它同时也是极其保守的？

Can a revulsion against the consequences of modern totalitarianism restore a set of beliefs, on the logical weakness of which the doctrines of totalitarianism itself were founded? Can the beliefs of liberalism, no longer believed to be self-evident, be upheld henceforth in the form of an orthodoxy? Can we face the fact that, no matter how liberal a free society may be, it is also profoundly conservative?

事实就是如此。在一个自由社会中，承认科学、艺术和道德的独立发展，意味着社会致力于培育一种特定的思想传统，这种思想传统由一群权威的专家传承和培育，并通过拉拢来延续。维护这种社会所推行的思想独立性，就等于认同一种正统观念，这种观念虽然没有明确规定任何信条，但在自由社会的文化领导层对创新过程施加的限制内，几乎是无懈可击的。如果这就是列宁所说的“哲学中缺乏党性（partinost）无非是对唯心主义和信仰主义卑鄙而伪装的奴性”的意思，275我们无法否认这一指控。我们还必须面对这样一个事实：这种正统观念以及我们所尊崇的文化权威，背后有国家的强制力支撑，资金来自官僚和财产的受益者。他们行使权力的机构——学校、大学、教堂、学院、法院、报纸和政党——都受到那些守护地主和资本家财富的警察和士兵的保护。

For this is the fact. The recognition granted in a free society to the independent growth of science, art and morality, involves a dedication of society to the fostering of a specific tradition of thought, transmitted and cultivated by a particular group of authoritative specialists, perpetuating themselves by co-option. To uphold the independence of thought implemented by such a society is to subscribe to a kind of orthodoxy which, though it specifies no fixed articles of faith, is virtually unassailable within the limits imposed on the process of innovation by the cultural leader-ship of a free society. If this is what Lenin meant by saying that The absence of party spirit (partinost) in philosophy is nothing but despicable and disguised servility towards idealism and fideism’,275 we cannot deny the charge. And we must face also the fact that this orthodoxy, and the cultural authorities which we respect, are backed by the coercive power of the state and financed by the beneficiaries of office and property. The institutions by which their authority is exercised, the schools, universities, churches, academies, law courts, newspapers and political parties, are under the protection of the same policemen and soldiers who guard the wealth of the landowners and capitalists.

这种制度框架是否必须被接受为自由社会的公民家园？难道只有通过避免采取任何激进行动来建立正义和博爱，才能维护政治自由赖以建立的绝对道德自决权？难道除非我们同意在有生之年，无论自由社会的纽带多么不公正，我们都必须尽可能地放松这些纽带，否则我们将不可避免地把人类推入卑微的奴役之中？

Must this institutional framework be accepted as the civic home of a free society? Is it true that the absolute right of moral self-determination, on which political liberty was founded, can be upheld only by refraining from any radical action towards the establishment of justice and brotherhood? That indeed, unless we agree that within our lifetime we must no more than loosen the ties of a free society, however iniquitous they may be, we shall inevitably precipitate men into abject servitude?

就我而言，我会说：是的。我相信，总的来说，这些限制是必要的。自由社会中盛行的不公正特权，只有通过精心分级才能减少；那些想在一夜之间摧毁它们的人，只会在原地建立更大的不公正。只有绝对的权力才能尝试实现社会的绝对道德革新，而这种权力必然会摧毁人类的道德生活。

For my part, I would say: Yes. I believe that, on the whole, these limitations are imperative. Unjust privileges prevailing in a free society can be reduced only by carefully graded stages; those who would demolish them overnight would erect greater injustices in their place. An absolute moral renewal of society can be attempted only by an absolute power which must inevitably destroy the moral life of man.

这一真理令人良心不安。难道我们必须压抑良心，或者接受极权主义的教条，认为只有暴力才是诚实的吗？我在本章的引言中曾说过，我将在社会环境中重新探讨这个问题：我们如何才能继续持有那些可能受到质疑的信念。本书试图通过将怀疑论的危险性纳入知识的条件中，来稳定知识，使其免受怀疑论的冲击。因此，这种尝试或许等同于对一个明显不完美的社会的忠诚，这种忠诚基于这样的认识：我们的责任在于服务于我们不可能实现的理想。

This truth is unpalatable to our conscience. Does it follow that we must suppress our conscience, or else accept the totalitarian teaching that violence alone is honest? I said in the introduction to this chapter that I would renew within a social setting the question, how we can keep holding beliefs that can conceivably be doubted. The attempt made in this book to stabilize knowledge against scepticism, by including its hazardous character in the conditions of knowledge, may find its equivalent, then, in an allegiance to a manifestly imperfect society, based on the acknowledgment that our duty lies in the service of ideals which we cannot possibly achieve.

 

 

第三部分 辩护

PART THREE THE JUSTIFICATION

个人知识

OF PERSONAL KNOWLEDGE

 

 

8

8

肯定的逻辑

THE LOGIC OF AFFIRMATION

 

 

  1. 介绍
  2. INTRODUCTION

至此，我已考察了一系列事实，它们有力地表明，我们需要重新评估我们获取知识的能力。这种重新评估要求我们拥有远超客观主义知识观所认可的认知能力，但与此同时，它也将人类判断的独立性降低到远低于传统上自由运用理性所宣称的水平。除非我们能够首先掌握迄今为止已知的知识，否则积累更多证据毫无意义。因此，我现在将尝试对个人知识的概念给出一个更为清晰的概述。为此，我将再次将论证的焦点集中在构成最大确定性核心的狭义知识上。只有我们能够找到简单的公式来定义此类知识的不确定性及其存在依赖性，我们才有可能设计出一个稳定的框架，使任何类型的知识都能在其中得到论证。

BY now I have surveyed a series of facts which seriously suggest a reappraisal of our capacity to acquire knowledge. This reappraisal demands that we credit ourselves with much wider cognitive powers than an objectivist conception of knowledge would allow, but at the same time it reduces the independence of human judgment far below that claimed traditionally for the free exercise of reason. It is useless to accumulate more evidence unless we can first master what has been given so far. I shall now try, therefore, to give a firmer outline to the conception of personal knowledge. The argument will be focussed for this purpose once more on the narrow range of knowledge, forming the hard core of greatest certainty. Only if we can find simple formulations which define the indeterminacy and existential dependence of such knowledge, can we hope to devise a stable framework within which any kind of knowledge can be justified.

 

 

  1. 自信地运用语言
  2. THE CONFIDENT USE OF LANGUAGE

如果我们对一个物体的所谓用途的理解完全错误（就像对永动机的理解错误一样），或者它未能达到其所谓的目的，那么它就不是工具；在这种情况下，依赖工具是一种错误。同样，如果一个描述性词语所传达的概念是错误的，或者该词语不能恰当地涵盖所讨论的主题，那么依赖它也是错误的。

An object alleged to be a tool is not a tool if our conception of its alleged use is altogether mistaken (in the way conceptions of a perpetuum mobile are mistaken) or if it otherwise fails to serve its alleged purpose; it is an error to rely on a tool in such a case. Similarly, it is an error to rely on a descriptive word if either the conception which it conveys is false, or the word does not properly cover the subject matter in question.

人们可以尝试性地使用某种工具，或者仅仅表明它毫无用处。同样，我们可以将描述性词语放在引号中，以表示怀疑。假设一篇论文的标题是“对‘超感官知觉’的解释”，另一篇论文的标题是“对超感官知觉的‘解释’” 。通过引号，我们立即意识到，第一篇论文认为超感官知觉是虚假的，而第二篇论文则承认它是真实的，并相反地否定了第一篇论文中对它提出的解释。

One can use a tool tentatively, or merely show that it is useless. Similarly, we can use a descriptive word sceptically by putting it in quotation marks. Suppose a paper is published under the title: An Explanation of ‘Extra-sensory Perception’, and another in reply to it, entitled: An ‘Explanation’ of Extra-sensory Perception. Guided by the quotation marks we recognize immediately that the first paper regards extra-sensory perception as spurious, while the second accredits it as genuine and discredits, on the contrary, the explanation suggested for it in the first paper.

描述性词语作为句子的一部分，不带引号，可以自信地被信赖：它们证明了其所传达概念的实质性特征及其与所讨论内容的贴切性。我称之为对词语的自信或直接使用。相比之下，用引号（作为与该词语无关的句子的一部分）使用的描述性词语276是以怀疑或间接的方式使用的。这种用法要么质疑该词语所唤起的概念的真实性，要么质疑其对相关案例的适用性。由于一个词语无论直接使用还是间接使用都保持不变，因此，自信地或怀疑地使用该词语之间的区别必然完全在于其表达的默契系数。这种区别正式地表明了与自信地使用描述性术语相关的不可指定的个人系数。

Descriptive words written down as part of a sentence without quotation marks around them are confidently relied upon: they accredit the substantial character of the conception which they convey and its appositeness to the matter in hand. I shall call this the confident or direct use of a word. By contrast, a descriptive word used in quotation marks (as part of a sentence not concerning that word)276 is used in a sceptical or oblique fashion. Such use calls in question either the reality of the conception evoked by the word, or its applicability to the case in point. Since a word remains the same whether used directly or obliquely, the difference between uttering it confidently or sceptically must lie wholly in the tacit coefficient of its utterance. This difference identifies formally the unspecifiable personal coefficient attached to the confident use of a descriptive term.

 

 

  1. 对描述性术语的质疑
  2. THE QUESTIONING OF DESCRIPTIVE TERMS

我们可以通过用文字解释并辅以论证来消除含义中不确定的残留。这种文字定义的作用方式与对一项技能的分析或对一种科学研究方法的公理化相同；它们揭示了我们迄今为止默默实践的某些艺术规则，并有助于巩固和改进这些规则的运用。因此，在表述定义时，我们必须依赖于观察词语运用技巧的真实实践方式；或者更准确地说，观察我们自己如何以我们认为真实的方式运用待定义的术语。“明示定义”仅仅是这种观察的适当延伸。它们将听众的注意力引向那些被认为特别清晰的例子，仿佛通过展示如何完成一项巧妙的技艺来补充其解释。因此，意义的形式化从一开始就依赖于非形式化意义的实践。最终，当我们使用定义中未定义的词语时，它也必然如此。最后，对定义的实际解读必须始终依赖于依赖者对其未定义的理解。定义只能改变意义的隐性系数；它只能降低它，但不能消除它。

We may try to eliminate the indeterminate residue of a meaning by explaining it in words aided by demonstrations. Such verbal definitions operate in the same way as the analysis of a skill or the axiomatization of a scientific method of enquiry; they disclose certain rules of art which we have hitherto practised tacitly, and help to consolidate and improve their use. Accordingly, in formulating a definition we must rely on watching the way the art of using a word is authentically practised; or more precisely, watch ourselves applying the term to be defined in ways that we regard as authentic. ‘Ostensive definitions’ are merely a suitable extension of this watching. They call the listener’s attention to examples believed to be particularly clear, supplementing as it were, the explanation of a clever feat by showing how it is done. The formalization of meaning relies therefore from the start on the practice of unformalized meaning. It necessarily does so also in the end, when we are using the undefined words of the definitions. Finally, the practical interpretation of a definition must rely all the time on its undefined understanding by the person relying on it. Definitions only shift the tacit coefficient of meaning; they reduce it but cannot eliminate it.

默契系数是一种自信的表现，而所有自信都有可能被错用。我之前曾谈到过这种风险，当时我指出，所有表达都根植于动物理解自身处境的理解力。我们已经看到，这种自信是多么充满激情，多么富有创造力和说服力；一个致力于培养这种自信的社会是如何分享、培育和规范这种自信的；而且，在某种程度上，我们对词语含义的自信是一种社会忠诚的表现。所有这些默契的承诺似乎都是自我满足的、不可逆转的，因此也无法具体化。它们似乎将我们置于一个极其复杂的、完全不确定的不确定性体系之中，如果我们真的要开口说话，就必须盲目地接受它。

The tacit coefficient is an act of confidence, and all confidence can be conceivably misplaced. I have spoken of this risk before, when showing that all articulation is rooted in the kind of comprehension by which animals make sense of their situation. We have seen how passionate is this confidence, how inventive and persuasive; how it is shared, fostered and disciplined, by a society dedicated to its cultivation; and how, to this extent, our confidence in the meaning of words is an act of social allegiance. All these tacit commitments appeared self-satisfying, irreversible and hence unspecifiable. They seemed to face us with an immensely ramified system of wholly indeterminate uncertainties which we have to accept blindly, if we are ever to speak at all.

通过对比词语的间接使用和直接使用，我们现在可以正式表明，自信言论的这些风险是不可避免的。我们可能会将一个词放在引号中，同时在句子的其余部分自信地使用语言。但依次质疑每个词永远不会同时质疑所有词。因此，它永远不会揭示出我们整个描述性习语背后的全面错误。我们当然可以写下一段文字，并通过将每个描述性词语放在引号中，同时收回对其中所有词语的信心。但这样一来，所有词语都没有任何意义，整个文字也毫无意义。至少在为某些描述性术语赋予意义的行为中，固有的自信风险是无法根除的。

By contrasting the oblique use of words with their direct use, we can now show formally that these risks of confident utterance are unavoidable. We may place a word in quotation marks, while using language confidently through the rest of a sentence. But the questioning of each word in turn would never question all at the same time. Accordingly, it would never reveal a comprehensive error which underlies our entire descriptive idiom. We can of course write down a text and withdraw our confidence from all its words simultaneously, by putting each descriptive word between quotation marks. But then none of the words would mean anything and the whole text would be meaningless. The hazards of confidence inherent in the act of attaching a meaning at least to some set of descriptive terms are ineradicable.

 

 

  1. 精确
  2. PRECISION

我以前也说过，我们必须接受语义不确定性的风险，因为只有含义不确定的词语才能对现实产生影响，而为了应对这种危险，我们必须相信自己有能力感知这种影响。277这一决定将消除作为一种理想的意义精确性，并提出一个问题，我们可以在什么意义上（如果有的话）将“精确”或“不精确”一词应用于描述性术语的含义。

I have also said before that we must accept the risks of semantic indeterminacy, since only words of indeterminate meaning can have a bearing on reality and that for meeting this hazard we must credit ourselves with the ability to perceive such bearing.277 This decision would eliminate precision of meaning as an ideal, and raise the question in what sense (if any) we may apply the term ‘precise’ or ‘imprecise’ to the meaning of a descriptive term.

我认为“精确”一词适用于描述性词语，就像适用于测量值、地图或任何其他描述一样，只要该词语与经验相符。精确性或不精确性是一种属性，可以通过将一个名称与某个非名称的事物（但该名称所依附的情境）进行匹配来判断。

I suggest that the term ‘precise’ is applicable to a descriptive word in the same way as to a measured quantity, a map, or any other description, in so far as the word appears to match experience. Precision or imprecision is a property that can be predicated of a designation when it is tested by matching it against something which is not a designation, but is the situation on which the designation bears.

这种检验本身无法以相同的意义进行检验。它是一种默契的表现，因此缺乏使指称与被指对象——两者——在逻辑上能够对峙和匹配的二元性。因此，当我们说一个描述性术语是精确的时，我们是在宣告一个检验的结果，而这个检验本身却无法以相同的意义说是精确的。当然，当我们用得出该术语的检验来检验它时， “精确”一词的应用或许可以再次被称为精确的，或不精确的；但这种第二次对峙必须再次依赖于一种个人的评价，而这种评价在描述所能达到的意义上无法被称为精确。因此，一个词的精确性最终总是依赖于一个与该词本身意义不相同的检验。

This test itself cannot be tested in the same sense. It is a tacit performance, and as such lacks the duality which makes the confrontation and the matching of two things—the designation and the designate— logically possible. Therefore, when we say of a descriptive term that it is precise, we declare the result of a test which itself cannot be said to be precise in the same sense. Of course, the application of the term ‘precise’ might once more be said to be precise, or imprecise, when we confront it with the test from which it was derived; but this second confrontation would have to rely once more on a personal appraisal which cannot be said to be precise in the sense in which a description can be. The precision of a word will ultimately always rely, therefore, on a test which is not precise in the same sense as the word is said to be.

当我们询问“精确”一词的应用本身是否精确时，我们陷入了不确定且徒劳的倒退​​，这表明应该通过否认“精确”一词具有描述性术语的特征来避免这样的问题。当我们说一个词是精确的（或恰当的、合适的、清晰的或富有表现力的），我们是在赞同我们自己的一个行为，因为我们在执行这个行为时感到满意。我们对所做的事情感到满意，就像我们理解模糊的景象或微弱的声音；或者当我们找到方向或恢复平衡时一样。我们通过说我们正在使用的词是精确的来恰当地宣布我们自己这种个人理解的结果。只有当我们把这种自我满足的宣告伪装成一个指称另一个描述性术语的属性的描述性术语时，才会出现不确定的倒退。

The indefinite and futile regress on which we enter when asking whether the application of the term ‘precise’ is itself precise, suggests that such a question should be avoided by denying to the word ‘precise’ the character of a descriptive term. When we say that a word is precise (or apt, or fitting, or clear, or expressive), we approve of an act of our own which we have found satisfying while carrying it out. We are satisfied by something we do in. the same way as when we make sense of blurred sights or faint noises; or when we find our way or recover our balance. We properly declare the outcome of this personal comprehension of our own, by saying that a word which we are using is precise. The indefinite regress arises only when we disguise this announcement of our self- satisfaction as a descriptive term designating a property of another descriptive term.

要避免这种谬误，我们必须充分认识到，只有说话者或听者才能用词语表达某种含义，而词语本身没有任何意义。当一个人运用对事物的理解，并用描述事物的词语表达意义时，按照严格的标准表达意义的可能性在逻辑上就显得毫无意义了。因为任何严格形式的操作都是非个人化的，因此无法传达说话者的个人承诺。对“精确”一词的分析应用于描述性术语（这些术语只有在不严格精确的情况下才能具有真实的含义），揭示了说话者在说出该术语并评估其精确性时是自主的行为。

We shall avoid this fallacy by fully acknowledging that only a speaker or listener can mean something by a word, and a word in itself can mean nothing. When the act of meaning is thus brought home to a person exercising his understanding of things by the use of words which describe them, the possibility of performing the act of meaning according to strict criteria appears logically meaningless. For any strictly formal operation would be impersonal and could not therefore convey the speaker’s personal commitment. The analysis of the term ‘precise’ applied to descriptive terms which can mean something real only if they are not strictly precise, reveals therefore the self-reliant act of the speaker uttering the term and assessing its precision.

 

 

  1. 个人意义模式
  2. THE PERSONAL MODE OF MEANING

那么，如果有意义的不是词语，而是说话者或听众通过词语表达的意思，那么，请允许我据此表明我作为迄今为止所写内容以及后续内容的作者的真实立场。我现在必须承认，我并不是从一片无信仰的空白开始重新考虑我的信仰的。远非如此。我起初是一个在智力上受特定习语影响的人，这些习语是通过我成长的地方在特定历史时期盛行的文明习得的。这是我所有智力努力的母体。我要在其中找到我的问题并寻求解决方案的条件。我对这些原始术语的所有修正都将保留在我以前的信仰体系中。更糟糕的是，我无法准确地说出这些信仰是什么。我什么也说不出来。我说过和将要说的话都没有意义：只有谁通过它们才有意义。并且，一般来说，我并不确切地知道我的意思，尽管我可以在一定程度上探索我的意思，但我相信，如果我的词语（描述性词语）有任何意义的话，那么它们所代表的意义一定比我所知道的更多。
