(2) Having such confidence in myself, I went on to recognize the companionship of other people, thus using my powers of personal knowing for crediting others with the exercise of similar powers.364 (3) By the same token I can now generalize this fiduciary act to a recognition of all kinds of individual living beings.

因此，个体性是一种个人事实，并且在某种程度上是不可具体化的。下一章我将回到这个问题；目前，我将讨论我们关于个体的知识的其他特性。首先，一个活着的个体给我们的印象是一个个人事实，

Individuality is, accordingly, a personal fact, and to that extent unspecifiable. To this I shall return in the next chapter; for the time being, I shall deal with other peculiarities of our knowledge concerning individuals. In the first place, a living individual strikes us as a personal fact,

比我们迄今遇到的任何其他个人事实都更加切实可感、更加活跃。当然，对整体的每一次理解都承认了它的真实性；我们所理解的一切，不仅对我们有意义，而且至少在一定程度上，本身也具有存在的意义。我们通过倾尽全力以达到对整体的焦点意识来体验这种意义。通过栖居于和谐的声音序列中，我们承认它们作为曲调的共同意义：一种它们自身具有的存在意义。在某种程度上，我们对一个活着的个体的存在的承认沿着非常相似的路线进行。我们在其中评价一种重要的秩序，这种秩序本身就具有意义。但一个活着的个体与我们之前赋予意义的任何无生命的东西，如曲调、文字、诗歌、理论、文化，都截然不同。它的意义不同，或许更丰富，最重要的是，它有一个中心。现在，我们理解的重点是某种活跃的事物，它生长，产生有意义的形状，通过器官的合理运作而生存；它能够行动并获取知识，在人类层面上，甚至可以思考并确认自己的信念。

having a much more tangible and active being than any other personal fact that we have yet encountered. Of course, every comprehension of a whole acknowledges the reality of it; and whatever we comprehend both means something to us and to a certain extent at least means something also existentially, in itself. We experience this meaning by pouring ourselves out for the sake of achieving a focal awareness of the whole. By dwelling in a harmonious sequence of sounds, we acknowledge their joint meaning as a tune: a meaning they have in themselves, existentially. Up to a point our acknowledgment of the existence of a living individual proceeds on quite similar lines. We appraise in it a significant orderliness, which as such means something in itself. But a living individual is altogether different from any of the inanimate things, like tunes, words, poems, theories, cultures, to which we have ascribed meaning before this. Its meaning is different, perhaps richer, and above all, it has a centre. The focus of our comprehension is now something active, that grows, produces meaningful shapes, survives by the rational functioning of its organs; something that can behave and acquire knowledge, and at a human level, can even think and affirm its own convictions.

承认这样一个中心在逻辑上是新颖的。这在人类层面上尤为明显。当我们认识某个人，而他自己也知道一些事情时，他的知识就是我们研究对象的一部分。我们必须判断这是否真的是知识。一个人的幻想与他的知识并不相同。因此，我们必须着手区分这两者，并理解获得知识的基础。因此，我们很快就会发现自己正在审视知识或所谓的知识，就像我们反思自己知道或自以为知道的东西一样。

The acknowledgment of such a centre is a logical novelty. This becomes strikingly apparent at the human level. When we know somebody who himself knows something, his knowledge is part of our subject matter. We must decide whether it is in fact knowledge. A man’s illusions are not the same as his knowledge. We must undertake therefore to discriminate between the two and to understand the ground on which knowledge was acquired. So presently we find ourselves examining knowledge or alleged knowledge, in the same way as when we reflect on what we ourselves know, or believe we know.

这非常特殊。因为逻辑学家严格区分了我们对事物的知识和我们对这些知识的反思。自然科学被视为对事物的知识，而关于科学的知识则被认为与科学截然不同，被称为“元科学”。因此，我们有三个逻辑层次：第一层是科学的对象，第二层是科学本身，第三层是元科学，它包含科学的逻辑和认识论。但是，既然我们已经看到，符号学习在逻辑上等同于自然科学中真理的确立，那么符号学习的过程就发生在两个逻辑层次上：学习占据较高的层次，而辨别框等等则位于较低的层次。因此，我们现在将元科学的三层结构归于符号学习的研究，动物心理学家占据其最顶层，即第三层。我在第262页的某个地方已经预见到了这一点，通过定义神经学家研究大脑功能的三重情境。

This is very peculiar. For logicians discriminate sharply between our knowledge of things and our reflections on our knowledge of things. Natural science is regarded as a knowledge of things, while knowledge about science is held to be quite distinct from science, and is called ‘meta- science’. We have then three logical levels: a first floor for the objects of science, a second for science itself and a third for meta-science, which includes the logic and epistemology of science. But since we have seen that signlearning is logically equivalent to the establishment of truth in the natural sciences, it follows that the process of sign-learning takes place on two logical levels: learning occupying the higher, and the discrimination box, etc., the lower level. And hence to the study of sign-learning we now ascribe the three-storied structure of a meta-science, the animal psychologist occupying its topmost, third level. I have anticipated this already up to a point on p. 262 by defining the tripartite situation in which the neurologist investigates the functions of the brain.

现在，研究活人的科学与研究无生命事物的科学在逻辑上似乎有所不同。与无生命科学的两层逻辑结构相比，生物科学（至少是生物学的某些部分）似乎具有三层结构，类似于逻辑学和认识论。这一结论给我们带来了以下悖论。进化过程构成了从无生命阶段到活人阶段的连续过渡；那么，它如何能带来额外的逻辑层次——用二代替一，用三代替二？

A science dealing with living persons appears now logically different from a science dealing with inanimate things. In contrast to the two- storied logical structure of inanimate science, biological science, or at least some parts of biology, seem to possess a three-storied structure, similar to that of logic and epistemology. This conclusion presents us with the following paradox. The evolutionary process forms a continuous transition from the inanimate stage to that of living and knowing persons; how can it then bring forth an additional logical level—two in place of one, three in place of two?

让我们首先看看三层结构完全建立的阶段。一旦我们了解了动物的刻意行为，即它致力于一种可能正确或错误的行为模式，并因此暗示了对外部事物可能为真或为假的假设，那么对这种承诺的理解就是一种关于正确性和知识的理论。它显然是三层的。但三层结构的某些方面出现得更早，在个体生物首次出现时就已显现。任何这样的个体都可以被称为正常或不正常；健康或患病；它可能残缺、畸形，也可能完整且形态良好。三层结构在此阶段仅体现在这样一个事实中：生理和病理形态或过程之间的任何区别都必须基于适合该个体的正确性标准。这些标准为该个体所属的物种所共有，承认了我们对该物种正常样本存在的兴趣，并认可它们的正常功能是其特有的。观察者对正确性的判断在此已在两个连续的层面上运作。在较高层面上，它确立了物种的生理特征，而非其病理异常；而在较低层面上，它将这些标准应用于评估单个个体，并假设这些标准告诉我们什么对个体有益。第三个、也是最低的层面显现的最原始阶段是，动物进行外部活动，尽管并非经过深思熟虑，例如协调四肢运动、引导迁徙等。这时，可以说动物正在做某事，这种行为可能是对的，也可能是错的，尽管这种判断比其深思熟虑的行为要弱一些。如果不涉及任何行动，就不存在更低的层面，形态学和生理学的判断仅仅意味着动物的正常存在是正确的，因为它是这样的。

Let us look first at the stage where the three-storied structure is fully established. Once we have before us the deliberate behaviour of an animal, by which it commits itself to a mode of action which can be right or wrong, and which thus implies assumptions about external things that can be true or false, the understanding of such a commitment is a theory of rightness and knowledge. It is clearly three-storied. But some aspects of the three-storied structure emerge much earlier, at the very first appearance of individual living beings. Any such individual may be said to be normal or abnormal; healthy or sick; it may be mutilated, malformed, or else intact and well-shaped. The three-storied structure manifests itself at this stage only in the fact that any distinction between a physiological and pathological shape or process must necessarily be based on standards of rightness that are proper to the individual in question. These standards, which are common to the species to which the individual belongs, acknowledge our interest in the existence of normal specimens of the species and endorse their normal functions as proper to them. The observer’s judgment of rightness already operates here on two consecutive levels. On the upper level, it establishes the physiological characteristics of the species, as opposed to its pathological anomalies, while, on the lower level, it applies these criteria for the appraisal of a single individual, on the assumption that they tell us what is good for him. The most primitive stage at which a third, lowest level becomes apparent, is when animals operate externally, though without deliberation, e.g. by co- ordinating their limbs for locomotion, guiding their migration, etc. The animal may then be said to be doing something that can be right or wrong, though in a weaker sense than when it is acting deliberately. Where no action is involved no lower level exists, and the judgments of morphology and physiology then merely imply that the normal existence of the animal is right in being what it is, as it is.

因此，就被观察的个体在做某事或了解某事而言，生物学是三层的；而当观察一个独立存在、不与外界事物发生关系的个体时，生物学是两层的。这种逻辑层次的减少类似于从技术和自然科学（后两者均在两个层次上运作）向纯数学和音乐的转变，后两者与自身之外的事物无关，而是通过内在于一个层次上的经验。为自己而活的生命在这里在逻辑上等同于艺术体验。由于被动存在逐渐唤醒主动表现，因此从植物和最低等动物的两层生物学到更活跃、更有知识的动物的三层生物学的转变中不存在不连续性。这解决了我们的悖论。

Biology is therefore three-storied in so far as the individual under observation is doing or knowing something; and two-storied when it observes an individual existing by himself, without bearing on things outside it. This reduction in the number of logical levels is similar to the transition from technology and the natural sciences, which both operate on two levels, to pure mathematics and music which—having no bearing on things outside themselves—are experienced by indwelling, on one level. Life lived for itself is equated here logically with artistic experience. Since passive existence awakens gradually to active performances, there is no discontinuity in the transition from the two-storied biology of plants and the lowest animals, to the three-storied biology of the more active and more knowledgeable animals. This resolves our paradox.

在两个连续的层面上评价动物的行为（以及它的形状和器官的功能），是对我们之前遇到的一个原则的重要概括，当我们承认过去的一项科学著作的伟大之处时，即使其结果在很大程度上是错误的。我们这样做是因为我们是在作者当时可用的手段框架内判断该著作的价值。同样的原则再次根据我们出生和成长的特定条件定义了我们自己的职业。这一原则的所有应用都具有普遍的意图，通过区分我们身上的主观或偶然因素（这是我们职业的一部分）和我们身上在这种环境中起作用的个人因素。

The appraisal of an animal’s behaviour (as well as of its shape and the functioning of its organs) on two consecutive levels is an important generalization of a principle that we have met before, when we acknowledged the greatness of a scientific work of the past, even when its results had been largely mistaken. We did so because we judged the merits of the work within the framework of the means available to the author at the time. It was the same principle, once more, which defined our own calling in the light of the particular conditions to which we were born and brought up. All the applications of this principle were made with universal intent, by distinguishing between the subjective or contingent in us, which is part of our calling, and the personal in us which acts within this setting.

这让我想到了第二个逻辑上的新颖之处，它源于对个体中心的承认。因为它揭示了另一种消除逻辑层次的方式，这一次尤其体现在人类层面。另一个人可以评判我们，就像我们评判他一样，而他的评判可能会影响我们对自己的评判。我们与他的关系实际上可能主要是被动的，就像我们承认此人的权威一样。因为，当我们信任地接受一个陈述时，我们就会放弃探究其合理性，也不能说我们是从我们自身更高的逻辑层面来审视它。即使是动物心理学家和他正在做实验的老鼠之间，也存在着某种程度的友谊，但当我们与更高级的动物打交道时，人际关系会变得更加广泛，而当我们达到人与人之间的层次时，这种关系就更加广泛了。在这里，互惠性如此盛行，以至于观察者面对处于较低逻辑层面的对象的逻辑范畴变得完全不适用。“我-它”的情境逐渐转变为“我-你”的关系。这表明，从事实陈述到道德和公民命令的肯定，存在着持续过渡的可能性。我们将在下一章结尾处看到这一点的证实。

This brings me to a second logical novelty arising from the acknowledgment of a centre of individuality. For it shows another way in which logical levels can be effaced, this time particularly on the human level. Another person can judge us as we can judge him, and his judgment may affect our judgment of ourselves. Our relation to him may, indeed, be predominantly passive, as when we acknowledge the person’s authority. For to the extent to which we accept a statement on trust, we forgo enquiring into its justification and cannot be said to be examining it from our own superior logical level. A measure of companionship prevails even between the animal psychologist and a rat on which he is experimenting, but interpersonal relations become ampler as we deal with higher animals, and even more as we reach the inter-human level. Mutuality prevails to such an extent here that the logical category of an observer facing an object placed on a lower logical level becomes altogether inapplicable. The I-It situation has been gradually transformed into an I-Thou relation. This suggests the possibility of a continuous transition from statements of fact to affirmations of moral and civic commands. We shall see this confirmed at the close of the next chapter.

 

 

12

12

认识生命

KNOWING LIFE

 

 

  1. 介绍
  2. INTRODUCTION

关于生物的事实比无生命世界的事实更具个人色彩。此外，随着我​​们提升到生命的更高层次，为了理解生命，我们必须运用越来越个人化的能力——这需要认知者更广泛的参与。因为无论一个生物体是像机器一样运作，还是更多地通过等势整合过程运作，我们对它成就的认识都必须依赖于对它的全面理解，而这种理解无法用更客观的事实来具体化，而且，随着我们攀登进化的阶梯，我们的理解与我们对理解的具体化之间的逻辑差距会不断加深。我将在本章中论证这一点。但在开始这一探究之前，我想先说明另一点；即，随着我们继续探究生命的上升阶段，我们的研究对象将倾向于越来越多地包含我们赖以理解生命的能力。我们意识到，我们对生物能力的观察必须与我们依赖同类能力来观察生命相一致。生物学是生命对自身的反思，生物学的发现必须与生物学对其自身发现的主张相一致。 365

FACTS about living things are more highly personal than the facts of the inanimate world. Moreover, as we ascend to higher manifestations of life, we have to exercise ever more personal faculties—involving a more far- reaching participation of the knower—in order to understand life. For whether an organism operates more as a machine or more by a process of equipotential integration, our knowledge of its achievements must rely on a comprehensive appreciation of it which cannot be specified in terms of more impersonal facts, and the logical gap between our comprehension and the specification of our comprehension goes on deepening as we ascend the evolutionary ladder. I shall demonstrate this in the present chapter. But before entering on this enquiry, I want to anticipate yet another point; namely, that as we proceed to survey the ascending stages of life, our subject matter will tend to include more and more of the very faculties on which we rely for understanding it. We realize then that what we observe about the capacities of living beings must be consonant with our reliance on the same kind of capacities for observing it. Biology is life reflecting on itself, and the findings of biology must prove consistent with the claims made by biology for its own findings.365

我们将发现自己赋予生物以广泛的能力，类似于我们在先前探究知识的本质和正当性时所宣称的能力，我们将看到，生物学是知识理论的扩展，成为涵盖所有生物成就的理论，而知识的获取就是其中之一。所有这些都将包含在一个广义的承诺概念中。对生物学的批判将转化为对生物学家承诺的分析，生物学家通过承诺认可生物在生存策略中所依赖的现实。虽然这些现实将与我们关于无生命事物的知识所承诺的现实相一致，但另一条概括路线，从“我-它”上升到“我-你”，并超越它，延伸到对人类伟大性的研究，将把生物学家与其研究对象的关系转变为人与他所承诺服务的永恒苍穹之间的关系。

And as we shall find ourselves accrediting living beings with a wide range of faculties, similar to those which we have claimed for ourselves in the foregoing enquiry into the nature and justification of knowledge, we shall see that biology is an expansion of the theory of knowledge into a theory of all kinds of biotic achievements, among which the acquisition of knowledge is one. These will all be comprised by a generalized conception of commitment. The critique of biology will then turn out to be an analysis of the biologist’s commitment, by which he accredits the realities on which living beings rely in the stratagem of living. And while these realities will fall into line with the realities to which our knowledge of inanimate things commits us, another line of generalization, ascending from the I-It to the I-Thou and beyond it to the study of human greatness, will transform the biologist’s relation to his subject matter to that between man and the abiding firmament which he is committed to serve.

 

 

2. 类型真实性

2. TRUENESS TO TYPE

个体生命最低级的表现形式——但绝非最不精彩的——是其以特定标准所支配的形态出现的方式。这种和谐存在的意义，以及我们对其意义的欣赏，是两种相互关联的生命形式。因为，欣赏和谐的存在，如同欣赏一件艺术品，本身就是一种和谐的存在。我们对生物的沉思在自身中找到了正当性——这种正当性源于它赋予所沉思的生物以意义，将其视为自在的存在。

The lowest manifestation of individual life—but not the least wonderful— is its manner of appearance, in shapely forms, ruled by specific standards. The meaning of such harmonious being and our appreciation of its significance are two allied forms of life. For the appreciation of harmonious beings is, just like the enjoyment of a work of art, itself a harmonious being. Our contemplation of living beings finds a justification in itself—a justification derived from the significance which it accords to the living beings that it contemplates, as beings in themselves.

有一门科学——描述性科学——根据形状对生物进行分类。这种最古老的植物学和动物学形式，如今被专业地称为分类学。366事实上，分类学家的基本工作每天都在进行，无需任何科学手段，无论我们识别的是一只猫、一株报春花还是一个人。即使是动物也拥有这种能力，即使对一个通常与它们没有切身关系的物种，无论是作为威胁还是猎物，它们也能运用这种能力。洛伦兹发现，幼鸟如果对人类表现出孝顺之情，也会对人类的所有成员表现出同样的态度。 367

There is a science—a descriptive science—which undertakes the classification of living beings according to shapes. This most ancient form of botany and zoology goes today by the technical name of taxonomy.366 The basic performance of the taxonomist is actually practised every day without any scientific aid, whenever we identify a cat, a primrose or a man. Even animals have this capacity, and can exercise it even in respect of a species which has normally no vital interest for them, whether as a menace or as a quarry. Lorenz found that young birds who fix their filial sentiments on a human being will show the same attitude towards all members of the human race.367

普通法规定，谋杀罪的认定及其惩罚取决于被害人死亡时的体形。它要求，无论死亡形态如何变化——无论是年龄、种族差异、畸形、残缺，还是肆虐的疾病——我们都必须始终辨认出死亡时的人形。这项要求似乎并不过分，因为目前为止，还没有哪起案件中被告以无法辨认被害人的人形为由进行辩护。

Common Law makes the crime of murder, and punishment for murder, dependent on the human shape of the individual whose death has been caused. It demands that through all its variations—caused by differences of age and race, by malformations and mutilations, or by ravaging disease—we should always identify the presence of the human shape. Nor does this demand seem excessive, since no case is known in which an accused has pleaded failure to recognize the human shape of an individual he had killed.

然而，似乎不可能设计出一个定义，明确规定人体形状可以变化的范围，以及不能变化的范围；而且可以肯定的是，那些认识这种形状的人并没有这样的明确定义。相反，他们通过构建人体形状的概念来运用他们的认知技巧。他们相信自己能够识别出那些尽管存在差异，却被他们判断为相同特征的明显不同实例，并且在其他情况下，他们能够区分那些尽管存在一些相似之处，却被他们判断为不同特征的实例的事物。他们坚信人类类型存在，并不断通过将人类视为这种类型的实例来构建他们对这种类型的概念。在这样做的过程中，他们运用了一种能力，这种能力能够从对整体各部分的辅助意识中产生对整体的集中意识。

Yet it would seem impossible to devise a definition which would unambiguously specify the range over which human shape may, and beyond which it may not, vary; and it is certain that those who recognize this shape are not in possession of any such explicit definition. Instead, they have exercised their art of knowing by forming a conception of the human shape. They have trusted themselves to identify noticeably different instances of what—in spite of these differences—they judge to be the same features, and to discriminate in other cases between things which, in spite of some similarities, they judge to be instances of different features. Sustained by the belief that a human type exists, they have continued to build up their conception of it by noticing human beings as instances of this type. In doing this, they have practised the kind of power used for generating a focal awareness of a comprehensive entity from a subsidiary awareness of its parts.

我已经承认我相信这种个人认知能力的威力，并指出它将在描述性科学中占据主导地位。我尤其赞同我们有能力根据我们认为合理的标准对事物（尤其是生物）进行分类，并期望由此形成的分类在未来能够通过揭示一系列未约定的共同属性而被证明是真实的。 368

I have already acknowledged my belief in the competence of this power of personal knowing, and said that it will be found to predominate in the descriptive sciences. I have endorsed especially our competence for classifying things—and living beings in particular—according to criteria which we believe to be rational, and to expect that the classes thus formed will prove real in the future, by revealing an indefinite range of uncovenanted common properties.368

现在让我再重复一遍，通过承认一个标本的正常性，生物学家根据他为该标本设立的功绩标准来评估其成就。这个过程类似于将单个晶体视为其所属晶体学类别的标本进行评估。但是，即使撇开其研究对象具有个体性中心这一重要事实不谈，生物学与晶体学的不同之处在于，生物学家的标准是经验性的。这些标准并非基于对所研究标本的总结性经验，从一个高度概括的假设中推导出来，而是由一系列概念性决策逐渐形成的，这些决策是通过对每一个新标本进行密切观察，并将其归入其被认为所属的物种而做出的。369因此，每次对一个标本进行评估时，正常的标准都会有所修改，以使其更接近该物种的真正正常水平。3370这些标准本身需要生物学家的评估。他会认为某些物种定义明确，而另一些物种则定义不明确或完全是伪物种。他也会将类似的标准应用于超种群，例如属、科、目、纲；并且他会将这些标准应用于这些物种所属的整个分类系统。

Let me repeat now also that, by acknowledging that a specimen is normal, the biologist appraises an achievement on a scale of merit that he had set up for the specimen in question. This process is similar to the appreciation of individual crystals as specimens of the crystallographic class to which they are thought to belong. But even apart from the important fact that its objects have a centre of individuality, biology differs from crystallography in that the biologist’s standards are empirical. They are not deduced from a single highly generalized assumption, based on a summary experience of the specimens in question, but are shaped piecemeal by a series of conceptual decisions, made by a close observation of every new specimen to be subsumed under the species to which it is thought to belong.369 Thus every time a specimen is appraised, the standards of normality are somewhat modified so as to make them approximate more closely to what is truly normal for the species.3370These standards are themselves subject to appraisal by the biologist. He will regard some species as well-defined, others as uncertain or altogether spurious. He will apply similar standards also to supra-specific groupings, such as genera, families, orders, classes; and he will apply them to the entire classificatory systems of which these form part.

人工分类与自然分类之间最重要的价值差异就在于此。林奈根据雄蕊和心皮的数量和排列对植物进行的分类，在区分物种和归档标本的实际用途上非常出色。但它是一种人为的体系，虽然优雅，却缺乏真正的科学美感。林奈知道这种体系并非自然，并不懈地努力用一种能够根据物种的性质揭示其​​真实亲缘关系的体系来取代它。林奈认为物种是不可改变的；371然而，他清楚地认识到自然分类的深层意义，并认为这一发现是系统植物学的起点和终点。他说，人工系统用于区分不同植物，而自然系统则用于揭示植物的本质。372

The most important difference of value lies here between an artificial and a natural classification. The Linnean classification of plants according to the number and arrangement of stamens and carpels was excellent for the practical purpose of discriminating species and filing away specimens. But it was an artificial system, elegant, but lacking in real scientific beauty. Linnaeus knew that this system was not natural, and laboured relentlessly to replace it by one that would reveal the true kinship between species according to their nature. Linnaeus believed species to be immutably fixed;371 yet he clearly appreciated the deeper significance of a Natural Classification, the discovery of which he thought the Alpha and Omega of Systematic Botany. He said that while artificial systems serve to distinguish one plant from another, natural systems serve to teach the nature of plants.372

林奈本人为动植物建立自然分类的努力，大约半个世纪后，康多勒（A.P. de Candolle）成功地继承了植物的自然分类，拉马克和居维叶（Lanmarck and Cuvier）也成功地继承了动物的自然分类。后续研究极大地扩展了这些自然分类的原则，但并未从根本上改变它们；事实上，达尔文1859年出版的《物种起源》揭示了这一体系的更深层含义，远超其作者们的设想。动植物两界及其下属的纲、目、科、属和种的等级制度，在此被重新诠释为家谱的分支，其连续的阶段可以通过古生物学来验证。

The effort made by Linnaeus himself to establish natural classifications both for plants and animals was successfully resumed about half a century later by A.P.de Candolle for plants, and by Lamarck and Cuvier for animals. Subsequent work has enormously expanded, but not changed fundamentally, the principles of these natural classifications; indeed, the publication of Darwin’s Origin of Species in 1859 revealed a deeper meaning of this system than its authors had ever clearly envisaged. The hierarchy of the two kingdoms of plants and animals, with their subordinate Classes, Orders, Families, Genera and Species, was reinterpreted here as the branches of a family tree, the successive stages of which could be verified by paleontology.

我们可以通过估算当代动植物的物种数量，以及这些物种所构成的纲的数量，来了解这个系统的规模和复杂性。1953年出版的一本标准教科书估计，已知的动物种类有112万种，373形成30个门和68个纲；374而 GNJones 在 1951 年估计已知植物种类的数量为 350,000 种。375

Some idea of the size and complexity of this system may be gleaned from the estimates of the number of species into which our contemporary fauna and flora are divided, and the number of classes formed by these species. A standard textbook published in 1953 estimates that there are 1,120,000 known species of animals,373 forming 30 phyla and 68 classes;374 while G.N.Jones estimated in 1951 the number of known plant species at 350,000.375

人们或许会以为，在生物学——这门研究动植物的科学——被教授和推崇的地方，这一宏伟成就都会受到赞誉。然而，事实并非如此；古典分类学几乎已不再被视为一门科学。其原因似乎在于知识价值的转变。这是因为人们对某些形式的认知和存在方式日益厌恶；人们越来越不愿相信自己拥有个人认知的能力，相应地，也不愿承认这种认知所确立的那些不可具体化的实体的现实性。376

One might expect to find this grandiose achievement celebrated wherever biology—the science of animals and plants—is taught and cherished. But no; classical taxonomy has almost ceased to count as a science. The explanation seems to lie in a change in the valuation of knowledge. It is due to a steadily mounting distaste for certain forms of knowing and being; a growing reluctance to credit ourselves with the capacity for personal knowing, and a corresponding unwillingness to recognize the reality of the unspecifiable entities established by such knowing.376

因为分类学的基础是鉴赏力。这种能力的本质在一位伟大的博物学家身上得到了最好的体现，他在这方面展现了极高的水平。例如约瑟夫·胡克爵士。1859年，他收集并发表了近8000种澳大利亚开花植物的资料，其中超过7000种是他亲自收集、观察和编目的。377胡克从他所观察到的个体标本中得出的8000个属名，在绝大多数情况下都被植物学家后来的观察所证实。关于胡克的特殊天赋，有人曾这样评价：“很少有人，甚至真的有人，像他一样了解植物，将来也永远不会了解……他对植物了如指掌。”378

For taxonomy is based on connoisseurship. The nature of this faculty can be best recognized in a great naturalist who displayed it to a high degree. Take Sir Joseph Hooker. In 1859 he brought together and published evidence of nearly 8000 species of flowering plants in Australia, more than 7000 of which he himself had collected, seen and catalogued.377 The 8000 generic entities which Hooker derived from the individual specimens coming under his notice, have been recognized as valid in the vast majority of cases by subsequent observations of botanists. Of Hooker’s special gifts it was said: ‘Few, if indeed any, have ever known or will ever know plants as he did…. He knew his plants personally.’378

最近，CFAPantin 描述了如何通过一种奇怪的不适感发现一种新的蠕虫物种，感觉有些不对劲，然后突然发现错误并同时意识到它非常重要——“它确实是Rhynchodemus ，但它不是 bilineatus——它是一个全新的物种！”

More recently, C.F.A.Pantin has described how a new species of worm is discovered by a peculiar feeling of discomfort that something is not quite right, followed by a sudden detection of the error and simultaneous realization that it is highly significant—‘It is a Rhynchodemus all right, but it is not bilineatus— it is an entirely new species!’

潘坦将这种识别模式称为“审美识别”，与基于关键特征的系统性识别相对。他指出，前者在田野调查中占主导地位。379

Pantin calls this mode of identification an ‘aesthetic recognition’ by contrast to a systematic recognition based on key features. He shows that the former predominates in field work.379

一个物种一旦确定，通常就通过其某些独特的关键特征来定义。但这些关键特征本身的形状是可变的，因此提及它们再次代表着对不同形态中典型形状的识别。1930 年在剑桥举行的第五届国际植物学大会明确了这一点，部分原因是为了给物种下一个定义。AJ威尔莫特说，不同的作者将植物的特征描述为“卵形、椭圆形、直立的、多毛的、纤毛的……”，但这些作者心中的属性可能大相径庭。“林奈的披针形（他继续说道）与林德利的披针形截然不同……我的同事中没有哪两个画的披针形是相同的。” 4作为标本鉴定的准则，了解关键特征是无价的，但与所有准则一样，它只对那些掌握运用技巧的人有用。380

Once a species is established it is usually defined by the presence of certain distinctive key features. But these key features themselves are variable in shape, and hence reference to them represents once more a claim to the identification of a typical shape in its variable instances. This was made clear at the Fifth International Botanical Congress, held in Cambridge in 1930, partly for the purpose of finding a definition for a species. The features of plants are characterized by different authors as ‘ovate, oval, patent, hirsute, ciliate…’ but these authors may have quite different attributes in mind, said A.J.Wilmott. ‘The lanceolate of Linnaeus (he continued) is very different from that of Lindley…. No two of my colleagues draw the same form of lanceolate.’4 The knowledge of key features is invaluable as a maxim for the identification of specimens, but like all maxims it is useful only to those who possess the art of applying it.380

然而，如此非凡的技能运用削弱了科学家在当今科学界眼中的地位，并倾向于贬低其知识及其研究内容。确定一个物种需要极高的鉴赏力，加之其研究领域极其广泛，而由此获得的知识又相对肤浅，这使得分类学家很容易被指责沉溺于主观想象。第五届国际植物学大会的与会者宣称：“大多数物种的概念必须基于个体分类学家的判断和经验。”381他们招致了这种批评。在反思这场关于物种定义的讨论时，斯哈兰德回忆起萧伯纳的《芬妮的第一部戏剧》中，戏剧评论家在回答这部戏剧是否是好戏剧的问题时，回答是：如果这部戏剧是由一位优秀的作家创作的，那么它就是一部好戏剧。哈兰德写道：“关于物种的构成，情况似乎也有些类似。”382

But the exercise of such exceptional skill weakens the position of the scientist today in the eyes of scientific opinion and tends to depreciate both his knowledge and its subject matter. The exceptionally high degree of connoisseurship required for establishing a species, combined with the enormous extension of the domain over which it is to be exercised and the comparative shallowness of the knowledge thus acquired, lays the taxonomist open to the charge of indulging in merely subjective imaginings. When members of the Fifth International Botanical Congress declared that ‘the concept of most species must rest on the judgment and experience of the individual taxonomist’,381 they invited this criticism. Reflecting on this discussion on the definition of a species, S.C.Harland recalled how in Fanny’s First Play, by Bernard Shaw, the dramatic critic replies to the question whether the play was a good play, that if the play was by a good author, then it was a good play. The situation would appear to be somewhat similar’, writes Harland, ‘in regard to what constitutes a species.’382

我认为答案就藏在萧伯纳式的笑话背后。正如优秀作家创作的剧本通常（当然并非总是）都是好剧本一样，优秀物种分类学家描述的物种通常也是好物种。换句话说：优秀的剧作家和优秀的物种分类学家凭借其公认的技巧，都享有相当大的权威。这一点对这两类作家来说都显而易见，因为他们创作的规则以及评判其作品的规则极其微妙，且完全无法具体说明。只有当你拒绝接受任何此类高度无法具体说明的知识，从而完全放弃了解一部好剧本或一个好物种的可能性——并由此彻底抹去优秀剧作家或优秀物种分类学家的概念——你才能否定任何此类人的权威。

I would suggest that the answer lies behind the Shavian joke itself. Just as plays written by good writers are, as a rule (though, of course, not always) good plays, so species described by good systematists are as a rule good species. In other words: owing to their acknowledged skill, good playwrights and good systematists alike enjoy considerable authority. This is conspicuous for both kinds of authors, because the rules by which they work and by which their work is judged are extremely delicate and altogether unspecifiable. Only if you refuse to accept any such highly unspecifiable knowledge, so that you renounce altogether the possibility of knowing a good play or a good species—and wipe out thereby the very conception of a good playwright or a good systematist— can you repudiate also the authority of any such persons.

当然，哈兰德教授在此表达的对系统形态学不精确性的普遍厌恶，并不意味着要求否认具有典型形状和结构的不同动植物的存在。哈兰德教授（以及其他表达类似倾向的科学家）只想用更客观的遗传学术语来重塑物种的概念。如此定义，物种（“基因种”）将由一个生物体的世界种群形成，其中存在——或者至少人们认为存在——在整个种群中交换染色体物质的可能性。383然而，对一个种群进行基因研究的前提是其形态上的独特性。

Of course, the widespread distaste for the inexactitude of systematic morphology, which Professor Harland expresses here, issues in no demand for denying the existence of different animals and plants of typical shapes and structures. Professor Harland (and other scientists expressing similar tendencies) would only wish to recast the concept of species in the more impersonal terms of genetics. Thus defined, a species (a ‘geno-species’) would be formed by a world population of an organism, where there is—or is at least believed to be—a potentiality for an exchange of chromosomal material throughout the entire population.383 However, the genetic investigation of a population presupposes its morphological distinctness.

观察特定种群内杂交的过程和结果本身就已十分困难，对于绝大多数已知形态的物种而言，这通常难以实现。不顾形态差异而进行遗传实验，仅仅为了根据这些差异来界定特异性的界限，这种做法荒谬至极。这当然从未被设想过​​。

The task of observing the process and the outcome of interbreeding within a given population is difficult enough and often quite impracticable for the vast majority of known morphological species. To undertake genetic experiments irrespective of morphological differences, with the intention of establishing from these alone the boundaries of specificity, would be absurd. It has certainly never been contemplated.

所有其他近期提出的旨在使分类学建立在更客观基础上的测试方法也同样如此。得益于I. Manton的工作，细胞学对蕨类植物的形态系统进行了非常有趣的修正和扩展。1但是，这类测试的范围仍然相对有限，而且最重要的是，它必须依赖现有的形态系统作为指导。

The same is true of all other tests that have been recently suggested with a view to placing taxonomy’on more objective foundations. Thanks to the work of I.Manton, cytology has yielded very interesting corrections and amplifications of the morphological system of ferns.1 But, once more, the range of such tests is comparatively limited, and above all, it has to rely on the existing morphological system for its guidance.

归根结底，如果你想让地球上种类繁多的动植物井然有序，首先必须观察它们。全世界有数十亿只昆虫爬行、游动、穴居和跳跃，它们大约有80万个物种。如果不关注它们独特的形状和标记，任何识别和区分这些繁多昆虫的测试方法显然都行不通。

It all comes down to this. If you want to bring order into the multitude of animals and plants on earth, you must first of all look at them. Many thousands of millions of insects are crawling, swimming, burrowing and hopping all over the world and they fall into about 800,000 species. To apply any kind of test for identifying and discriminating these teeming multitudes, without paying attention to their characteristic shapes and markings, would be obviously impossible.

当然，没有人提出过这种建议。所有旨在应用附加的、特别是更客观的分类学测试的项目，都将其任务设定在现有的形态学体系内。他们提出，通过将其他生物学分支的方法（无论是遗传学和细胞学的更客观的测试，还是解剖学、生理学、组织学、生态学、植物地理学和动物地理学等的描述性方法）应用于现有体系，来修改现有体系，或仅仅是为了更好地理解现有体系。这当然不会废除自然史，转而采用基于客观测试的体系。然而，现代生物学界普遍认为，自然史的原始概念是一种沉思而非分析的成就。 384

Of course, nobody has suggested this. Projects for the application of additional, and in particular more objective, taxonomic tests, have all set themselves their tasks within the existing morphological system. They propose to amend it or merely to understand it better, by bringing to bear on the existing system the methods of other branches of biology, whether the more objective tests of genetics and cytology, or the descriptive methods of anatomy, physiology, histology, ecology, phyto- and zoo- geography, etc. This would certainly not abolish Natural History in favour of a system based on objective tests. Yet the deprecation of the original conception of Natural History as a contemplative, rather than an analytical, achievement persist throughout modern biology.384

这并不意味着，观察动植物，并通过仔细研究它们的形状和行为，了解它们生存形态的乐趣，在我们这个时代的博物学家中已经消失了。远非如此；听听KZLorenz的说法：

Not that the joy of seeing animals and plants and of entering into their forms of existence, by carefully studying their shapes and behaviour, is extinct among the naturalists of our time. Far from it; listen to K.Z.Lorenz:

我可以自信地断言（他写道），即使拥有超人的耐心，也没有人能够坚持不懈地注视鱼类、鸟类或哺乳动物，以便了解一个物种的行为模式，除非他的眼睛被他观察的对象迷住，这种目光并非出于有意识地努力去获取知识，而是被生物之美对我们中的一些人产生的神秘魅力所驱使！ 385386

I confidently assert (he writes) that no man, even if he were endowed with a superhuman patience, could physically bring himself to stare at fishes, birds or mammals, as persistently as is necessary in order to take stock of the behaviour patterns of a species, unless his eyes were bound to the object of his observation in that spellbound gaze which is not motivated by any conscious effort to gain knowledge, but by that mysterious charm that the beauty of living creatures works on some of us!385386

事实上，生物学仍然是对生物的研究，其价值最终源于对生物的内在兴趣——这是人类普遍的兴趣，而自然史极大地拓宽和深化了这种兴趣。对动植物进行的实验研究仍然毫无意义，除非它们与我们通过日常经验和自然史所了解的动植物相关。

Indeed, biology remains the study of living beings, deriving its value ultimately from the intrinsic interest of living things—a general human interest which Natural History has immensely widened and deepened. Experimental studies made on animals and plants remain meaningless, except through their bearing on animals and plants as known to us by ordinary experience and through Natural History.

当然，如果科学研究证明某个主题实际上是虚幻的，那么它完全有可能摧毁我们对它的兴趣。天文学起源于巴比伦时代，作为占星术的一部分，最终证明了占星术是虚幻的；而最初在炼金术框架内兴起的化学研究，最终推翻并取代了炼金术。如果实验生物学能够推翻动植物的存在——或者至少证明它们所谓的典型形状及其系统分类是虚幻的——就像星座的形状是虚幻的一样——那么实验生物学或许确实可以取代自然史，并因其自身而受到研究，而无需与自然史产生关联。追求这一点无疑是愚蠢的，但至少是一致的。然而，我们却遭遇了现代知识分子典型的搪塞手法，这种手法最早由康德在其规范原则中系统化。我们认为真实且对我们至关重要的知识被轻视，因为我们无法用批判哲学来解释它是如何被接受的。于是，我们觉得自己有权继续运用这些知识，即便我们通过贬低这些知识来抬高自己的智力优越感。事实上，我们仍然坚定地依赖这些被鄙视的知识来指导和赋予我们更精确的探究意义，同时假装只有这些知识才符合我们科学严谨的标准。

Of course, the scientific study of a subject matter may justifiably destroy our interest in it if it proves that the matter is in fact illusory. Astronomy, which started in Babylonian times as part of astrology, eventually proved astrology to be illusory; and the study of chemistry, originally initiated within the framework of alchemy, finally discredited and replaced alchemy. If experimental biology could discredit the existence of animals and plants—or at least prove that their alleged typical shapes and their systematic classifications are illusory—in the sense in which the shapes of constellations are illusory—then experimental biology might indeed supersede Natural History and be studied for its own sake, without bearing on Natural History. To aim at this would no doubt be foolish, but at least it would be consistent. Instead, we meet with the typical device of modern intellectual prevarication, first systematized by Kant in his regulative principles. Knowledge that we hold to be true and also vital to us, is made light of, because we cannot account for its acceptance in terms of a critical philosophy. We then feel entitled to continue using that knowledge, even while flattering our sense of intellectual superiority by disparaging it. And we actually go on, firmly relying on this despised knowledge to guide and lend meaning to our more exact enquiries, while pretending that these alone come up to our standards of scientific stringency.

如果一贯否认科学的沉思价值，将会切断生物学与其起源的智识激情，最终必然会完全否定生命存在之物的科学实在性。当然，生物学或许可以明智地摒弃其自诩的哲学，继续蓬勃发展（就像其他科学分支一样）。但随着我们进一步深入研究，我们将会发现，这种说法并非完全可靠。

If consistently carried out, the denial of contemplative value in science would cut off biology from the intellectual passions from which it takes its origin, and could not stop short of denying altogether scientific reality to the beings in which life manifests itself. Of course, biology may continue to flourish vigorously (as other branches of science have done) by wisely disregarding its own professed philosophy. But we shall see, as we proceed further, that this cannot be altogether relied upon.

 

 

  1. 形态发生
  2. MORPHOGENESIS

我们从研究典型形状上升到研究其形成的科学，从评价生命形式上升到评价再生和胚胎生长的过程，从而达到生物学成就的第二个层次。

We ascend to the second level of biological achievement, by passing from the study of typical shapes to the science dealing with their coming into being: from the appraisal of living forms to the appraisal of the processes of regeneration and embryonic growth.

再生是指残缺生物体的修复。一些低等动物，例如水螅或涡虫，拥有非凡的再生能力，它们身体的微小碎片能够再生为完整的个体。387这是一种植物中常见的营养性无性繁殖方式。它构成了从再生到有性个体发生的过渡，可以理解为由两个亲本配子融合形成的碎片再生出一个完整的个体。Driesch发现，任何从海胆分节阶段胚胎中分离出来的细胞或细胞群都能发育成完整的胚胎，这又是再生向个体发生的另一种延伸。 388

Regeneration is the restoration of a mutilated organism. Some lower animals, like hydra or planaria, have exceptional powers of regeneration, so that tiny pieces of their body will regenerate to complete individuals.387 This is a manner of vegetative, a-sexual reproduction, commonly found in plants. It forms a transition from regeneration to sexual ontogenesis, which may be regarded as the regeneration of a complete individual from a fragment formed by the fusion of two parental gametes. The fact discovered by Driesch that any cell or cell-group, detached from the embryo of a sea urchin at the stage of segmentation, grows into a complete embryo is another extension of regeneration into ontogenesis.388

但完全再生并非普遍现象，在再生的极限下，我们遇到了形态发生的另一条原理，该原理用一个固定潜能系统取代了所有可分离碎片的等势性。如果将处于二细胞或四细胞阶段的海鞘受精卵切成两半，每一半都只能发育成半个胚胎。389虽然这种个体发生模式始终受调控倾向的影响，但其原理可以清晰地区分为一系列独立进行的生长过程。生物体由多个部分构成，这些部分必须相互衔接，并在时机成熟时随时准备协同运作。这种由独立进行的互锁序列组成的镶嵌结构与Roux和Weismann在Driesch观察到等势性之前所提出并普遍推行的个体发生概念相符。原肠的入口主导着胚胎的进一步分割。如果将胚胎切开，其中任何部分，如果存在这种主导性

But complete regeneration is not universal, and at the limits set to regeneration we meet another principle of morphogenesis, which replaces the equipotentiality of all detachable fragments by a system of fixed potentialities. If the fertilized Ascidian egg in the two or four cell stage is cut in two, each half develops only into half an embryo.389 Though this type of ontogenesis is never free of regulative tendencies, its principle can be clearly distinguished as a pattern of independently proceeding processes of growth. The organism is built up in sections which must fit together and be ready to function together when the moment arrives for it. Such a mosaic of independently proceeding interlocking sequences corresponds to the conception of ontogenesis which Roux and Weismann had formulated and made universally current before Driesch’s observations on equipotentiality. entrance of the primitive gut which dominates the further segmentation of the embryo. If the embryo is cut up, any part of it in which this dominant

Driesch 的调节原理和 Roux-Weisman 的镶嵌原理实际上是联合运作的。这在 Spemann 的局部胚胎组织者原理中得到了揭示。Spemann 发现在原肠胚阶段的蝾螈胚胎中，有一个特定的区域与被包含（或植入）的区域相邻，该区域将继续进一步发育，而在被消除的胚胎组织中，个体化停止。因此，占主导地位的区域，即组织者所在的位置，将其控制下的整个区域塑造成一个完整的胚胎，而不管其几个组成细胞先前有何分化特征，这些细胞对组织者的刺激作出等势反应。这种刺激对其控制区域的影响归因于组织者的形态发生场。390在这个阶段，个体的形态发生能力集中在一个组织器中；但很快，这个组织器中心分裂成多个组织子中心，每个子中心通过其场控制胚胎某一部分的发育。之后，这些子组织器又按阶段分化成二级，甚至可能是三级的特化子组织器，每个子组织器控制着肢体、肢体的一部分，或个体逐渐分化过程中出现的其他器官或特征的发育。一个拥有自身组织器的分离区域可能会被切断，然后继续孤立地分化——例如，产生一个孤立的肢体。在这个更高的阶段，胚胎的发育可以被视为一个由相互关联的独立序列组成的镶嵌体，每个序列都由其组织器控制，而等势性在由各自组织器控制的几个形态发生场的范围内被削弱。这种镶嵌体

The regulative principle of Driesch and the mosaic principle of Roux- Weisman actually operate in combination. This is revealed in Spemann’s principle of localized embryonic organizers. Spemann found that in the newt embryo at the gastrula stage there is a certain region adjoining the region is included—or in which it is engrafted—will proceed to develop further, while in the embryonic tissue from which it is eliminated, individuation comes to a stop. Thus the dominant region, which is the seat of the organizer, moulds a whole region under its control into one complete embryo, irrespective of any previously differentiated character of its several component cells, which respond equipotentially to the organizer’s stimulus. The effect of this stimulus on the area under its control is ascribed to the organizer’s morphogenetic field.390 The morphogenetic powers of the individual are localized at this stage in a single organizer; but presently this centre splits up into sub-centres of organization, each of which controls by its field the development of one section of the embryo. Later, these suborganizers divide up in their turn by stages into secondary, and possibly tertiary, specialized sub-organizers, each of which controls the development of a limb, or part of a limb, or of some other organ or feature emerging from the progressive differentiation of the individual. A segregated area provided with its own organizer may be cut off with it and will then go on differentiating in isolation— producing, for example, an isolated limb. At this higher stage the development of the embryo may be regarded as a mosaic of interlocking independent sequences, each controlled by its organizer, while equipotentiality has been reduced within the confines of the several morphogenetic fields controlled by their separate organizers. This mosaic

但为了完善这幅形态发生的图景，即使只是最粗略的轮廓，我们也必须补充一个事实：胚胎组织并不总是无条件地服从于组织者的场域。沃丁顿根据胚胎学观察定义了这种准备状态，并称之为组织的“能力”。391根据他的嫁接实验的结果，P.Weiss 更普遍地确定了“除非细胞内在地做好了准备，否则场不能使任何细胞产生任何特定的反应”。392由于这种情况，组织者所起的作用可能是所有这些形态发生的原理都是由 Wilhelm Roux 于 1885 年首次应用的新实验方法发现的。393这项工作始终基于先前对结构（des-structure）的了解，结构预示着成年高等动物中特定再生能力的固定定位。简化为对其影响下的组织中已形成的潜能的单纯唤起。这引发了胚胎组织固有的形态发生潜能与邻近组织主导影响下诱导的形态发生潜能之间的广泛竞争。描述性胚胎学，其依赖于先前对系统形态学的了解。因此，正是这些描述性科学共同设定了评估正常胚胎阶段实现正常形状的标准，而实验胚胎学则试图分析迄今为止以描述性方式定义的表现。因此，这里概述的形态发生原理可以用来定义实现形态学意义上的个体发生成功的操作。在本研究中，我们在不同的条件下对形态形成的几个因素进行了独立的测试，并通过再生、移植、毒性介质影响等实验观察了它们的运作。虽然研究将扩展到异常形态的产生，但这些过程的兴趣在于它们与正常发育的关系。

But to complete this picture of morphogenesis even in the crudest outline, we must yet add the fact that embryonic tissues do not always submit unconditionally to the field of an organizer. This preparedness was defined from embryological observations by Waddington and called the ‘competence’ of the tissue.391 As the result of his grafting experiments, P.Weiss established more generally that ‘a field cannot make any cell produce any specific response unless that cell is intrinsically prepared to do so’.392 Owing to this condition, the part played by the organizer may be All these principles of morphogenesis were discovered by the new experimental methods applied for the first time by Wilhelm Roux in 1885.393 The work was based throughout on a previous knowledge of des-structure prefigures the fixed localization of specific regenerative powers found in the adult higher animal. reduced to a mere evocation of the potentialities preformed in the tissue subjected to its influence. This opens up a wide range of rivalry between the morphogenetic potentialities that are proper to an embryonic tissue and those induced in it by the dominant influence of adjacent tissues. criptive embryology, which relied in its turn on a previous knowledge of systematic morphology. It was these descriptive sciences, therefore, that jointly set the standards for appraising the achievement of normal shapes by normal embryonic stages, and experimental embryology was thus an attempt to analyse hitherto descriptively defined performances. The morphogenetic principles sketched out here may accordingly be taken to define operations for the achievement of ontogenetic success conceived in morphological terms. In the pursuit of this study several factors of form achievement are tested in isolation and under variable conditions, and their operation observed also by experiments of regeneration, of transplantation, of the influence of toxic media, etc. While the investigation will thus extend to the production of abnormal forms, these processes derive their interest from their bearing on normal development.

在上一章中，我区分了两种类型的生物学成就：（1）由多个具有固定功能的部分合理协同作用而产生的成就；（2）由系统所有部分等势相互作用而产生的成就。在形态发生中，第一种类型，即机械型，存在于基于固定潜能镶嵌的独立互锁形态发生序列策略中；第二种类型，即整合型，存在于由组织者场诱导的形态发生成就，以及孤立组织的自主形态发生反应中。由于这两种理性原则的合理结合，胚胎发生似乎是一种综合性的成就。

In the previous chapter I have distinguished two kinds of biological achievements, namely, (1) achievements performed by the rational concurrence of several parts with fixed functions and (2) achievements performed by the equipotential interplay of all parts of a system. In morphogenesis the first, machine-like, type is present in the stratagem of independent interlocking morphogenetic sequences, based on a mosaic of fixed potentialities; the second, integrative, type is found in the morphogenetic achievements induced by the field of an organizer, as well as in the autonomous morphogenetic responses of isolated tissues. Embryogenesis appears to be a comprehensive achievement due to the rational combination of these two types of rational principles.

对生物形成过程的分析与成就逻辑相符，正如我们探究机器运作方式的方式所示。我们必须从对系统整体性能的一些先验知识入手，将系统拆解开来，以发现每个部分如何与其他部分协同运作。任何此类分析的框架在逻辑上都由引发它的问题所决定。其内容可以无限扩展，并由此进一步深入形态发生的物理和化学机制；但其意义始终在于它与那些从形态发生场的镶嵌中涌现的、符合类型的生命结构的关系。

The analysis of the process by which living beings are formed corresponds to the logic of achievement, as illustrated by the manner in which we find out how a machine works. We must start from some anterior knowledge of the system’s total performance and take the system apart with a view to discovering how each part functions in conjunction with the other parts. The framework of any such analysis is logically fixed by the problem which evoked it. Its content may be extended indefinitely and it may penetrate thereby ever further into the physical and chemical mechanism of morphogenesis; but its meaning will always lie in its bearing on living structures that are true to type, emerging from a mosaic of morphogenetic fields

因此，实验胚胎学的意义双重依赖于个人知识：既包括对真实形状的模糊认知，也包括对极其重要的形状和结构诞生过程的理解。这种情况引起了科学家们的不安。保罗·韦斯抱怨道：“形态发生学仍处于从描述性‘自然史’向分析科学的过渡阶段。”他发现，当将高精度的现代物理和化学工具应用于以这种不太精确的术语表述的问题时，结果同样不精确且模棱两可。1 FSC诺斯罗普和HS伯尔在1937年发表的关于生命电动力学理论的总结中，表达了更为激进的这一抱怨。 394395他们认为，物理化学解释与德谟克利特的科学哲学相符，而“感知组织”则是亚里士多德的概念。但是：“亚里士多德和德谟克利特的科学哲学并不相容。” 因此，在生物学中，我们被要求用对生物体产生的电动力场的观察来取代生物体的可见外观。CMChild 也同样坚持认为，形态分化必须用量化的术语来定义，否则我们将不可避免地陷入“枯燥的新活力主义假设”。396

The meaning of experimental embryology is thus doubly dependent on personal knowledge: both in respect of the unspecifiable knowledge of true shapes, and in respect of the appreciation of the process by which highly significant shapes and structures are brought into existence. This situation has caused uneasiness among scientists. ‘Morphogenesis’—complains Paul Weiss—‘is still in the transition phase from descriptive “natural history” to analytical science.’ He finds that when modern physical and chemical tools of great precision are applied to problems formulated in such less precise terms, the results are equally imprecise and ambiguous.1 This complaint was voiced even more radically by F.S.C.Northrop and H.S.Burr in a summary of their electro-dynamic theory of life, published in 1937.394395 Physico-chemical explanations, they suggest, correspond to a Democritean philosophy of science, while ‘perceived organization’ is an Aristotelian concept. But: ‘The Aristotelian and Democritean philosophies of science do not combine.’ Hence we are asked to replace in biology the visible appearance of organisms by an observation of the electrodynamic field produced by them. C.M.Child had insisted likewise that morphological differentiation must be defined in quantitative terms, since otherwise we are inevitably led to ‘barren neo- vitalistic assumptions’.396

在整个文献中，“活力论”一词被用作谴责术语，就像沃勒和李比希使用的那样，目的是抹黑威胁更客观框架的证据。397然而，在这种情况下，并不存在这样的客观框架。至今无人认真设想过，我们可以在不注意生物的情况下研究它们；然而，一旦我们注意到它们，我们依赖的正是“德谟克利特式”科学必然忽略的那些特征。事实上，完整的“德谟克利特式”或拉普拉斯式知识，如果不依赖我们对这些综合特征的亲身了解，就无法告诉我们任何信息。假设我们获得了一张完整的地形图，上面列出了我们周围发生的所有物理化学变化。要从这些信息中发现像鸡这样的东西，它们是由蛋孵化出来的，这需要超人的洞察力。但假设我们能够做到这一点——我们能够做到这一点，并由此熟悉鸡及其蛋孵化的过程——我们获得的关于形态发生的综合视角，仍然只是我们普通洞察力所能获得的那种。

Throughout this literature the word ‘vitalistic’ is used as a term of condemnation, even as Wöhler and Liebig used it, for the purpose of discrediting evidence which threatened a more objectivistic framework.397 However, in this case no such objectivistic framework exists. No one has yet seriously envisaged that we should study living beings without noticing them; yet as soon as we do notice them we are relying on those very features which a ‘Democritean’ science must ignore. Indeed, a complete ‘Democritean’ or Laplacean knowledge can tell us nothing without relying on our personal knowledge of these comprehensive features. Suppose we were given a complete topographical chart of all physico-chemical changes taking place in our surroundings. It would require a superhuman feat of insight to discover from this information the fact that there are somewhere such things as chickens, which are hatched from eggs. But suppose we could do this—that we could achieve this feat and became familiar through it with chickens and their hatching from eggs—we should still have gained only the same kind of comprehensive view of morphogenesis as our ordinary insight conveys to us.

但是——我们可能会问——鸡、鸡蛋等等的形状难道不能用数学术语来确定吗？那么，我们难道不能对形态发生给出一个精确且严格客观的描述吗？不，我们不能；因为即使基于这个荒谬的假设（诺斯罗普和伯尔似乎以他们自己的方式设想了这一点），我们最终仍然依赖于普通的形态学观察。正常形状——不同于异常、畸形、发育不良的形状——必须先根据我们自己的正确性标准来识别，然后才能用数学术语定义它们。数学关系就像物理和化学过程一样，对于形态发生的成败是中性的；因此，我们必须先识别这些可能性，然后才能用数学或物理和化学术语来分析它们。 398

But—we may be asked—could the shape of chickens, eggs, etc. not conceivably be determined in mathematical terms? Could we not give then an exact and strictly objective account of morphogenesis? No, we could not; for even on this fantastic assumption (which Northrop and Burr seem to have envisaged in their own way) we would be still ultimately relying on ordinary morphological observations. Normal shapes—as distinct from abnormal, malformed, stunted shapes—would have to be identified by our own standards of rightness before they could be defined in mathematical terms. Mathematical relations are, like the processes of physics and chemistry, neutral in respect to morphogenetic success or failure; these alternatives must therefore be identified by ourselves before we can analyse them in terms of mathematics or physics and chemistry.398

我们可以得出这样的结论：我们通过洞察来识别单个植物和动物的生命，区分它们的不同种类，并评估它们是正常还是异常，从而确定它们形成过程的成功或失败，这些洞察揭示了我们无法通过其他渠道接触到的现实，因此形态发生的机制永远只能是对与该现实明确的模式和过程的观察和理解。

We may conclude that the insights by which we recognize life in individual plants and animals, and distinguish their several kinds—and by which we appraise them as normal or abnormal, establishing thereby the success or failure of the process by which they come into existence—that these insights reveal a reality to which we have access by no other channels, and that the mechanism of morphogenesis can therefore never amount to anything but the observation and understanding of patterns and processes expressly bearing on that reality.

 

 

  1. 活体机械
  2. LIVING MACHINERY

植物和动物体内都拥有大量精妙的器官，用于造福生物体。动物比植物更富有活力，拥有的器官也更多。数百项专利的权利要求都描述了动物器官如何合理地相互作用，以实现其各种功能。这些专利所定义的运作原理，即动物生理学的原理。

Both plants and animals have a great many ingenious devices within their bodies which are used for the benefit of the organism. Animals, operating more energetically than plants, are much richer in them. Claims for hundreds of patents could be found by describing the rational interaction of the animal’s organs in the service of its various interests. The operational principles defined by such patents would be the principles of animal physiology.

我在上一章分析了我们对机器的认识。要识别机器，首先必须至少粗略地猜测它们的用途和工作原理。然后，可以通过技术研究进一步明确它们的工作原理。物理学和化学可以确定它们成功运行的条件并解释可能出现的故障，但用物理化学术语对一台机器进行全面的描述将彻底瓦解我们对该机器的认识。399

I have analysed in the previous chapter our knowledge of machines. They can be recognized as such only by first guessing, at least approximately, what they are for and how they work. Their operational principles can then be specified further by technological investigations. Physics and chemistry can establish the conditions for their successful operation and account for possible failures, but a complete specification of a machine in physico-chemical terms would dissolve altogether our knowledge of the machine.399

工程学的逻辑也适用于生理学，但略有不同。人体器官比机器部件更复杂多变，其功能也更难明确定义。判断一个好的螺旋桨的形状并诊断其可能存在的缺陷可能需要相当的鉴赏能力，而判断心脏的形状及其可能出现的畸形则需要更精细的技能。了解动物学已知的所有动物器官的形状和位置，构成了庞大的形态学信息；动物学是一门描述性科学。此外，任何特定的功能都可以通过多种方式实现。例如，在呼吸时，胸部两侧、横膈膜和颈部肌肉可以进行各种协调。与机器相比，这降低了生物体性能的可指定性，并再次增强了生理学的描述性。

The logic of engineering applies also to physiology, but with some modifications. The organs of the body are more complex and variable than the parts of a machine, and their functions are also less clearly specifiable. While considerable connoisseurship may be required to judge the shape of a good air-screw and to diagnose any possible defect of it, the skill needed for judging the shape of a heart and its possible malformations is more delicate. A knowledge of the shape and location of the organs in the whole variety of animals known to zoology forms a vast body of morphological information; it is a descriptive science. Moreover, any particular function can be performed in a great many ways. In breathing, for example, the two sides of the chest, the diaphragm, and the muscles of the neck may be used in variable co-ordinations. This reduces the specifiability of a living performance as compared with that of a machine and contributes once more to the descriptive character of physiology.

因此，在生理学中，组织形状及其内部发生的过程的双重不可指定性，加上一般操作原理所固有的不可指定性，就此而言，生理学的逻辑不同于工程学的逻辑。否则，这两种情况都有相同的关系。对一个器官的研究必须从尝试猜测它的用途和工作原理开始。只有这样，才能通过结合生理学和物理化学研究进行更进一步的研究，这两种研究都与它们有助于阐明的有目的的生理框架有关。任何不顾生理学假设而试图对生物体进行物理化学研究的行为，通常都会导致毫无意义的结果；任何试图用生物体的物理化学图表完全取代生理学的行为，都会彻底瓦解对生物体的任何理解。 400

Thus in physiology, the twofold unspecifiability of organized shapes and of the processes occurring within them is added to the inherent unspecifiability attached to operational principles in general, and to this extent the logic of physiology differs from that of engineering. Otherwise we have the same set of relations in both cases. The study of an organ must begin with an attempt to guess what it is for and how it works. Only then can it proceed further by combined physiological and physico- chemical enquiries, both being conducted with a bearing on the purposive physiological framework which they help to elucidate. Any attempt to conduct physico-chemical investigations of a living being irrespective of physiological assumptions will lead as a rule to meaningless results; and any attempt to replace physiology altogether by a physico-chemical chart of the living organism would completely dissolve any understanding of the organism.400

当然，生命机器的唯一目的就是为了观察者所评估的生命个体的利益。但它必须拥有这个目的。器官及其功能只有在与生命个体的假定利益相关时才存在。所有生理学都是意识形态的，从这个意义上讲，我们也可以在这里谈论理由和原因。我们说循环系统中有瓣膜的原因是为了防止血液反流；而尽管有瓣膜，我们却将任何反流的原因归咎于畸形或疾病导致的瓣膜功能不全。生理学是一套正确规则，因此只能解释健康。因此，我们不会探究健康的原因——就像我们不会探究数学证明的原因一样；但我们会探究疾病的原因，就像我们探究数学错误的原因一样。

Of course, living machinery has a purpose only in the interest of the living individual as appraised by the observer. But it must possess this purpose. Organs and their functions exist only in their bearing on the presumed interest of the living individual. All physiology is Ideological, and in this sense we may speak here also of reasons and causes. We say that the reason for having valves in the circulatory system is to prevent the regurgitation of the blood; while we ascribe the causes of any regurgitation, occurring in spite of these, to an insufficiency of the valves owing to malformation or disease. Physiology is a system of rules of rightness, and as such can account only for health. Accordingly, we do not enquire into the causes of health—any more than into the causes of a mathematical proof; but we do enquire into the causes of disease, as we do into the causes of a mathematical error.

再次，正如形态学和形态发生学一样，每个生物的存在本身都被视为一个目标；无论跳蚤或肝吸虫对我们来说多么令人厌恶，我们都承认其器官为了自身利益而合理运作。因此，生理学的纯科学兴趣最终取决于促使我们追求自然史的激情。它依赖于那些解释我们赋予生物本身重要性的激情；依赖于其内在的利益，以及我们对它现状以及应有状态的思考。

Once more, as in morphology and morphogenesis, the existence of every living being is acknowledged as an aim in itself; however nasty a flea or liver fluke may be to us, we recognize the rational functioning of its organs in their own interest. The purely scientific interest of physiology depends, therefore, ultimately on the passions which make us pursue Natural History. It relies on the passions which account for the importance which we attribute to a living being in itself; on its intrinsic interest, and on our contemplation of it as it is—and as it ought to be.

根据现行的进化论，所有生命机械的出现都是偶然的，其存在仅仅是因为它赋予了构成其组成部分的个体生物以竞争优势，从而确保了其物种的生存。这种进化观（我将稍后详细论述）会排除生物系统发育中任何真正的成就；但即便如此，这也不会影响其机械结构的目的论性质，这种性质在逻辑上是内在地存在于共同运作器官的概念之中的。

According to the current theory of evolution all living machinery has come into existence by accident and is found in existence only because it has conferred on the individual living beings, of which it forms part, competitive advantages which have secured the survival of their kind. This conception of evolution (to which I shall yet return in detail) would eliminate any true achievement from the phylogenesis of living beings; but even so this would not affect the teleological character of their machinelike equipment, which is logically inherent in the conception of jointly functioning organs.

 

 

  1. 行动与感知
  2. ACTION AND PERCEPTION

到目前为止，我已经概述了生物体的存在、生长和功能，并将其作为知识的主题。这些植物的生活方式在植物和动物中都很常见；但它们在动物中通常更为显著，也更为人所知，因此我从动物学中选取了一些例子。接下来我将探讨生物学作为关于行动和感知的知识，这将专门适用于动物研究。这里所说的行动，通过深思熟虑，将不同于单纯的器官功能。这假设了一种有意识的动机的驱动，我称之为驱动力。401“知觉”一词在此将以其通常含义使用，指通过外部对象在我们感官上留下的印象来认识该对象的过程。因此，我将忽略原始感知的早期阶段，从一开始就设想知觉具有自觉的辨别能力，尽管它尚未具备深入思考的能力。这一阶段大致相当于人类摆脱幼稚的自闭症，并将外部世界视为充满危险的行为和认知领域的过渡阶段。

I have surveyed so far the being, the growing and the functioning of organisms as subject matters of knowledge. These vegetative manners of living are common to plants and animals; yet they are usually more striking and better known in animals, and hence I took my examples from zoology. The examination of biology as a knowledge of action and perception, to which I shall now proceed, will apply exclusively to the study of animals. Action will be taken here to differ, by being deliberate, from the mere functioning of organs. This assumes the prompting of a conscious motive which I shall call a drive.401 The term ‘perception’ will be applied here in its usual sense, to designate the process of getting to know an external object by the impression made by it on our senses. Disregarding thus the earlier stage of protopathic sentience, I shall envisage perception from the start as consciously discriminating, even though not yet capable of strenuous deliberation. This stage corresponds about to the transition by which human beings emerge from childish autism and recognize the world outside as a field of hazardous doing and knowing.

在存在、成长或运作的层面上，个体可能因异常、畸形或患病而失败。积极主动、善于感知的人还有两种出错的可能性，即主观性和错误；同样，观察者也有责任去体会这些缺陷所损害的正确性。除非在这些方面进行立法，否则你无法观察到刻意的行为或感知。

At the level of being, of growing, or of functioning, an individual could fail through being abnormal, malformed or diseased. The active, perceiving person has two more possibilities for going wrong, namely, subjectivity and error; and again, it falls to the observer to appreciate the rightness which is impaired by these shortcomings. You cannot observe deliberate action or perception except by legislating for it in these respects.

以高等动物的喂养为例，这是一种有意识的行为。这可以定义为食物的摄入。但由于我们只将我们认为有营养的、或至少对动物无害的物质视为“食物”，因此，我们有责任在一定程度上确定什么是正确的喂养方式。这通常远非显而易见。当一只羊吃掉另一只羊背上的羊毛，或者牛吃骨头时，未经训练的人可能会反对这种行为，认为这是一种反常行为，但生理学家却认可这种行为，认为这是对动物饮食中某些矿物质缺乏的一种补偿。然而，并非动物吃的所有东西都有营养，甚至并非都是有益健康的。用砷或士的宁很容易毒害动物，或者像钓鱼者用苍蝇那样欺骗它们。老鼠会喝没有营养价值的糖精溶液，圈养的猿猴会吃它们的粪便，而这些粪便似乎完全没有作为食物的价值。在所有这些情况下，观察者的判断可以评估什么是正确的喂养，什么是错误的喂养。

Take the feeding of a higher animal as an example of conscious action. This may be defined as the ingestion of food. But since we recognize as ‘food’ only materials which we believe to be nutritive, or at least not deleterious to the animal, it falls to us to this extent to determine what is right feeding. This is often far from obvious. When a sheep eats the wool off the back of another sheep, or cattle eat bones, the uninstructed may object to this as an aberration, but physiologists approve of it as a compensation for certain mineral deficiencies in the animal’s diet. Yet not everything that animals eat is nutritive or even wholesome. It is easy to poison animals by arsenic or strychnine, or to deceive them as the angler does by his fly. Rats will drink saccharine solution, which has no nutritive value, and captive apes eat their faeces, which seem to be quite useless as food. In all these cases it is the observer’s judgment which appraises what is right and what is wrong feeding.

这种判断的性质取决于这样一个事实：进食通常由一种本能驱动。爱狗人士会痛苦地意识到他的狗在呜咽着要吃东西时的饥饿；老鼠对甜味的享受是它吃糖精溶液的唯一原因。认识到这一点，我们承认动物体内存在一个理性中心，我们将其正确和错误的决定都归因于此。从这个意义上讲，我们不赞同老鼠喝糖精溶液，认为它纯粹是一种主观满足，而将鱼吞食钓鱼者的蝇饵归类为在其他方面完全理性的进食方式中出现的合理错误。另一方面，我们否认一个疯狂吞食纸张或沙子的人具有任何程度的理性；这种虚假的进食行为将被归类为毫无意义的行为。这是一种强迫性的病理过程，由病态的心理所承受，因此应被归类为纯粹被动的身体畸形。

The nature of this judgment is qualified by the fact that feeding is normally actuated by a drive. The dog-lover is painfully conscious of his dog’s hunger when it whines for food; the rat’s enjoyment of a sweet taste is the only reason that can be found for its feeding on a solution of saccharine. In recognizing this we acknowledge the presence of a rational centre in the animal, to which we attribute both its correct and its mistaken decisions. In this sense we shall deprecate the drinking of a saccharine solution in a rat, as offering a purely subjective satisfaction, and class the swallowing of an angler’s fly by a fish as a reasonable error in an otherwise altogether rational way of feeding. On the other hand, we shall deny to a maniac devouring paper or sand any degree of rationality; this kind of false feeding will be classed as a meaningless act. It is a compulsive pathological process, endured by the diseased mind and as such to be classed with purely passive bodily malformations.

感知过程具有类似的逻辑结构。只要调节努力与视网膜图像的大小之间存在某种关系，接近眼睛的物体就会被视为恒定。更准确地说，当视网膜图像和适应努力都发生变化时，我们共同意识到两者之间的某些关系，而这些变化体现在在不同距离处看到的物体的大小保持不变。如果观察者本人认可其中隐含的断言，即物体确实保持了恒定的大小，那么他就会认为这是正确的表现。但也可能出现这种情况，就像前面提到的艾姆斯的实验一样，观察者通过给物体（一个橡皮球）充气来改变其大小，而受试者没有注意到。我们已经看到，受试者可能会增加调节努力，就好像物体正在接近他一样，并通过看到膨胀的物体以恒定的大小靠近，从而意识到这种增加的调节努力与增大的视网膜图像的结合。在这种情况下，看到恒定的大小可以被视为合理的错误。另一方面，如果由于阿托品中毒而增加了一定程度的调节所需的努力，就会看到接近的物体缩小到很小的尺寸，而其尺寸的缩小会使它看起来更远；但由于我们知道这不可能是真的，所以我们会知道这种异常现象具有欺骗性。 402那么，我们就应该把它看作是感知者的一种主观体验，从感知者的角度来看，这是理性的，但从其他角度来看则不然。403再者，我们知道幻觉，其虚假性无法用主观理性或合理错误来解释；它们缺乏理性。

The process of perception has a similar logical structure. An object approaching the eye is seen as constant, so long as a certain relationship prevails between the effort of accommodation and the size of the retinal image. More precisely, we are jointly aware of the retinal image and of the adaptive effort, as well as of certain relations of the two, while both are undergoing a change, in terms of the constant size of an object seen at variable distances. The observer of this process of perception will regard it as a correct performance if he himself endorses the affirmations implied in it, namely that the object did in fact remain of constant size. But it may happen, as in the experiments of Ames already mentioned, that unnoticed by the subject, the observer alters the size of the object—a rubber-ball— by inflating it. We have seen that the subject may then increase his accommodation as if the object were approaching him and become aware of this increased effort in its conjunction with an increased retinal image, by seeing the swelling object as coming nearer at constant size. In this case the seeing of a constant size may be regarded as a reasonable error. On the other hand, if the effort required for a certain measure of accommodation is increased by atropin poisoning, an approaching object will be seen shrinking to a tiny size and the reduction of its size will make it appear farther off; but owing to our knowledge that this cannot be true we shall know this anomalous appearance to be deceptive.402 We shall regard it then as a subjective experience of the perceiving person which is rational from his own point of view, but not otherwise.403 And again, we know of hallucinations, the falsity of which cannot be accounted for either by subjective rationality or reasonable error; they are devoid of reason.

我们在此探讨了一些原始的承诺形式，生物学也揭示了对承诺的欣赏。吞下某种东西并希望它有益健康显然是一种承诺，以特定方式看待事物的每一种行为也是一种承诺。我之前曾提出，即使在植物层面，承诺也应该被广义地认可，因为生物体的本质在于，每个部分的功能，以及其作为生物体一部分的意义，都依赖于许多其他部分的存在和正常运作。1从这个意义上讲，我们对生物体正常生长、功能和存在的认识，是对生物体原始承诺的评估，这种评估认可了生物体的成功。承诺可以通过意识的提升来划分等级；即从存在、功能和生长中心的原始、植物性承诺，到主动感知中心的原始承诺，进而到有意识地深思熟虑的人的负责任的承诺。 “生物学是生命反思自身”这句格言如今获得了更完整的含义。生物学是一种负责任的承诺，它评估其他的承诺。在其通常的狭义上，生物学是一种负责任的承诺，它评估原始的和最原始的承诺。但我将突破这一表述所隐含的局限性，立即着手将对负责任的承诺的评估（包括对我自身信念的论证）视为一系列不断上升的生物学观察的延伸，超越生物学，进入一个可以称为“超生物学”的领域。

We have met here some primitive forms of commitment, and biology has been revealed as an appreciation of commitment. To swallow something in the hope that it may be wholesome is clearly a commitment, and so is every act of seeing things in one particular way. I have suggested before that in a generalized sense commitment may be acknowledged even at the vegetative level, since it is of the essence of a living organism that each part relies for its function, and for its very meaning as part of the organism, on the presence and proper functioning of a number of other parts.1 In this sense our knowledge of the normal growth, functioning and being of the organism is an appraisal of its primordial commitments which accredits their success. Commitment may then be graded by steps of increasing consciousness; namely, from primordial, vegetative commitment of a centre of being, function and growth, to primitive commitment of the active-perceptive centre, and hence further again, to responsible commitments of the consciously deliberating person. The aphorism that biology is life reflecting on itself now acquires a fuller meaning. Biology is a responsible commitment which appraises other commitments. In its usual narrower sense, biology is a responsible commitment which appraises primordial and primitive commitments. But I shall break through the limitation implied in this formulation and proceed presently to consider the appraisal of responsible commitments (which includes the justification of my own convictions) as the extension of an ascending series of biological observations beyond biology, into a domain that may be called ‘ultra-biology’.

我之前已经讨论过植物层面的摩尔特征；现在让我总结一下在主动感知层面上新增的特征。它们是动机感知和

I have dealt before with the molar features that characterize the vegetative level; let me now sum up the new features that are added to these on the active-perceptive level. They are sentience of motive and

在形态和植物层面，我们只有两类评估：正常和异常：健康或疾病。感知的介入将我们的​​评估范围扩大到四个重要的类别：

On the morphological and vegetative level we had only two classes of appraisal: namely normality and abnormality: health or disease. The intervention of sentience enlarges our scale to four significant classes:

（1）正确满足正常标准，

(1)a correct satisfaction of normal standards,

（2）对正常标准的错误满足，

(2)a mistaken satisfaction of normal standards,

（3）满足主观、虚幻标准的行为或感知，

(3)action or perception satisfying subjective, illusory standards,

（4）精神错乱导致无意义的反应。

(4)mental derangement issuing in meaningless reactions.

知识；努力做正确的事并真正了解；相信存在一个独立的现实，使这些努力变得有意义，并意识到随之而来的危险。

knowledge; an effort to do right and know truly; a belief that there exists an independent reality which makes these endeavours meaningful, and a sense for the consequent hazards.

前三种评价是正常个体的评价，第四种情况是病态的。这种分类表明，生物体拥有感知能力、有目的的行为以及对外部事物的认知，这使得我们对生物体的认识提升到批判性认识的层面。

The first three kinds of appraisals are those of a normal individual, the fourth case is pathological. This classification shows that the presence in a living being of sentience, purposive action and the knowing of external things elevates our knowledge of the living being into a critical meeting of it.

通过对主体处理和认知事物的方式进行批判，生物学变得三层结构。我们个人的认知由此变成了对主动意图意义的感知，我们试图理解它，并根据其所依据的事实进行判断。事实上，它是对一种愉悦交流的接收，并接受我们自身的批判性评价。

By including a critique of the handling and the knowing of things by its subjects, biology becomes three-storied. Our personal knowing becomes then the perceiving of an actively intended meaning, which we are trying both to understand and to judge with a view to the facts on which it bears. It is, in fact, the reception of a convivial communication, subject to its critical appraisal by ourselves.

我们对饥饿动物选择食物的理解，或对警觉动物聆听、观察并对其所注意到的事物做出反应的理解，都是一种个人认知行为，其结构类似于动物自身的个人行为，而我们对动物的认知正是对其自身行为的评估。因此，如果我们用对其多种表现的焦点认知来取代我们对主动感知动物的认知，那么我们对它的认知将完全消失。只有通过辅助性地意识到这些细节，并结合对动物个体的焦点认知，我们才能知道动物在做什么、在做什么。此外，当一个综合实体的次要细节像这些情况一样高度复杂多变时，试图具体化它们只能突显一些特征，而这些特征的含义将继续依赖于一个我们只能在对相关实体的理解范围内才能了解的不可具体化的背景。换句话说，只有通过解读动物行为的细节（或通过解读其行为背后的思想）才能理解动物行为的含义，而不能像观察无生命过程那样通过观察行为本身来理解。

Our understanding of the hungry animal choosing its food, or of an animal on the alert listening, watching and reacting to what it notices, is an act of personal knowing similar in its structure to the animal’s own personal act which our knowing of it appraises. And accordingly, our knowledge of the active-perceptive animal would dissolve altogether if we replaced it by our focal knowledge of its several manifestations. Only by being aware of these particulars subsidiarily, in relation to a focal awareness of the animal as an individual, can we know what the animal is doing and knowing. Besides, when the subsidiary particulars of a comprehensive entity are as highly complex and variable as in these cases, attempts to specify them can do no more than highlight some features, the meaning of which will continue to depend on an unspecifiable background that we only know within our understanding of the entity in question. In other words, the meaning of an animal’s actions can be understood only by reading the particulars of its actions (or by reading its mind in terms of these actions) and not by observing the actions themselves as we may observe inanimate processes.

行为主义者主张，在观察动物时，我们首先要克制自己，不要试图想象自己如果处于动物的位置会怎么做。而我认为，恰恰相反，除非遵循相反的准则，即把自己与动物的行为中心联系起来，并用我们为动物设定的标准来评判它的行为，否则，我们根本无法了解任何与生理学，更不用说与心理学相关的信息。

Behaviourists teach that in observing an animal we must refrain above all from trying to imagine what we would do if placed in the animal’s position. I suggest, on the contrary, that nothing at all could be known about an animal that would be of the slightest interest to physiology, and still less to psychology, except by following the opposite maxim of identifying ourselves with a centre of action in the animal and criticizing its performance by standards set up for it by ourselves.

 

 

  1. 学习
  2. LEARNING

在对生物学知识的上升阶段进行快速概述时，我必须忽略该主题的许多方面。现在，我将着手反思我们关于学习的知识，而不考虑动物原始行为和感知能力中由学习而来的成分。我还将完全忽略动物行为学的领域，专注于基于动物实验的学习心理学。我将利用我之前对这一主题的论述，主要使用之前提到的例子。

In this rapid survey of the ascending stages of biological knowledge I must disregard many aspects of the subject. I shall proceed now to reflect on our knowledge of learning, without taking into account the component due to learning in the animal’s capacity for primitive action and perception. I shall also leave out altogether the domain of ethology, and concentrate on the psychology of learning, based on animal experiments. I shall take advantage of my earlier treatment of this subject by using mainly examples already mentioned there.

首先以辨别箱实验为例。心理学家将动物置于一个情境中，该情境会对其一些主要驱动力（通常是饥饿感）产生影响。只有当 (1) 动物能够识别问题并做出反应，并且 (2) 这个问题需要相当程度的创造力，但不超过动物实际拥有的创造力时，学习过程才会从这种安排中产生。提供给动物的有限选择迫使它以一种可以被归类为正确或错误的方式做出反应（如果它真的会做出反应的话）。此外，实验的设计使得动物必须在特定的时间和空间点上在正确和错误之间做出选择。实验情境的狭窄性往往会在选择点上加剧动物的困惑状态，使其达到在更广泛的自然环境中不太可能达到的紧张状态。因此，实验室既强化了动物进行启发式努力的时刻，也凸显了动物的活跃中心提升到进行智能判断的那一刻。

Take first experiments with the discrimination box. Here the psychologist places the animal in a situation which constitutes a problem for the satisfaction of some of its major drives, usually hunger. A process of learning will originate from this arrangement only if (1) the animal recognizes the problem and responds to it, and if (2) this problem demands an appreciable measure of ingenuity, but not more than the animal in fact possesses. The limited alternatives offered to the animal force it to respond (if it responds at all) in a manner that can be classed as correct or false. Moreover, the experiment is so devised that the animal’s choice between a correct and a false response has to be made at a particular point in time and space. The narrowness of the experimental situation tends to key up the animal’s state of perplexity at a choice point, to a tension which is not likely to be reached in the wider circumstances of nature. Thus the laboratory both intensifies and spotlights the moments of heuristic effort by which the animal’s active centre rises to the performance of an intelligent judgment.

我之前已经给出过证据，稍后我会进一步阐述。同时，请允许我提醒一下，我们之前已经将符号学习等同于归纳推理的过程。404因此，动物如何学会识别符号？（或者，如果用反射语言来说，动物如何适应特定刺激？）这个问题本质上类似于认识论问题：如何从经验中得出正确的概括？动物对我们自身设计的事件进行概括，这一事实在这方面与人类并无区别，因为作为主体，动物和我们自身都面临着我们无法控制的事件。405

I have given evidence for this before, which I shall presently expand further. Meanwhile let me recall that we have identified sign-learning with a process of inductive inference.404 The question: How does an animal learn to recognize a sign? (or if the reflex language is preferred, How is an animal conditioned to a particular stimulus?) is therefore essentially akin to the epistemological question: how can correct generalizations be drawn from experience? The fact that the animal is generalizing about events engineered by ourselves does not distinguish it from us in this respect, since as subjects both the animal and we ourselves are faced with events beyond our control.405

但也存在一些差异。认识论反思我们自认为拥有的知识；心理学家研究的是他认为他人获得的知识，同时也研究这些知识的不足之处。任何知识，无论是我们自己的知识还是老鼠的知识，都无法完全具体化；但我们必须依靠自身对老鼠行为的了解来识别老鼠的知识或无知，这一事实需要额外的探究和额外的不可具体化性。我还要补充一点（鉴于在动物实验中，学习的成果必须始终体现在恰当的行为中），为了简洁起见，我在此将把技巧学习归入符号学习，除非该技巧显然是从已知元素中设计出来的，例如科勒的猿猴实验。406从一开始，我就完全承认所有类型的学习中都存在潜在学习，尽管在某些情况下几乎不存在这种学习。

But there are certain differences. Epistemology reflects on knowledge which we ourselves believe we possess; the psychologist studies knowledge which he believes to have been acquired by another individual and studies also the shortcomings of such knowledge. No knowledge, whether our own or that of a rat, is fully specifiable; but the fact that we must rely on recognizing the rat’s knowledge, or ignorance, from our own knowledge of the rat’s behaviour, involves an additional enquiry and an additional unspecifiability. Let me add also that (in view of the fact that in animal experiments the achievement of learning must always manifest itself in appropriate behaviour) I shall subsume here, for brevity, trick- learning under sign-learning, except when the trick is manifestly contrived from known elements, as in Köhler’s experiments on apes.406 I shall also admit fully, from the start, the presence of latent learning in all types of learning, though in some cases it is found almost lacking.

现在我们可以看看学习实验的各种替代结果。

We can now run through the various alternative outcomes of learning experiments.

（1）只有当根据动物的行为判断，我们相信它已经形成了我们认为是其问题的正确解决方案的概括时，我们才认为学习已经完全实现。在格思里所用的实验中，学习纯粹是偶然发生的，因此随后的概括通常会包含许多无关的因素。（这时，可以说动物犯了错误，就像原始人犯了错误一样，原始人无法清楚地知道是他的斧头，还是伴随斧头砍伐的咒语，砍倒了树木。）正确的概括必须没有这样的错误。它应该能够充分理解问题情境，从而确定成功的必要条件。聪明的汉斯面对着一块对他毫无意义的黑板，通过观察实验者敲击地面时的行为，找到了获得实验者奖励的答案。这种概括可以被认为是主观正确的，因为它是在动物能力范围内能够建立的最合理的概括。同样，我们也可以认为红绿色盲者通过次要符号区分两种颜色的概括是主观正确的。错误的“初始假设”（“总是向右转”或“总是向左转”或“左右交替”）的形成也可以归入此类。407

(1)We consider that learning has been fully achieved only if, judging by the animal’s behaviour, we believe that it has formed a generalization which we consider to be the correct solution to its problem. In experiments of the type used by Guthrie, in which learning is achieved by pure accident, the ensuing generalization will usually contain many irrelevant elements. (The animal may be said to be mistaken then in the sense in which primitive man is, who does not know clearly whether it is his axe, or the incantation by which he accompanies its strokes, that fells the tree.) A correct generalization must be free of such errors. It should offer a sufficient understanding of the problematic situation for establishing the necessary conditions of success.Clever Hans, faced with a blackboard which meant nothing to him, found a solution to the problem of obtaining the reward offered by the experimenter, by watching the man’s behaviour while he, Hans, was tapping the ground. This generalization may be regarded as subjectively correct, as it was the most reasonable that could be established within the range of the animal’s competence. We may similarly regard as subjectively correct the generalization by which red-green colour blind people distinguish by means of secondary signs the two kinds of colouring. The forming of false ‘initial hypotheses’ (‘turn always to the right’, or ‘always to the left’, or ‘alternately right and left’) may be also classed in this category.407

（2）拉什利 (Lashley) 和弗朗兹 (Franz) (1917) 在对“问题箱”进行实验时发现，一只老鼠从笼顶坠落，意外打开了箱子，在放弃该方法之前，它曾尝试重复这一壮举五十次，但都失败了。408这只老鼠做出了错误的概括。

(2)Lashley and Franz (1917), experimenting with a ‘problem box’, observed that a rat which accidentally opened the box by a fall from the roof of the restraining cage, attempted to repeat this feat fifty times in vain before the method was abandoned.408 This rat had formed a mistaken generalization.

（3）大脑严重受损的老鼠什么也学不会。它们在迷宫里四处乱窜。患有实验性神经症的老鼠则表现出强迫症。409这些动物并不具有普遍性。

(3)Rats with extensive cerebral destruction never learn anything. In a maze they move about at random. Rats suffering from experimental neurosis behave obsessively.409 These animals form no generalizations.

我们用来对合理行为和感知进行分类的四个等级，在经验推理的分类中再次出现。我们将其分为：(1) 客观合理推理，(2) 合理错误，(3) 主观合理推理，以及 (4) 非合理，即无推理。同样，每个等级都根据观察者根据其自身对所设问题的理解而设定的标准来评估主体的表现。

The four grades according to which we classified reasonable action and perception reappear here in the classification of empirical inferences. We have (1) objectively reasonable inference, (2) reasonable error, (3) subjectively reasonable inference, and (4) unreason, i.e. no inference. And once more, each of these grades assesses the subject’s performances by standards set for it by the observer, from his own understanding of the problem he has set to it.

但我们也注意到，从(4)到(1)，对普遍性的主张愈发坚定，同时启发式冲动也愈发活跃，两者共同作用的结果是一种更强烈的承诺行为。从完成性行动转向感知时，这种三重重点的转变已经显而易见。实际上，第二部分和第三部分通过将学习与问题解决联系起来，已经预见到了这一点。因为问题暗示了一种隐藏的理性关系，人们认为这种关系可以通过启发式努力来获得，即使在动物中，这种关系的发现也可能伴随着对其自身创造力的生动享受。通过寻找这种隐藏的关系并最终欣然接受，动物会寻求比食物或性更客观满足的东西，从这个意义上讲，随之而来的承诺变得更加彻底。自我中心的欲望让位于个人主张；易腐烂的东西披上了不腐烂的外衣。

But we notice also, proceeding from (4) to (1), a hardening of the claims to universality, combined with a quickening of the heuristic impulse, and as a joint result of these a more emphatic act of commitment. This threefold shift of emphasis could already be noticed when passing from consummatory action to perception. It has been actually anticipated already in Parts Two and Three by the linking of learning to problem- solving. For a problem is the intimation of a hidden rational relationship which is felt to be accessible by an heuristic effort, and the discovery of which may be accompanied, even in animals, by the lively enjoyment of their own ingenuity. By searching for such a hidden relation and by its eventual joyful acceptance, the animal reaches out towards something more objectively satisfying than food or sex, and in this sense the ensuing commitment becomes more radical.
