189正如 RBBraithwaite 在1953 年剑桥出版的《科学解释》第 272 页中所说，“非归纳政策不是启动器”。

189 As when R.B.Braithwaite in Scientific Explanation, Cambridge, 1953, p. 272, says, ‘The non-inductive policies are not starters’.



190高达 90% 的受试者可能会预测接下来出现的是迄今为止非优势的选择（J.Cohen 和 CEMHansel，《风险与赌博》，伦敦、纽约、多伦多，1956 年，第 10-36 页）。

190 Up to 90 per cent of the subjects may predict that the hitherto non-preponderant alternative will appear next (J.Cohen and C.E.M.Hansel, Risk and Gambling, London, New York, Toronto, 1956, pp. 10–36).



191奥斯卡·普丰斯特 (Oskar Pfungst)，《Das Pferd des Herrn von Osten》（Der kluge Hans），莱比锡，1907 年。

191 Oskar Pfungst, Das Pferd des Herrn von Osten (Der kluge Hans), Leipzig, 1907.



192莫里斯·R·科恩（Morris R. Cohen）在批判传统“归纳法则”时总结道：“如果我们的大前提中没有包含真正的原因，那么‘归纳法则’就无法让我们发现它。如果有人认为我低估了这些归纳法则作为发现方法的适用性，那就让他用它们来发现癌症或内分泌失调的原因吧。”（《逻辑学序言》，伦敦和纽约，1944年，第21页）

192 Morris R.Cohen concludes a critique of the traditional ‘canons of induction’ by saying: ‘If the true cause is not included in our major premise the “canons of induction will not enable us to discover it. If anyone thinks that I have understated the case for these canons of induction as methods of discovery, let him discover by their means the cause of cancer or of disorders of internal secretion’ (A Preface to Logic, London and New York, 1944, p. 21).



193“聪明汉斯谬误”还有一种变体，可以称之为“你不会错过”的错觉。对某个地区非常熟悉的人最不擅长给陌生人指路。他们会告诉你“一直往前走就行”，却忘记了你必须在岔路口决定该往哪走。他们没有意识到自己指的路完全是模棱两可的，因为在他们看来，这些路并非如此。所以他们自信满满地说：“你不会错过的。”

193 There is a variant to the Clever Hans fallacy in what may be called the illusion of ‘You can’t miss it’. Persons very familiar with a district are the worst at giving directions to a stranger. They tell you ‘just to keep going straight on’, forgetting the forks at which you will have to decide which way to go. They cannot realize that their indications are altogether ambiguous, because to them they are not. So they say confidently, ‘You can’t miss it’.



194“物质优势”应排除象征性表达或人际互动的实现。因此，建造教堂和监狱，或制造手铐，都是技术任务，但这些物品的最终用途并非技术的一部分。“工具”一词旨在指代所有三类有用之物：材料、设备和工艺。遵循“特定规则”的行动排除了艺术表演。

194 ‘Material advantages’ should exclude inter alia the achievement of symbolic expression or of human interactions. Thus the construction of churches and prisons or the manufacture of handcuffs are tasks of technology, but the ultimate uses of these objects are not part of technology. The word ‘implement’ is meant to designate all three classes of useful things: materials, devices and processes. Action according to ‘specifiable rules’ excludes artistic performances.



195这里的操作原理将包括构造原理，这些原理告诉我们如何建造机器或房屋等技术设备。

195 Operational principles will be taken to include here the constructional principles which tell us the way technical devices, like machines or houses, are to be built.



196法律可以尝试授予一项新发现未来实际应用的垄断权；但没有专利法允许这样做，因为这是不切实际的。法律由此再次明确了自然事实知识（通过发现获得）与操作原理知识（通过发明获得）之间的区别。

196 The law could try to grant a monopoly for the future practical applications of a new discovery; but no patent law docs this, for it is impracticable. The law endorses thereby once more the sharp distinction between a knowledge of the facts of nature (achieved by discovery) and the knowledge of an operational principle (achieved by invention).



197JROppenheimer，“国际机构在研究和发展中的职能”，《原子科学通报》，1947 年，第 173 页。另见 VBWigglesworth，“纯科学对应用生物学的贡献”，《应用生物学年鉴》，42 （1955 年），第 34-44 页。谈到致力于解决实际战时问题的纯科学科学家，Wigglesworth 写道：“在他们习惯的纯科学中，如果他们无法解决问题 A，他们可以转向问题 B，而在研究这个问题时，也许成功的希望很小，他们可能会突然遇到解决问题 C 的线索。但现在他们必须找到问题 A 的解，而且​​只能找到问题 A 的解，而且​​别无选择。此外，事实证明，游戏规则令人厌烦且出乎意料，使游戏不必要地困难：有些解决方案被禁止，因为没有足够的原材料；其他解决方案被禁止，因为所需材料太昂贵；还有一些人则被排除在外，因为他们可能对人类生命或健康构成威胁。简而言之，他们发现，应用生物学并非“低智商者的生物学”，而是一门完全不同的学科，需要完全不同的思维态度。（第34页）

197 J.R.Oppenheimer, ‘Functions of the International Agency in Research and Development’, Atomic Scientific Bulletin, 1947, p. 173. See also V.B.Wigglesworth, ‘The Contribution of Pure Science to Applied Biology’, The Annals of Applied Biology, 42 (1955), pp. 34–44. Speaking of pure scientists working on practical war-time problems, Wigglesworth writes: ‘In the pure science to which they were accustomed, if they were unable to solve problem A they could turn to problem B, and while studying this with perhaps small prospect of success they might suddenly come across a clue to the solution of problem C. But now they must find a solution to problem A, and problem A alone, and there was no escape. Furthermore, there proved to be tiresome and unexpected rules which made the game unnecessarily difficult: some solutions were barred because there was not enough of the raw material available: others were barred because the materials required were too costly; and yet others were excluded because they might constitute a danger to human life or health. In short, they made the discovery that applied biology is not “biology for the less intelligent”, it is a totally different subject requiring a totally different attitude of mind’ (p. 34).



198关于隐藏在经验技术中的一系列未公开的知识，请参见上文第 52 页。

198 On the range of undisclosed knowledge buried in empirical technology, see p. 52 above.



199在刚刚引用的威格斯沃思的演讲中（第178页，注1），作者描述了生物学领域中纯科学与应用科学之间的各种关系。这两个“完全不同的学科”可能在许多方面互利互惠。例如，对于纯科学科学家来说，“对过度专业化风险最有效的矫正方法之一是通过实践接触的刺激”（第36页）。另一方面，应用生物学家可能会求助于纯科学来系统地解释其实践发现（第38页）；当然，应用生物学家“在思考任何实际问题时……都会不断运用关于其所有组成部分的全部科学知识”（第40页）。然而，当局被警告，这种互利最终取决于纯生物学不受应用学科更狭隘要求的约束：“……DSIR……为任何具有卓越‘时效性和前景’的研究提案提供资助。”困难在于，即使是最原创的想法，一开始也往往既没有前景，又不合时宜。只有完全不受束缚的研究才能在最没有前景的领域取得进展……我非常怀疑，如果……

199 In the address by Wigglesworth just cited (p. 178, n. 1), the author describes the varying relationships which obtain between pure and applied science in the biological field. These two ‘totally different subjects’ may contribute to each other’s good in a number of ways. E.g. for the pure scientist ‘one of the most efficient correctives to the dangers of over-specialization is provided by the stimulus of contact with practice’ (p. 36). On the other hand, applied biology may turn to pure science for the systematic explanation of its practical discoveries (p. 38); and of course the applied biologist ‘in thinking about any practical problem…is continually making use of the whole range of scientific knowledge that exists about all its component parts’ (p. 40). Yet the authorities are warned that this mutual advantage depends in the last analysis on the independence of pure biology from the narrower demands of the applied subject: ‘…the D.S.I.R…. makes grants for any research proposals which are of exceptional “timeliness and promise”. The difficulty is that the most original ideas are at the outset both unpromising and untimely. Only research which is totally unfettered can advance into the most unpromising fields…. I very much doubt whether it would have been reasonable for the



200下一章将探讨这种转变的机制。

200 The mechanism of this transformation will be examined in the next chapter.

201 P. 141 above.



202斯蒂芬·朗西曼，《拜占庭文明》，伦敦，1936 年，第 IX 章；以及约瑟夫·李约瑟，《中国科学技术史》，第 2 版，剑桥，1956 年，第 26-9、84 页。

202 Stephen Runciman, Byzantine Civilization, London, 1936, ch. IX, and Joseph Needham, Science and Civilization in China, 2, Cambridge, 1956, pp. 26–9, 84.



203利顿·斯特雷奇，《微型肖像》，伦敦，1931 年，第 23 页。

203 Lytton Strachey, Portraits in Miniature, London, 1931, p. 23.



204参见WMSmart，《约翰·库奇·亚当斯与海王星的发现》，《自然》，158，（1946年），第648-652页。或者，听听鲍尔如何评论拉兰德，如果当时他相信自己在1795年5月8日和10日所见的景象，他本应在当年就发现海王星。“但如果他真的相信了，那对科学界来说将是多么令人惋惜的损失。海王星的发现将仅仅是对一位辛勤工作者的意外奖励，而不是人类理性最崇高领域中最辉煌的成就之一。”（RSBall爵士，《天体的故事》，伦敦，1891年，第288页）。2 关于传统，另见上文第53页。

204 See W.M.Smart, ‘John Couch Adams and the Discovery of Neptune’, Nature, 158, (1946), pp. 648–52. Or listen to Ball commenting on the fact that Lalande would have discovered Neptune in 1795 if only he had believed what he saw on the 8th and 10th of May in that year. ‘But had he done so, how lamentable would have been the loss to science. The discovery of Neptune would then merely have been an accidental reward to a laborious worker, instead of being one of the most glorious achievements in the loftiest department of human reason’ (Sir R.S.Ball, The Story of the Heavens, London, 1891, p. 288). 2 On tradition, see also p. 53 above.



205参见 T.Dobzhansky，《俄罗斯生物科学的命运》，《汉堡科学与自由大会论文集》，伦敦，1955 年，第 216 页。试图根据科学的实际成功来定义科学，已经被证明在逻辑上是站不住脚的（参见上文第 169 页）。

205 See T.Dobzhansky, ‘The Fate of Biological Science in Russia’, Proceedings of the Hamburg Congress on Science and Freedom, London, 1955, p. 216. The attempt to define science in terms of its practical success has already been shown to be logically untenable (see p. 169 above).



206一些来自更遥远领域的类比或许能阐明这里所涉及的原则。假设精神病学家认定，只有恢复宗教信仰才能遏制精神神经病的普遍增长；但这并不能让我们都信仰上帝。事实上，没有任何别有用心的优势能让我们相信上帝，而如果我们相信上帝，也没有任何随之而来的劣势能让我们丧失信仰。或者假设美国人民通过对英国经验的研究明确得出结论，如果他们的共同感情寄托在国王和皇室家族身上，他们会生活得更亲密。但这本身不会产生这样的感情，也不会在美国建立君主制。真正的感情永远不会被别有用心的动机所产生；他们必须发现并维持对自身的满足。

206 Some parallels from remoter fields may throw light on the principle involved here. Suppose it were decided by psychiatrists that a general increase in psychoneurotic ailments could only be checked by a restoration of religious faith; this would not make us all believe in God. In fact no ulterior advantage can make us believe in God, while if we do believe in God no consequent disadvantage can make us lose our faith. Or suppose that the people of the United States came clearly to the conclusion from a study of British experience that they would live together more intimately if their common affections were attached to a King and a Royal Family. This would not in itself produce such affections, or establish a monarchy in the U.S. No genuine affections can ever be produced by ulterior motives; they must discover and uphold their satisfaction in themselves.



207请记住，解决问题的数学练习有两种类型，其中一种（“证明......”）是一种设计，就像在技术中一样，而另一种（“找到一个X使得......”）是一种发现，就像在科学中一样。

207 Remember in this connection that mathematical exercises in problem-solving are of two types, one of which (‘prove that…’) is a contriving, as in technology, while the other (‘find an X such that…’) is a discovering, as in science.



208莱布尼茨早已提出过这个问题，只是由于戴德金 (1872) 在欧几里得公理中增加了一条新公理才得以消除（Weyl，上引书，第 40 页）。达瓦尔和吉尔博在《数学原理》 （法国大学出版社，1945 年）中细致地追溯了概念的逐步发展及其随之而来的严谨性提高的过程，其中描述了导致博尔扎诺定理的一系列创造性行为。起点在于逐步逼近的基本过程，通过这一过程，我们可以以任意精度确定诸如x 3 =4 之类的方程的解。这种方法在 16 世纪末就已为人所知。但由于任何近似都无法给出解，因此这种方法留下了一个悬而未决的问题——通过方程的推广和几何表达，这个问题变得更加清晰。如果方程y 3 =4，或更一般地，f(x)=c，则表示为以下形式：

208 The scruple in question was raised already by Leibniz and was eliminated only by the addition of a new axiom by Dedekind (1872) to those of Euclid (Weyl, op. cit., p. 40). The process of successive conceptual development and accompanying increase of rigour has been meticulously traced by Daval and Guilbaud in Le Raisonnement Mathématique (Presses Universitaires de France, 1945), for the series of creative acts leading up to Bolzano’s theorem. The starting point lay in the elementary process of successive approximation by which we can determine to any degree of accuracy the solution of an equation such as x3=4. This method was known by the end of the sixteenth century. But since no approximation gave the solution, this method left open a problem—a problem which became clearer through the generalization and geometric expression of the equation. If the equation y3=4, or more generally, f(x)=c, is expressed in the form:

 

 

￼

￼

解将位于曲线y=f(x)与直线 y = c 的交点处。但如何保证两者会相交呢？柯西于 1821 年证明了该定理（后来称为波尔扎诺定理）：如果f (x)在区间x = a, x = b内连续，且 c 是介于f (a)和f (b)之间的数，则方程f (x)=c在区间(a, b)内始终至少有一个解。但“连续性”是什么意思呢？借助收敛概念，柯西定义了连续性：如果函数(x)在点a连续

the solution will lie at the intersection of the curve y=f(x) and the line y=c. But what guarantees that the two will meet? Cauchy, in 1821, proved the theorem (since called Bolzano’s): if f (x) is continuous in the interval x=a, x=b, and if c is a number lying between f (a) and f (b) the equation f (x)=c has always at least one solution in the interval (a, b). But what is meant by ‘continuity’? With the help of the conception of convergence, Cauchy defined continuity: a function (x) is continuous at point a if

￼

￼

因此，最重要的连续性理念就显现出来了，达瓦尔和吉尔博说，“grace à un see jeté Sure une opération mentale déjàeffectuée, mais qui se cristallise du fait que l'esprit treate ce qu'il a fait au lieu de continuer à faire”（第 117 页）。

Thus the all-important idea of continuity came to light, say Daval and Guilbaud, ‘grâce à un regard jeté sure une opération mentale déjà effectuée, mais qui se cristallise du fait que l’esprit regarde ce qu’il a fait au lieu de continuer à faire’ (p. 117).



209比照。 Émile Borel，L'Imaginaire et le Réel en Mathématiques et en Physique，巴黎，1952 年，第 14 页。 100：“……但是数学的一般性，是数学定义的本质，是一种独特的定义。”

209 Cf. Émile Borel, L’Imaginaire et le Réel en Mathématiques et en Physique, Paris, 1952, p. 100: ‘…le but généralement poursuivi par les mathématiciens, c’est de trouver pour chacune des êtres mathématiques qu’ils ont défini, une propriété distincte de leur definition.’



210 2 G.H.Hardy，《一位数学家的辩解》，剑桥，1940 年，第 71-83 页。

210 2 G.H.Hardy, A Mathematician’s Apology, Cambridge, 1940, pp. 71–83.



211KRPopper，《英国科学哲学杂志》，1 （1950-1），第194页。庞加莱似乎用下面的话指出了同样的重要条件：“发现恰恰不在于构建无用的组合，而在于构建有用的组合，而这些有用的组合是极少数。”（《科学与方法》，伦敦，1914年，第51页）

211 K.R.Popper, British Journal for the Philosophy of Science, 1(1950–1), p. 194. Poincaré seems to point out the same condition of significance in the words: ‘Discovery consists precisely in not constructing useless combinations, but in constructing those that are useful, which are an infinitely small minority’ (Science and Method, London, 1914, p. 51).

217 同上。另见第119页，阿达玛在其中写道，伽罗瓦（1811-1831）的发现直到他去世后才被重视：“所有这些深刻的思想最初都被遗忘了，直到十五年后，科学家们才满怀钦佩地注意到了科学院拒绝的这份报告。它标志着高等代数的彻底变革，将迄今为止最伟大的数学家们仅仅瞥见的东西投射到更广阔的视野中，同时，将这个代数问题与其他科学分支中的其他问题联系起来。”

217 loc. cit. See also ibid., p. 119, where Hadamard writes of the discoveries of Galois (1811–1831), which were appreciated only after his death: ‘All these profound ideas were at first forgotten and it was only after fifteen years that, with admiration, scientists became aware of the memoir which the Academy had rejected. It signifies a total transformation of higher algebra, projecting a full light on what had been only glimpsed thus far by the greatest mathematicians, and, at the same time, connecting that algebraic problem with others in quite different branches of science’.

223因此，诗歌中的陈述并非IA·理查兹所说的“伪陈述”，至少与几何学中的陈述不同。（参见IA·理查兹，《科学与诗歌》，伦敦，1926年，第六章，“诗歌与信仰”，第55页及后续章节）阐释艺术作品中隐晦的暗示或许有助于我们欣赏它：毕加索在纽约现代艺术博物馆对其一幅立体主义作品的视觉阐释，引导观者的目光更好地理解作品。另一方面，A·E·豪斯曼在《诗歌的名称与性质》（剑桥，1933年）中，阐述了追寻爱伦·坡《闹鬼宫殿》中象征主义的精确含义所带来的灾难性后果。我儿时的一些挚爱诗歌，在我不理解它们的时候，曾带给我更多真正的快乐。

223 The statements made in a poem are, therefore, not ‘pseudo-statements’, as I.A. Richards called them, at least not any more than those of geometry. (See I.A.Richards, Science and Poetry, London, 1926, ch. VI, ‘Poetry and Beliefs’, pp. 55 ff.) The elucidation of obscure hints in a work of art may help us to enjoy it: Picasso’s visual explanation of one of his cubistic pictures in the Museum of Modern Art in New York guides the viewer’s eye to a better understanding of it. On the other hand, A.E.Housman, in The Name and Nature of Poetry (Cambridge, 1933), demonstrates the disastrous effects of tracing the precise meaning of the symbolism in Poe’s ‘Haunted Palace’. Some of my favourite poems gave me more genuine pleasure as a child, when I did not understand them.

关于建筑中的暗示性，参见杰弗里·斯科特，《人文主义建筑》，第二版，纽约，1954年，第95页：“建筑……是一门关于空间和实体的艺术，是可衡量事物之间可感知的关系，是明显力量之间的相互协调，是像我们一样受制于某些基本规律的物质实体的组合。重量与阻力、负担与努力、虚弱与力量，都是我们自身体验中的元素，并且在这种体验中与安逸、喜悦或苦恼的感受密不可分。但重量与阻力、虚弱与力量，也是建筑中显而易见的元素，建筑通过它们演绎出一种人类戏剧。通过它们，机械问题的机械解决方案获得了审美趣味和理想价值。”

On allusiveness in architecture, see Geoffrey Scott, The Architecture of Humanism, 2nd edn., New York, 1954, p. 95: ‘Architecture…is an art of spaces and of solids, a felt relation between ponderable things, an adjustment to one another of evident forces, a grouping of material bodies subject like ourselves to certain elementary laws. Weight and resistance, burden and effort, weakness and power, are elements in our own experience, and inseparable in that experience from feelings of ease, exultation, or distress. But weight and resistance, weakness and power, are manifest elements also in architecture, which enacts through their means a kind of human drama. Through them the mechanical solutions of mechanical problems achieve an aesthetic interest and an ideal value.’



224奥尔德斯·赫胥黎在其著作《知觉之门》（伦敦，1954年，第14页）中写道，服用麦司卡林后，视觉体验“……除了对空间的漠视，对时间的漠视也更加彻底”。另见W.Mayer-Gross，《药物引起的实验性精神病和其他精神异常》，载于《英国医学杂志》（1951年），第2卷，第317页。

224 Aldous Huxley, The Doors of Perception (London, 1954, p. 14), writes of visual experience under mescaline ‘…along with indifference to space there went an even completer indifference to time’. Cf. also W.Mayer-Gross, ‘Experimental psychoses and other mental abnormalities produced by drugs’, Brit. Med. Journ. (1951), 2, p. 317,



225如果一个人侧着头欣赏风景，其色彩的强度就会增强。这种不寻常的姿势所造成的意义的丧失，会被感官生动性的增强所弥补。

225 If one looks at a landscape with one’s head bent sideways the intensity of its colours is increased. The loss of meaning caused by the unusual posture is compensated for by increased sensory vividness.

232蜜蜂可以通过符号相互交流，但无法将其用于推理思考。因此，文中肯定的符号的独用性与社会性使用之间的联系，反过来却不成立。

232 Bees can communicate with each other by symbols without being able to use these for the purpose of discursive thought. So the connection between the solitary and the social use of symbols affirmed in the text does not hold in reverse.

247这是一致性要求的一个简化版本，我称之为“自我证实的进展”，并在第二部分第 6 章第 142 页中表述如下：“只有通过认可我们在描述人和社会过程中所运用的理智激情，我们才能形成既认可这种认可又维护社会文化自由的人和社会概念。”

247 This is a simplified variant of the consistency requirement which I called ‘self- confirmatory progression’ and formulated as follows in Part Two, ch. 6, p. 142: ‘Only by accrediting the exercise of our intellectual passions in the act of describing man and society can we form conceptions of man and society which both endorse this accrediting and uphold the freedom of culture in society.’



248考虑到《名人录》收录了大约 15,000 名科学家、艺术家、作家等的名字，我们可以估计，2.5 亿英语国家人民依赖大约 20,000 到 30,000 名知识领袖，即万分之一的领袖。

248 Considering that Who’s Who contains about 15,000 names of scientists, artists, writers, etc., we may estimate that the 250 million English speaking people rely on about 20– 30,000 intellectual leaders; i.e. on one in ten thousand.



249在英国，权威个人对于宪法本身的解释作用被普遍认可。

254布尔什维克在掌握了足以解散苏维埃代表大会的武装力量后，奋力争取该代表大会的支持。（莱昂纳德·夏皮罗，《共产主义专制的起源》，伦敦，1955年，第68页）希特勒就任总理仅一个月，便采取了一系列手段，最终迫使国会赋予他绝对权力。斯大林和希特勒都经常运用其强制权力，迫使民众表达对他们的支持，并不断向由他们选出的代表大会发表演讲，以赢得一致掌声。拿破仑在其整个职业生涯中都在努力巩固其统治的合法性，而他的垮台正是因为他从未完全实现这一目标。

254 The Bolsheviks fought hard to obtain the support of the Congress of Soviets, after they had captured sufficient armed power to dissolve this assembly. (Leonard Schapiro, The Origin of the Communist Autocracy, London, 1955, p. 68.) Hitler had been Chancellor for a month when he set in motion a series of manœuvres by which he eventually forced the Reichstag to invest him with absolute powers. Both Stalin and Hitler used their coercive powers regularly to compel expressions of popular support for themselves and continued to address assemblies of men elected at their command in order to earn their unanimous applause. Napoleon struggled throughout his career to strengthen the legality of his rule and his fall was due to the fact that he never fully achieved this aim.



255斯大林肯定相信了克里姆林宫那些被指控企图暗杀苏联领导人的医生们的逼供；因为他下令处决这些政治上无足轻重却为他提供宝贵专业服务的人物，除了这些之外别无其他理由。希特勒秘密灭绝犹太人，以及他固执地拉拢英国——尽管他无法理解英国的态度——都源于他对宣传中所使用的种族主义理论的坚信。

255 Stalin must have believed the extorted confessions of the Kremlin doctors accused of attempting to assassinate the Soviet leaders; for he could have had no other reason for ordering the execution of these politically insignificant men who were rendering him valuable professional services. Hitler’s secret extermination of the Jews, as well as his obstinate wooing of England whose attitude he could not understand, were both determined by his belief in the racial theories used in his propaganda.



256F.Meinecke，马基雅维利主义，伦敦和纽黑文，1957 年，第 3 册，第 1 章。 5.

256 F.Meinecke, Machiavellism, London and New Haven, 1957, Book 3, ch. 5.



257I.Berlin，卡尔·马克思，牛津，1939 年，第 10 页。

257 I.Berlin, Karl Marx, Oxford, 1939, p. 10.



258汉娜·阿伦特，《我们时代的重担》，伦敦，1951 年，第 301 页。另请参阅 G.A.阿尔蒙德（《共产主义的呼吁》，普林斯顿，1954 年，第 22 页）。他对列宁和斯大林主要宣传著作进行了定量分析，结果表明，94%到 99% 的提及共产党及其活动的地方都将其描述为夺取、操纵和巩固权力。甚至斯大林的《历史》也是如此，该书涵盖了该党在苏联执政时期的相当一部分。文中提到的马克思主义者的自我矛盾经常被指出，但人们没有意识到，正是这些矛盾产生了该学说的说服力。有关一些最近的参考资料，请参见第 230 和 239 页的注释。在本章中，“马克思主义”一词更多地用于描述当前的意识形态，而不是马克思本人的假设信念。

258 Hannah Arendt, The Burden of Our Time, London, 1951, p. 301. See also G.A. Almond (The Appeals of Communism, Princeton, 1954, p. 22), where a quantitative analysis of the chief propagandistic writings of Lenin and Stalin shows that 94 per cent to 99 per cent of the references to the communist party and its activities describe it as seizing, manipulating and consolidating power. This is true even of Stalin’s History, which covers a substantial part of the period during which the party has held power in the Soviet Union. The self-contradictions of Marxists mentioned in the text have been frequently pointed out, but it has not been realized that it is these very contradictions that generate the convincing power of the doctrine. For some recent references see notes to pp. 230 and 239. Throughout this chapter the term ‘Marxism’ is used rather for describing a current ideology, than the hypothetical beliefs of Marx himself.



259列维-布留尔所定义的“参与”以及我文中与之等同的“内在性”，仅仅是语义关系的延伸，这种语义关系存在于一个意指另一事物的事物与它所意指的另一事物之间。在这种情况下，有意义的事物并非一个符号，而是一个引人注目的事件，它“吸收”了自身所指的内容，从而肯定了该事物在其自身内部的在场。

259 ‘Participation’ as defined by Levy-Bruhl and ‘immanence’ identified with it in my text, are merely extensions of the semantic relation between something that means another thing and the other thing meant by it. In this case the meaningful thing is not a symbol but a striking event which ‘assimilates’ what it means to the extent of affirming the presence of this thing within itself.



260这大概就是A.J.耶尔（A.J.A.Yer）最近对此事的论述（《遭遇》（Encounter），5 （1955），第32页）。一年前，约翰·普拉梅纳茨（John Plamenatz）在《德国马克思主义与俄国共产主义》（伦敦，1954），第50页中，以警句式的语言总结了他的分析：“……无论科学与社会主义作为一个人生活的一部分如何关联，他永远不可能成为一个科学社会主义者。即使他的科学预言了他的社会主义所赞同的东西。‘科学社会主义’是一种逻辑上的荒谬，一个神话，一个革命口号，是两位道德家的妙语，他们渴望与之前的所有道德家都不同。”在最近的一本书《一个时代的幻觉》（伦敦，1955 年）中，HBActon 教授再次非常详细地重新审视了整个问题，最终得出结论：“马克思主义者只能在一定的范围内从他的社会科学中获得道德戒律，即由于所使用的词汇，这些道德戒律已经形成了社会科学中隐藏的、未被承认的部分”（第 190 页）。

260 This is about how A.J.Ayer has recently put the matter (Encounter, 5 (1955), p. 32). A year before that John Plamenatz had summed up his analysis epigrammatically in German Marxism and Russian Communism (London, 1954), p. 50, as follows: ‘…what ever the relation of science and socialism as parts of the life of one man, what he can never be is a scientific socialist. Not even if his science predicts what his socialism approves. “Scientific socialism” is a logical absurdity, a myth, a revolutionary slogan, the happy inspiration of two moralists who wanted to be unlike all moralists before them.’ In a recent book, The Illusion of an Epoch (London, 1955), Professor H.B.Acton has re-examined the whole question once more in great detail, only to conclude: The Marxist can derive moral precepts from his social science only to the extent that they already form, because of the vocabulary used, a concealed and unacknowledged part of it’ (p. 190).



261Crankshaw，同上，第28页，引用了希姆莱高度道德化的劝诫，要求屠杀所有犹太人。作者在其书的结尾（第247页）将这种在盖世太保中盛行的态度称为“腐朽的理想主义”。

261 Crankshaw, op. cit., p. 28 quotes Himmler’s highly moral exhortations to massacre all Jews. The author concludes his book (p. 247) by calling this attitude, widespread among the Gestapo, ‘idealism gone rotten’.

《自由的逻辑》，芝加哥和伦敦，1951年，第106页。我在该书中也指出，道德颠倒不过是伪替代的巩固，即将虚假的道德颠倒转化为真实的道德颠倒。自由社会是接受真理和正义服务的社会，而极权主义是怀疑论否定真理和正义理念的内在力量（通过颠倒而产生的）结果，这种观点最早在我1946年的著作《科学、信仰与社会》中提出。

The Logic of Liberty, Chicago and London, 1951, p. 106. I have shown there also that moral inversion is but the consolidation of a pseudo-substitution, i.e. the transformation of a spurious moral inversion into an actual one. The view that a free society is one accepting the service of truth and justice, and that totalitarianism is the outcome (by inversion) of a scepticism denying intrinsic force to the ideas of truth and justice, was first outlined in my Science, Faith and Society (1946).



262S.弗洛伊德，《文化中的不行为》。

262 S.Freud, Das Unbehagen in der Kultur.



263弗洛伊德，同上，第八部分。

263 Freud, ibid., Section VIII.



264弗洛伊德，同上，第一部分。

264 Freud, ibid., Section I.



265弗洛伊德，同上，第二部分。

265 Freud, ibid., Section II.



266切斯瓦夫·米沃什，《大诱惑》，文化自由大会出版，巴黎，1952年。这一论点在切斯瓦夫·米沃什的《被俘的心灵》中得到进一步阐述，纽约，1953年。

266 Czeslaw Milosz, La Grande Tentation, published by the Congress for Cultural Freedom, Paris, 1952. The argument is enlarged in Czeslaw Milosz, The Captive Mind, New York, 1953.



267“共产主义在知识分子中的成功，主要是因为他们渴望获得价值的保障，即便不是上帝的保障，至少也是历史的保障。”切斯瓦夫·米沃什， 《汇流》（哈佛大学），5 （1956），第14页。

267 ‘The successes of Communism among the intellectuals were due mainly to their desire to have value guaranteed, if not by God, at least by history.’ Czeslaw Milosz in Confluence (Harvard), 5 (1956), p. 14.



2681935 年 3 月访问莫斯科时，布哈林向作者解释说，纯科学与技术不同，只能存在于阶级社会中。

268 Bukharin explained to the author, on the occasion of a visit to Moscow in March, 1935, that pure science, as distinct from technology, can exist only in a class society.



269博琴斯基在其著作《苏维埃俄国辩证唯物主义》（伯尔尼，1950年）中引用了苏联作家MD卡马里（1947年和1948年）的观点（第142页），认为马克思主义是客观正确的，因为科学的真正利益与无产阶级的利益以及历史的客观运动相一致。但博琴斯基本人也谴责马克思主义明显自相矛盾（第156-157页）。西德尼·胡克在其著作《马克思与马克思主义者》（纽约，1955年）中也指出了同样的自相矛盾之处（第45-46页）。

269 Bochenski, Der Sowietrussische Dialektische Materialismus, Bern, 1950, quotes (p. 142) the Soviet writer M.D.Kammari (1947 and 1948) for the view that Marxism is objectively true because the true interests of science coincide with the interests of the proletariat and with the objective movement of history. But Bochenski himself condemns Marxism as manifestly self-contradictory (pp. 156–7). Sidney Hook, in Marx and the Marxists (New York, 1955), points out the same self-contradiction (pp. 45–6).



270“事实性”是汉娜·阿伦特的表达。

270 ‘Factuality’ is Hannah Arendt’s expression.



271参见伯特伦·D·沃尔夫，《三个革命家》，纽约，1948年，第534-557页。他写道：“俄罗斯的气质和环境里有某种东西，造就了这些性格矛盾、身兼两职的人，比如加蓬、阿泽夫、卡普林斯基、巴格罗夫和马利诺夫斯基——他们在其他国家的警察和革命运动中是独一无二的。” 但实际上，只要两个秘密组织相互对立，这些人物就会再次出现。由于只有少数成员知道成员的身份，因此在他们中间安插间谍相对容易，而这些间谍往往会扮演双重角色。他们偶尔会通过举报恐怖分子来获得报酬，并通过参与针对政府官员的暴力行动来表明自己属于革命一方。当这种背叛持续多年时，就像马利诺夫斯基的情况一样——他从 1902 年一直到 1918 年被处决——即使完全了解事实，也不可能再说他背叛了哪一方，又为哪一方服务。

271 See Bertram D.Wolfe, Three Who Made a Revolution, New York, 1948, pp. 534–57. ‘There was something’, he writes, ‘in the Russian temperament and scene which engendered these men of ambivalent spirit and double role, these Gapons, Azevs, Kaplinskys, Bagrovs and Malinovskys—figures without parallel in the police and revolutionary movements of other lands.’ But these figures actually tend to reappear wherever two secret organizations oppose each other. Since only few initiates know the identity of the members it is comparatively easy to plant spies among them, and these spies will tend to play a double role. They will earn their pay by occasionally denouncing some terrorists and accredit themselves with the revolutionary side by taking part in acts of violence against government officials. When this double-crossing has been practised for many years, as in the case of Malinovsky—who went on with it from 1902 until his execution in 1918—it is no longer possible to say, even with a complete knowledge of the facts, which side the man betrayed and which he served.



272汉娜·阿伦特，同上。引，第。 372.

272 Hannah Arendt, op. cit., p. 372.



273乔治·奥威尔在《一九八四》（伦敦，1949年）第250页中已经说过，在极权主义下，相信现实是一种颠覆性的原则。

273 George Orwell, in Nineteen-eighty-four, London, 1949, p. 250, has already said that belief in reality is a subversive principle under totalitarianism.



274“对苏联语言学现状的任何批评，即使是对所谓语言学‘新学说’最胆怯的批评，都遭到语言学界领导层的迫害和压制。优秀的语言学工作者和研究人员，仅仅因为批评尼·尼·马尔的遗产，或对其学说稍有不满，就被解职或降职。语言学者之所以被任命到领导岗位，并非因为他们的功绩，而是因为他们无条件地接受了尼·尼·马尔的理论。”（斯大林，《论语言学中的马克思主义》，苏联新闻小册子，伦敦，1950年，第22页）

274 ‘The slightest criticism of the state of affairs in Soviet linguistics, even the most timid attempt to criticize the so-called “new doctrine” in linguistics, was persecuted and suppressed by the leading linguistic circles. Valuable workers and researchers in linguistics were dismissed from their posts or demoted for being critical of N.Y.Marr’s heritage, or expressing the slightest disapproval of his teachings. Linguistic scholars were appointed to leading posts not on their merits, but because of their unqualified acceptance of N.Y.Marr’s theories’ (I.V.Stalin, Concerning Marxism in Linguistics, Soviet News Booklet, London, 1950, p. 22).



275 摘自《苏联哲学词典》，第 18 页（由巴黎文化自由大会于 1953 年出版）。

275 Extracts from the Soviet Philosophical Dictionary, p. 18 (Published by the Congress for Cultural Freedom, Paris, 1953).



276这应该排除使用引号中的单词作为同一个单词的名称，例如当我们说“cat”这个词指的是一只猫。

276 This should exclude the use of a word in quotes as a name of the same word, e.g. when we say that the word ‘cat’ designates a cat.



277第 95 页。

277 P. 95.



278RMHare，《道德语言》（牛津，1952 年），第 18 页，将未断言的陈述称为“短语”，将其断言称为断言的陈述的“神经”部分。

278 R.M.Hare, The Language of Morals (Oxford, 1952), p. 18, calls the unasserted statement the ‘phrastic’ and its assertion the ‘neustic’ part of the asserted statement.



279我对“真理”的重新定义，令人联想到马克斯·布莱克的“真理无真理论”（《语言与哲学》，纽约州伊萨卡，1949年，第104-105页），也与PFStrawson对语义理论的批判相一致（《真理的语义理论》，《分析》，9 （1949），第6期）。但这两位作者的目的都在于消除由真理定义引发的问题，而不是将“真理”的使用视为非批判性肯定行为的一部分。

279 My re-definition of ‘truth’ is reminiscent of Max Black’s ‘No truth theory’ of truth (Language and Philosophy, Ithaca, N.Y., 1949, pp. 104–5) and is in accord also with P.F.Strawson’s critique of the semantic theory (‘The Semantic Theory of Truth’, Analysis, 9 (1949), No. 6). But the purpose of both these authors is to eliminate the problem arising from the definition of truth, and not to accredit the use of ‘truth’ as part of an a-critical act of affirmation.



280第 29 页。

280 P. 29.



281形式化可以超越这一点，但仅限于在元理论中描述的“对象理论”，而元理论本身是非形式化的。以下摘自SCKleene著《元数学导论》（阿姆斯特丹，1952年）第62页的文字生动地描述了这一立场：“元理论属于直觉和非形式化的数学。”

281 Formalization can be carried beyond this point, but only for an ‘object theory’ described within a metatheory which is itself informal. The following passage from S.C.Kleene, Introduction to Metamathematics (Amsterdam, 1952) p. 62, vividly describes this position: ‘The metatheory belongs to intuitive and informal mathematics.

…[它]将用普通语言表达，并根据需要引入数学符号……。元理论的断言必须被理解。演绎必须令人信服。它们必须通过直觉推理进行，而不是像形式理论中的演绎那样，通过应用既定规则进行。已经陈述了规则来形式化对象理论，但现在我们必须在没有规则的情况下理解这些规则是如何运作的。即使要定义形式数学，直觉数学也是必要的。

…[It] will be expressed in ordinary language, with mathematical symbols…introduced according to need. The assertions of the metatheory must be understood. The deductions must carry conviction. They must proceed by intuitive inferences, and not, as the deductions in the formal theory, by applications of stated rules. Rules have been stated to formalize the object theory, but now we must understand without rules how those rules work. An intuitive mathematics is necessary even to define the formal mathematics.’



282K.哥德尔，莫纳什。数学。物理学，38 (1931)，第 173–98 页。

282 K.Gödel, Monatsh. Math. Phys., 38 (1931), pp. 173–98.



283A.塔斯基，《语义学中的真理概念和语义学基础》，《哲学与现象学研究》，第4卷（1944年），第341-376页。塔斯基指出，将两种语言分开可以避免“说谎者悖论”。我们通过证明，如果一个事实性断言是由句子p做出的，“p为真”就不是一个句子，从而得出了同样的结论。就本论证而言，这一结论可以用塔斯基定理来表达：“ p为真”属于与p不同的语言——在这种语言中，原始语言中每个被断言的句子都对应着该句子的名称，即引号中的同一个句子。

283 A.Tarski, ‘The Semantic Conception of Truth and the Foundations of Semantics’, Philosophy and Phenomenohgical Research, 4 (1944), pp. 341–76. Tarski shows that by keeping the two languages apart, the Paradox of the Liar is avoided. We arrived at the same result by showing that if a factual assertion is made by a sentence p, ‘p is true’ is not a sentence. For the purpose of the present argument this result may be taken to be expressed by Tarski’s theorem that ‘p is true’ belongs to a different language than p—a language in which to every asserted sentence of the original language there corresponds the name of that sentence, i.e. the same sentence in quotation marks.



284任何正式推理过程中的默契成分在分离后件时都发挥着类似的功能。（参见H. Jeffreys，《英国哲学杂志》，第5卷（1955年），第283页，他支持刘易斯·卡罗尔在《乌龟对阿喀琉斯说了什么》一文中的论证， 《心灵》，新斯科舍省，第4卷（1895年），第278页。）同样的默契操作也隐含在塔斯基对真值的定义中，即从“‘雪是白的’为真”这句话到断言雪是白的行为的转变。拒绝一个基于统计证据而不可能的零假设，是另一个由几乎令人信服的情况引发默契决策的例子。

284 The tacit component of any formal process of inference performs a similar function in detaching the consequent. (See H.Jeffreys, Brit. Journ. Phil. Sci., 5 (1955), p. 283, who supports the argument by Lewis Carroll in ‘What the Tortoise said to Achilles’, Mind, N.S., 4 (1895), p. 278.) The same tacit operation was also implied in Tarski’s definition of truth in the transition from the sentence, ‘“Snow is white” is true’ to the act of asserting that snow is white. The rejection of a null hypothesis rendered improbable on statistical evidence is another case where a tacit decision is induced by virtually compelling circumstances.



285LEJBrouwer 对此表示赞同庞加莱的观点。参见 H.Weyl，《数学与自然科学哲学》，普林斯顿大学，1949 年，第 51 页。

285 L.E.J.Brouwer agrees with Poincaré on this. See H.Weyl, Philosophy of Mathematics and the Natural Sciences, Princeton, 1949, p. 51.



286这是在1949年10月于曼彻斯特大学举行的“心智与机器”研讨会上的一篇通讯。这在《基于序数的逻辑系统》一文中有所预示，伦敦数学学会会刊，第2辑，45期（1938-1939），第161-228页。

286 In a communication to a Symposium held on ‘Mind and Machine’ at Manchester University in October, 1949. This is foreshadowed in ‘Systems of Logic Based on Ordinals’, Proc. London Maths. Soc., Series 2, 45 (1938–9), pp. 161–228.



287因此，我不同意 AMTuring ( Mind, NS, 59 (1950), p.433)的推测，他将“机器能思考吗？”这个问题等同于一个实验问题，即是否可以构造一台计算机来欺骗我们关于其自身性质的知识，就像人类可以在同一方面欺骗我们一样。

287 I dissent therefore from the speculations of A.M.Turing (Mind, N.S., 59 (1950), p. 433) who equates the problem: ‘Can machines think?’ with the experimental question, whether a computing machine could be constructed to deceive us as to its own nature as successfully as a human being could deceive us in the same respect.



288请参阅第 142 页和第 219 页。

288 See p. 142 and p. 219.



289在第 53 页我对传统的解释中，“不加批判的”现在应该被“不加批判的”所取代。

289 In my account of tradition on p. 53, ‘uncritical’ should now be replaced by ‘a-critical’.



290圣奥古斯丁，《自由意志论》，第一卷，第 4 段：“这些步骤是由先知制定的，他说，‘除非你们相信，否则你们不会理解’。”

290 St. Augustine, De libero arbitrio, Book I, par. 4: ‘The steps are laid down by the prophet who says, “Unless ye believe, ye shall not understand”.’



291洛克，《论宽容的第三封信》。

291 Locke, A Third Letter on Toleration.



292康德，《纯粹理性批判》，B 851。

292 Kant, Critique of Pure Reason, B 851.



293康德，《纯粹理性批判》，B 805–6。

293 Kant, Critique of Pure Reason, B 805–6.



294JSMill，《论自由》，第 2 章（Everyman 版，第 83 页）。

294 J.S.Mill, On Liberty, ch. 2 (Everyman edn., p. 83).



295康德，《纯粹理性批判》，B 766。

295 Kant, Critique of Pure Reason, B 766.



296由斯蒂芬·斯彭德 (Stephen Spender) 精心绘制的《一首诗的诞生》(The Making of a Poem)，伦敦，1955 年，第 51-2 页。

296 Well illustrated by Stephen Spender, The Making of a Poem, London, 1955, pp. 51–2.



297CSKenny，《刑法大纲》，第 12 版，剑桥，1926 年，第389-90 页，

297 C.S.Kenny, Outlines of Criminal Law, 12th edn., Cambridge, 1926, pp. 389–90,



298请参阅上文第 138 页。

298 See p. 138 above.



299梅斯梅尔 (1734-1815) 被指控为骗子；埃斯戴尔 (1808-59) 在印度通过催眠催眠状态进行了约 300 次无痛大手术，但无论是在印度还是在英国，他的医学期刊都无法刊登他的工作记录。他的研究结果被解释为这样的假设：当地人喜欢接受手术并试图取悦埃斯戴尔。1842 年，英国的 W.S. 沃德 (WSWard) 在催眠催眠状态中无痛截肢，并将此案报告给皇家医学和外科协会。然而，该协会拒绝相信。反射作用研究的先驱马歇尔·霍尔 (Marshall Hall) 坚持认为该患者一定是个骗子，并将该论文已被宣读的记录从协会的会议记录中删除……八年后，马歇尔·霍尔告知该协会，患者已承认自己被骗，但他的信息来源是间接和保密的。然而，病人随后签署了一份声明，称手术无痛。’埃利奥森（1791-1868）曾任伦敦大学学院医学教授，大学学院医院创始人，并在那里主要以治疗为目的进行催眠术实践，直至1837年大学学院理事会禁止该实践，他才辞去院长职务。（此记述基于E. Boring所著《实验心理学史》 ，第二版，1950年，纽约。Harley Williams所著《医生不同》（Doctors Differ），伦敦，1946年，伦敦，更详细地阐述了埃利奥森的职业生涯。参见上文第一部分，第四章，第52页。）

299 Mesmer (1734–1815) was denounced as an impostor; Esdaile (1808–59) carried out about 300 major operations painlessly under mesmeric trance in India, but neither in India nor in Great Britain could he get medical journals to print accounts of his work. His results were explained by the assumption that natives liked to be operated upon and tried to please Esdaile. In England in 1842 W.S.Ward amputated a leg painlessly under mesmeric trance and reported the case to the Royal Medical and Chirurgical Society. ‘The Society however refused to believe. Marshall Hall, the pioneer in the study of reflex action, urged that the patient must have been an impostor, and the note of the paper’s having been read was stricken from the minutes of the Society… Eight years later, Marshall Hall informed the Society that the patient had confessed to an imposition, but that the source of his information was indirect and confidential. The patient, however, then signed a declaration that the operation had been painless.’ Elliotson (1791–1868) was Professor of Medicine in the University College, London, founder of University College Hospital, practised mesmerism there, mainly for therapeutical purposes, until in 1837 the Council of University College forbade this practice, whereupon he resigned his chair. (This account is based on and the quotations are from E.Boring, History of Experimental Psychology, New York, 2nd edn., 1950. It is supported in greater detail in respect to Elliotson’s career in Harley Williams, Doctors Differ, London, 1946. See Part One, ch. 4, p. 52 above.)



300参见上文第二部分，第 6 章，第 157 页。

300 See above Part Two, ch. 6, p. 157.

301 See my Science, Faith and Society, Oxford, 1946, pp. 75–6.

304有关肯定“上帝存在”的困难，请参阅保罗·蒂利希（Paul Tillich）的《系统神学》（Systematic Theology）第1卷，伦敦，1953年，第227-233页、第262-263页。

304 On the difficulty of affirming ‘God exists’, see Paul Tillich, Systematic Theology, 1,London, 1953, pp. 227–33, 262–3.



305保罗·蒂利希，《圣经宗教与对终极现实的探索》，伦敦，1955 年，第 61 页。

305 Paul Tillich, Biblical Religion, and the Search for Ultimate Reality, London, 1955, p. 61.



306虽然我不敢断言本节中的论点完全赞同任何一位神学作家的观点，但我发现，保罗·蒂利希 (Paul Tillich) 著作中的许多段落证实了我自己对进步新教神学的范围和方法的理解。例如，参见他的《系统神学》第一卷，伦敦，1953 年，第 130 页：“科学、心理学和历史是神学的盟友，共同反对对真正启示的超自然主义扭曲。科学和历史批判保护启示；它们无法消解启示，因为启示属于现实的一个维度，科学和历史分析不足以解决这个问题。启示是理性深度的体现和存在的基础。它指向存在的奥秘和我们的终极关怀。它独立于科学和历史对其出现条件的描述；它不能使科学和历史依赖于自身。现实的不同维度之间不可能存在冲突。理性在狂喜和奇迹中获得启示；但理性不会被启示摧毁，正如启示不会被理性掏空一样。”或者关于“启示的动态”（同上，第140页）：“‘耶稣基督……昨日、今日、一直到永远是一样的’确实是教会历史各个时期不可动摇的参照点。但参照的行为从来都不是相同的，因为新一代带着新的接受潜力进入了这种关联并改变了它。”另一方面（第144页）：“启示知识虽然主要通过历史事件来传递，但并不意味着事实断言，因此它无法通过历史研究进行批判性分析。它的真实性必须通过启示知识维度内的标准来判断。”

306 Although I should not venture to declare that my argument in the present section agrees entirely with the views of any one theological writer, I find my own conception of the scope and method of a progressive Protestant theology confirmed by many passages in the writings of Paul Tillich. See, for example, his Systematic Theology, 1, London, 1953, p. 130: ‘Science, psychology, and history are allies of theology in the fight against the supranaturalistic distortions of genuine revelation. Scientific and historical criticism protect revelation; they cannot dissolve it, for revelation belongs to a dimension of reality for which scientific and historical analysis are inadequate. Revelation is the manifestation of the depth of reason and the ground of being. It points to the mystery of existence and to our ultimate concern. It is independent of what science and history say about the conditions in which it appears; and it cannot make science and history dependent on itself. No conflict between different dimensions of reality is possible. Reason receives revelation in ecstasy and miracles; but reason is not destroyed by revelation, just as revelation is not emptied by reason.’ Or on ‘the dynamics of revelation’ (ibid., p. 140): ‘It is true that “Jesus Christ…the same yesterday, today and forever” is the immovable point of reference in all periods of church history. But the act of referring is never the same, since new generations with new potentialities of reception enter the correlation and transform it.’ On the other hand (p. 144): ‘Knowledge of revelation, although it is mediated primarily through historical events, does not imply factual assertion, and it is therefore not exposed to critical analysis by historical research. Its truth is to be judged by criteria which lie within the dimension of revelatory knowledge.’

307 Cf. pp. 192–5.

315 同上。

315 loc. cit.



316参见 A.Weissberg 的《沉默的阴谋》，伦敦，1952 年，第 128、202、318、352 页；F.Beck 和 W.Godin 的《俄国清洗》，伦敦，1950 年，第 179 页。亚瑟·库斯勒在《正午的黑暗》中首次描述了自我谴责在促使共产党员认罪方面的作用。由于一些前囚犯的描述未能证实库斯勒的理论，我与保罗·伊格诺图斯夫妇就此进行了详细讨论，他们根据自己的丰富经验，大体上赞同该理论。共产党员囚犯对指控的抵抗因他们继续接受马克思列宁主义而大大减少，有些囚犯甚至完全怀疑自己的理智，而不是质疑党的判断。

316 Cf. A.Weissberg, Conspiracy of Silence, London, 1952, pp. 128, 202, 318, 352; F.Beck and W.Godin, Russian Purge, London, 1950, p. 179. The effect of self-condemnation in eliciting Communist confessions was first described by Arthur Koestler in Darkness at Noon. Since the accounts of some former prisoners have failed to confirm Koestler’s theory, I have discussed the matter at some length with Mr. and Mrs. Paul Ignotus, who broadly endorsed the theory from their own extensive experience. The resistance of Communist prisoners against the accusations made against them is much reduced by their continued acceptance of Marxism-Leninism, and some prisoners go so far as utterly to doubt their own reason rather than to call in question the judgment of the Party.



317威廉·詹姆斯，《心理学原理》，2，纽约，1890 年，第 110 页。

317 William James, Principles of Psychology, 2, New York, 1890, p. 110.



318我之前曾描述过类似的稳定性，当时我指出，两种不同的科学解释体系之间存在逻辑鸿沟，从而引发了科学界的激烈争论。参见第150-159页，另见第112-113页。

318 I have described similar stabilities before, when showing that two alternative systems of scientific explanation are separated by a logical gap and thus give rise to passionate controversy in science. See pp. 150–9, also pp. 112–13.

321斯米茨，《同素异形体理论》（1922年）。作者认为贝克的实验（第vii页）是“确定一元相复杂性的最美妙的方法”。

322Coehn 和 Tramm, Ber. deutsch. Chem. Ges., 56 (1923),456; Zeitschr. f. Phys. Chem., 105 (1923), 356, 110 (1924), 110; 以及 Coehn 和 Jung, Ber. deutsch. Chem. Ges., 56 (1923), 695. 这些作者报道了通过强烈干燥可以停止氢和氯的光化学结合。

324 J.R.Partington, General and Inorganic Chemistry, 1946, p. 483. Thorpe’s Dictionary of Applied Chemistry, Article ‘Benzene and its Homologues’ (1947), reports Baker’s ‘interesting discovery’ without any qualification.



325本章第 4 节中给出了这一程序的其他例子，其结果后来被证明是错误的，以说明信念和怀疑的等价性。

325 Other examples of this procedure in which its result subsequently proved erroneous were given before in see. 4. of this chapter to illustrate the equivalence of belief and doubt.



326明智地忽略棘手的事实，甚至对演绎科学的发展也可能有益。希腊数学家们曾因无法用整数表示两条不可通约线段的比值而放弃发展代数。BLVan der Waerden（《科学觉醒》，格罗宁根，1954 年，第 266 页）写道：“希腊数学对这种逻辑一致性的坚持，为其增添了光彩。” 但如果他们的后继者也同样严格地遵循逻辑原则，数学或许会因其自身的严谨性而消亡。

326 The wise neglect of awkward facts may be of value even for the development of the deductive sciences. Greek mathematicians allowed themselves to be discouraged from developing algebra by the impossibility of representing the ratio of two incommensurable line segments in terms of whole numbers. B.L.Van der Waerden (Science Awakening, Groningen, 1954, p. 266) says that ‘it docs honour to Greek mathematics that it adhered inexorably to such logical consistency’. But had their successors been as exacting in their logical scruples, mathematics would have died of its own rigor.



327请参阅上文第二部分，第 7 章，第 210 页。

327 See Part Two, ch. 7, above, p. 210.



328伯特兰·罗素，《让人民思考》，伦敦，1941 年，第 27 页。

328 Bertrand Russell, Let the People Think, London, 1941, p. 27.



329参阅第 171 页。

329 Cf. p. 171.



330伯特兰·罗素，《哲学问题》，第四版，伦敦，1919年，第202页：“……当存在对应事实时，信念为真；当不存在对应事实时，信念为假。” 参见：《人类知识的范围和限度》，伦敦，1948年，第164-170页。第170页：“任何并非单纯行动冲动的信念，都具有画面的性质，并结合了‘是’或‘否’的感觉；在‘是’的感觉的情况下，如果存在一个事实与画面的相似性，就像原型与图像的相似性一样，则该信念为‘真’；在‘否’的感觉的情况下，如果不存在这样的事实，则该信念为‘真’。不真实的信念被称为‘假’。这就是‘真’与‘假’的定义。”

330 Bertrand Russell, The Problems of Philosophy, 4th edn., London, 1919, p. 202: ‘…a belief is true when there is a corresponding fact, and is false when there is no corresponding fact’. Cf. Human Knowledge Its Scope and Limits, London, 1948, pp. 164–70. P. 170: ‘Every belief which is not merely an impulse to action is in the nature of a picture, combined with a yes-feeling or a no-feeling; in the case of a yes-feeling it is “true” if there is a fact having to the picture the kind of similarity that a prototype has to an image; in the case of a no-feeling it is “true” if there is no such fact. A belief which is not true is called “false”. This is a definition of “truth” and “falsehood”.’



331RBBraithwaite，《科学解释》，剑桥，1953 年，第 278 页及后续页。

331 R.B.Braithwaite, Scientific Explanation, Cambridge, 1953, pp. 278 ff.



332以下例子或许能说明这一立场的模糊性。F.Waismann，《可证实性》，载于A.Flew，《逻辑与语言》，I（牛津，1951年），第142-143页：“我们从无限多的可能定律中挑选出一条特定定律的方式表明，在我们对现实的理论建构中，我们受到某些原则的指导——我们可以称之为调节原则。如果有人问我这些原则是什么，我会暂时列出以下几点：（1）简单性或经济性——要求定律尽可能简单，（2）我们使用的符号体系的要求——例如，图形应该代表一个解析函数，以便于执行某些数学运算，如微分，（3）美学原则（毕达哥拉斯、开普勒、爱因斯坦所设想的“数学和谐”），尽管很难说出它们是什么。 (4) 一种原则，它规范着我们概念的形成，使尽可能多的选择成为可判定的。这种趋势体现在亚里士多德逻辑的整个结构中，尤其是在排中律中。(5) 还有一个难以捉摸且极难界定的因素：一种纯粹的思想基调，虽然没有明确表述，但它弥漫在一个历史时期的空气中，并激励着其领军人物。它是一种组织和引导一个时代思想的领域……”或参见H. Feigl论“归纳法与概率”（H. Feigl和W. Sellars，《哲学分析读本》，纽约，1949年，第302页）；其中有人认为，归纳法根本不存在问题，因为归纳法原理根本不是一个命题，而是“一个程序原则、一个规范准则、一个操作规则”。伯特兰·罗素在其著作《人类知识：其范围与限度》 （伦敦，1948年，第六部分，第二章）中也得出了同样的结论。在该书中，科学的前提最终沦为一系列既非经验性也非逻辑必然性的预设。我之前曾批评过这种模糊性（见第113页）。明确的科学前提是准则，只有作为科学家对其现实观的承诺的一部分，才能被承认为准则（见上文第160-170页）。

332 The following examples may illustrate the vagueness of this position. F.Waismann, ‘Verifiability’, in A.Flew, Logic and Language, I (Oxford, 1951), pp. 142–3: ‘The way we single out one particular law from infinitely many possible ones shows that in our theoretical construction of reality we are guided by certain principles—regulative principles as we may call them. If I were asked what these principles are, I should tentatively list the following: (1) Simplicity or economy—the demand that the laws should be as simple as possible, (2) Demands suggested by the requirements of the symbolism we use—for instance, that the graph should represent an analytic function so as to lend itself readily to the carrying out of certain mathematical operations such as differentiation. (3) Aesthetic principles (“mathematical harmony” as envisaged by Pythagoras, Kepler, Einstein) though it is difficult to say what they are. (4) A principle which so regulates the formation of our concepts that as many alternatives as possible become decidable. This tendency is embodied in the whole structure of Aristotelian logic, especially in the law of excluded middle. (5) There is a further factor elusive and most difficult to pin down: a mere tone of thought which, though not explicitly stated, permeates the air of a historical period and inspires its leading figures. It is a sort of field organizing and directing the ideas of an age…’ Or Cf. H.Feigl on ‘Induction and Probability’ (H.Feigl and W.Sellars, Readings in Philosophical Analysis, New York, 1949, p. 302); where it is argued that there is no problem of induction because the principle of induction is not a proposition at all, but ‘a principle of procedure, a regulative maxim, an operational rule’. This is also the conclusion of Bertrand Russell’s Human Knowledge: Its Scope and Limits (London, 1948, Part Six, ch. 2), where the premisses of science turn out to be a set of pre-suppositions neither empirical nor logically necessary. I have criticized this vagueness before (on p. 113). Explicit premisses of science are maxims, that can be acknowledged as such only as part of a commitment endorsing the scientist’s vision of reality (pp. 160–70 above).



333我们已经看到，开普勒正是基于这个理由而拒绝了中世纪的原则，即通过不坚持真理的理论来拯救现象（第146 页）。

333 The medieval principle of saving the phemonena by a theory without commitment to its truth was, as we have seen, rejected by Kepler on these very grounds (p. 146).



334在法国大革命时期，法官有义务将所有成文法未涵盖的事项提交立法机关，但这一做法于1804年被废除。此后，法院有权根据法典及其所体现的法律原则，裁决所有受理的案件，这一原则得到了普遍认可。（参见JW Jones著，《法律理论历史导论》，牛津，1940年。）

334 In France, during the revolutionary period, judges were obliged to refer back to the legislature all matters not covered by statute, but this practice was abolished in 1804. Subsequently, the doctrine gained general acceptance that courts of law are competent to decide every case brought before them, by applying the Code in conjunction with the legal principles embodied in the Code. (Cf. J.W.Jones. Historical Introduction to the Theory of the Law, Oxford, 1940.)



335用弗洛伊德的话来说，主观人格是欲望的本我，受审慎的自我控制。弗洛伊德将责任人格解释为内化的社会压力的产物，由超我内部驱动。这种解释忽略了一个事实：一个同时抑制本我和自我的责任人格，可能同时反抗主流正统观念，而这恰恰是其存在最显著的体现。将道德良知视为社会压力的内化，会使社会对其成员良知给予尊重，甚至应得尊重的想法变得荒谬。超我不可能自由，要求它拥有自由将是荒谬的。至于弗洛伊德将求知激情解释为欲望驱动力的升华，它忽略了科学和艺术与本能（它们本应升华）之间的所有区别。 “升华”是一种迂回的说法，它的含义完全依赖于我们先前对它所要解释的事物的理解。

335 In Freud’s terms the subjective person is the appetitive id, controlled by the prudent ego. The responsible person is explained away by Freud as the outcome of interiorized social pressures, actuated from inside by the super-ego. This interpretation overlooks the fact that a responsible personhood, which curbs both the id and the ego, may at the same time rebel against the ruling orthodoxy, and that this is precisely where its presence is most impressively manifested. To accept moral conscience as the interiorization of social pressure renders nonsensical the very idea of respect being paid, or even due, by society to the conscience of its members. A super-ego cannot be free, and to demand liberty for it would be farcical. As to the Freudian interpretation of intellectual passions as a sublimation of appetite drives, it leaves unaccounted for everything that distinguishes science and art from the instincts of which these are supposed to be sublimates. ‘Sublimation’ is a circumlocution which relies for its meaning entirely on our previous understanding of the things which it is supposed to explain.



336萨尔瓦多·德·马达里亚加在其著作《克里斯托弗·哥伦布》（伦敦，1939年）中，论证了哥伦布在葡萄牙逗留期间曾见过并偷偷抄袭托斯卡内利的地图。他还描述了哥伦布对伪经作家埃斯德拉斯的依赖，后者认为世界“六分陆地，一分海洋”。马达里亚加写道：“对科隆来说，托斯卡内利正在追寻真理，但由于他没有读过埃斯德拉斯的作品，他的计划仍然需要航海家们——他们不习惯看不见陆地——在未知的海域航行130°62.5英里，即8125英里。而科隆通过对埃斯德拉斯的研究，“知道”这段距离只有2550英里。”（第101页）

336 Salvador de Madariaga, in his Christopher Columbus (London, 1939), argues the case for Columbus’ having seen, and surreptitiously copied, Toscanelli’s map during his stay in Portugal. He also describes Columbus’ reliance on the Apocryphal writer Esdras, who believed that the world is ‘six parts dry land and one part sea’. ‘Toscanelli, for Colon,’ Madariaga writes, ‘was on the way to truth, but as he had not read Esdras his plan still required mariners, not used to losing sight of land, to navigate 130° 62½ of miles, i.e. 8125 miles over unknown seas. Colon, through his study of Esdras, “knew” that the distance was only 2550 miles’ (p. 101).



337参见ES和FRRobinson著《普通心理学》（芝加哥，1926年），第242页（檐口和台阶）。RHWheeler著《心理学科学》（伦敦，1929年），第358页（“下落的立方体”和“花瓶和面孔”）。

337 Cf. e.g. E.S. and F.R.Robinson, General Psychology, Chicago, 1926, p. 242 (cornice and steps). R.H.Wheeler, Science of Psychology, 1929, London, p. 358 (‘the falling cube’ and ‘vase and faces’).



338决策制定的这一方面最早由 A.Wald 在《数学统计年鉴》16 （1945 年）第 117 页中正式提出。最简单的情况是，通过收集随机样本来检验零假设H0 。在每次新的检验中，都要做出三重决策，即 (1) 接受H0或( 2) 拒绝H0或 (3) 继续实验。你设定一个值 α，作为即使H0为真也拒绝H0的最大可容忍概率。你继续测试，直到犯此错误的实际概率低于 α。如果你预先为 α 分配一个不合理的小值，你就会付出不合理的时间和精力成本；如果你将 α 固定为零，则会最大限度地提高不合理性。

338 This aspect of decision making was first formalized by A.Wald, Annals of Mathem. Statistics, 16 (1945), p. 117. The simplest case is that a null hypothesis H0 is to be tested by collecting random samples. At each new test a threefold decision is to be made, namely (1) to accept H0 or (2) to reject H0 or (3) to continue the experiment. You fix a value α for the maximum tolerable probability of rejecting H0 though H0 is true. You go on testing till the actual probability of committing this error falls below α. If you pre-assign an unreasonably small value for α you are incurring unreasonable costs in time and effort; if you fix α at zero you maximize unreason.



339请参阅第 122 页。

339 See p. 122.



340L.Heck，“Uber die Bildung einer Assoziation beim Regenwurm auf Grund von Dressurversuchen”，Lotos，67/8 (1916–20)，第 17 页。 168.

340 L.Heck, ‘Uber die Bildung einer Assoziation beim Regenwurm auf Grund von Dressurversuchen’, Lotos, 67/8 (1916–20), p. 168.



341第四部分对此类进行了细分，将单纯的不连贯性与系统性误解区分开来。

341 This class is subdivided in Part Four, by separating mere incoherence from systematically pursued misinterpretations.



342詹姆斯·金斯爵士在《科学与音乐》（剑桥，1937 年，第 184-185 页）一书中引用了亥姆霍兹的话：“当我从音准正的簧风琴转到大钢琴时，后者的每一个音符听起来都很不真实，令人不安……在管风琴上，当混合音栓以完整和弦演奏时，不可避免地会发生一场地狱般的争吵，管风琴家们也只能听天由命。这主要是由于平均律，因为每个和弦都会同时提供平均律和正律的五度音程和三度音程，其结果就是声音混乱而模糊不清。”另见马克斯·普朗克在《科学自传及其他论文》（伦敦，1950 年，第 26-27 页）中写道：“……即使在和声大三和弦中，与平均律三度音程相比，自然三度音程听起来也显得无力和缺乏表现力。毫无疑问，这一事实最终可以归因于多年来和几代人形成的习惯。’

342 Sir James Jeans, Science and Music, Cambridge, 1937, pp. 184–5, quotes Helmholtz as saying, ‘When I go from my justly intoned harmonium to a grand pianoforte, every note of the latter sounds false and disturbing…. On the organ, it is considered inevitable that, when the mixture stops are played in full chords, a hellish row must ensue, and organists have submitted to their fate. Now this is mainly due to equal temperament, because every chord furnishes at once both equally-tempered and justly-intoned fifths and thirds, and the result is a restless blurred confusion of sounds.’ Cf. Max Planck, Scientific Autobiography and Other Papers, London, 1950, pp. 26–7: ‘… Even in a harmonic major triad, the natural third sounds feeble and inexpressive in comparison with the tempered third. Indubitably, this fact can be ascribed ultimately to a habituation through years and generations.’



343对于知觉判断训练实验工作的调查和评论，请参阅 Eleanor J.Gibson 的《通过控制练习或训练提高知觉判断》，《心理学公报》，1 （1953 年），第 401-431 页。

343 For a survey and critique of the experimental work on the training of perceptual judgment, see Eleanor J.Gibson, ‘Improvement in Perceptual Judgments as a Function of Controlled Practice or Training’, Psychological Bulletin, 1 (1953), pp. 401–31. Mrs.



344Wilder Penfield 博士，《大脑运作的证据》，《听众》，41 （1949 年 1 月至 6 月），第 1063 页。

344 Dr. Wilder Penfield, ‘Evidence of Brain Operations’, Listener, 41 (Jan.-June, 1949), p. 1063.



345CLHull，《催眠与暗示》，纽约，1933 年，第 38-40 页（引自 E.Bleuler，“Die Psychologie der Hypnose”，Munch. Mcd. Woch.，1889 年。第 5 期）。

345 C.L.Hull, Hypnosis and Suggestibilitv, New York, 1933, pp. 38–40 (quoting from E.Bleuler, ‘Die Psychologie der Hypnose’, Munch. Mcd. Woch., 1889. No. 5).



346在药理学以及其他科学与技术交叉的领域（参见第二部分，第六章，第179页），所涉及的操作原理与自然法则相重叠，而自然法则是其实用性的条件。即便如此，操作原理的作用始终可以通过其工具性语境与自然法则区分开来。它是一种行动；因此，它既可以成功，也可以失败。

346 In the case of pharmacology and other areas where science and technology overlap (see Part Two, ch. 6, p. 179), the operational principles in question overlap with the laws of nature which are the conditions of their practicability. Even so, the action of an operational principle can always be distinguished from a natural law by its instrumental context. It is an action; which as such can succeed or fail.



347我之前曾指出（第二部分，第六章，第161页），我们所依赖的科学程序规则以及我们所持有的科学信念和评价是相互决定的；此外，我（第二部分，第六章，第184页）还指出，数学可以同样地与自然科学或技术相关联。我们稍后会看到，一个事实语句的真实性等同于其断言的正确性。但这些相互关系可以追溯到感知结构和低等动物的探索活动，它们是获取知识过程的内在属性。它们代表了感知和探索的普遍相互渗透（参见第一部分，第四章，第55-56页），而不是操作原理与其所包含的媒介之间的二元性。

347 I have pointed out before (Part Two, ch. 6, p. 161) that the rules of scientific procedure on which we rely, and the scientific beliefs and valuations which we hold, are mutually determined, and also (Part Two, ch. 6, p. 184) that mathematics can be equally affiliated to natural science or technology. We have seen later that the truth of a factual sentence is equivalent to the rightness of its assertion. But these interrelations, which could be traced back to the structure of perception and the exploratory activities of the lower animals, are intrinsic to the process of acquiring knowledge. They represent the universal interpenetration of sensing and groping (see Part One, ch. 4, pp. 55–6), and not the duality of an operational principle contrasted with the medium in which it is incorporated



348逻辑机器已在第三部分第 8 章第 261 页中讨论过。

348 Logical machines were discussed earlier in Part Three, ch. 8, p. 261.



349例如，参见让·皮亚杰（Jean Piaget）的《逻辑与心理学》，曼彻斯特，1953 年。

349 Cf. e.g. Jean Piaget, Logic and Psychology, Manchester, 1953.



350第 74 页。

350 P. 74.



351第 316-317 页。

351 Pp. 316–17.



352第 62 页。

352 P. 62.



353第 96-7 页。

353 Pp. 96–7.



354我已经提供充分的证据表明，这些综合性问题是由我们对事物普遍性质的洞察力所决定的，而这种洞察力的指导对于科学而言是不可或缺的（参见第135页）。但由于这种普遍概念的受托性质很少被承认，我将在此引用K.S.拉什利（K.S.Lashley）关于我当前主题的两句话。拉什利教授在1948年希克森研讨会上代表与会成员就大脑行为机制发表讲话时宣称：(1)“我相信，我们共同的立场是我们所有人都认同的信念，即行为和心智现象最终可以用数学和物理科学的概念来描述”（第112页）。后来，他又代表自己说道：(2)“我越来越相信，每一种人类行为机制的雏形都能在进化的阶梯中找到，甚至在神经系统的原始活动中也能找到。”如果在人类大脑活动中，存在着一些过程，用我们目前构建的基本整合生理学理论来看，这些过程似乎根本不同或无法解释，那么，这种理论很可能是不完整的或错误的，甚至就其所应用的行为层面而言也是如此”（《行为中的大脑机制：希克森研讨会》，Ll.A. Jeffress 编，纽约和伦敦，1951 年，第 135 页）。虽然我完全赞同此类受托陈述的必要性，也接受 KSLashley 提出的连续性原则，但我并不赞同他的观点 (1)，即心智可以用物理学和化学来表示。即使是机器也无法用这种方式来表示。

354 I have given ample evidence that such comprehensive questions are decided by our vision of the general nature of things, and that the guidance of such a vision is indispensable to science, (see p. 135). But since the fiduciary character of such general conceptions is rarely acknowledged, I shall quote here two statements by K.S.Lashley in respect to my present subject matter. Speaking for the assembled members of the Hixon Symposium of 1948 on cerebral mechanisms in behaviour, Professor Lashley declared: (1) ‘Our common meeting ground is the faith to which we all subscribe, I believe, that the phenomena of behavior and of mind are ultimately describable in the concepts of the mathematical and physical sciences’ (p. 112), and later, speaking only for himself: (2) ‘I am coming more and more to the conviction that the rudiments of every human behavioral mechanism will be found far down in the evolutionary scale and also represented even in primitive activities of the nervous system. If there exist, in human cerebral action, processes which seem fundamentally different or inexplicable in terms of our present construct of the elementary physiology of integration, then it is probable that that construct is incomplete or mistaken, even for the levels of behavior to which it is applied’ (Cerebral Mechanisms in Behavior: The Hixon Symposium, ed. Ll.A.Jeffress, New York and London, 1951, p. 135). While I fully endorse the necessity of such fiduciary statements and also accept the principle of continuity as propounded by K.S.Lashley, I do not share his belief (1) that mind can be represented in terms of physics and chemistry. Not even a machine can be thus represented.



355请参阅第 263-4 页和第 312 页。

355 See pp. 263–4 and 312.



356请参阅第 124 页。

356 See p. 124.



357 WvBuddenbrock，Biologisches Zentralblatt ，1921，41，41-8 。

357 W.v.Buddenbrock, Biologisches Zentralblatt, 1921, 41, 41–8.



358A.Bethe，《正常与病理生理学手册》，1931 年，15 (Zweite H.)，1175–1220。

358 A.Bethe, Handbuch der normalen und pathologischen Physiologie, 1931, 15 (Zweite H.), 1175–1220.



359K.S. 拉什利（K.S. Ashley）在1951年的希克森研讨会（Hixon Symposium）上（第124页）赞同贝特的观点。埃夫·霍尔斯特（Ev Holst）广泛地研究了贝特的研究成果（尤其参见《自然科学》（Die Naturwissenschaften ）第37卷（1950年），第464-476页），试图更精确地阐述贝特关于肌肉协调的动态概念。保罗·韦斯（Paul Weiss）证明了中枢神经系统中不存在解剖学上固定的协调通路，因为他发现，即使肌肉附着于任意种类神经元的神经纤维，其协调性也不会受到影响。有关这一事实及其他支持证据，请参阅《发育分析》（Analysis of Development），B.H. Willier、P.A. Weiss和V. Hamburger编，费城和伦敦，1955年；《神经发生》（Neurogenic），保罗·韦斯著，第388页。

359 K.S.Lashley, in the Hixon Symposium of 1951 (p. 124), concurs in Bethe’s argument. Bethe’s work has been followed up extensively by E.v.Holst (see particularly Die Naturwissenschaften, 37 (1950), 464–76) in an attempt to lend greater precision to Bethe’s dynamic conception of muscular co-ordination. Paul Weiss has proved the absence of anatomically fixed co-ordinative paths in the central nervous system by showing that the co-ordination of muscles remains unaffected when these are attached to nerve fibres belonging to an arbitrary assortment of neurons. For this fact and other supporting evidence see Analysis of Development, ed. B.H.Willier, P.A.Weiss and V.Hamburger, Philadelphia and London, 1955, ‘Neurogenesis’, by Paul Weiss, p. 388.



360 Paul Weiss 实验室最近进行的实验（Proc. Nat. Acad. USA, 42 (1956), 819）显著扩展了等势重组的范围。胚胎皮肤、软骨或肾脏组织被完全分离成独立的自由漂浮的细胞。结果发现，将任意一种组织的细胞随机放在一起，培养物中都会增殖，形成该组织的更高级阶段；从而分别产生羽毛胚、肾小管或某种特征性的软骨。我们还可以补充一点，形态发生整合的能力早已被一些研究者承认，它本质上类似于理解能力，格式塔心理学已将我们的注意力引向了理解能力。这是实验胚胎学大师 1938 年在西利曼讲座上发表的结束语。

360 Recent experiments carried out in the laboratory of Paul Weiss (Proc. Nat. Acad. U.S.A., 42 (1956), 819) have strikingly expanded the domain of equipotential reorganization. Embryonic skin-, cartilage- or kidney-tissue was subjected to complete dissociation into separate freely floating cells. It was found that cells from any one of these tissues, thrown together at random, proliferated in cultures to form higher stages of the tissue in question; thus producing respectively feather germs, kidney tubules or a cartilage of a characteristic type. We may add also that the powers of morphogenetic integration have long since been acknowledged by some investigators as essentially akin to the powers of comprehension, to which Gestalt psychology has directed our attention. The concluding paragraph of the Silliman Lectures delivered in 1938 by the great master of experimental embryology.

汉斯·施佩曼雄辩地表达了这一点。他写道，我仍然需要做出解释，我相信我应该向读者解释。他反复使用的术语并非指向物理的类比，而是指向精神的类比。这并非诗意的隐喻。它旨在表达我的信念：一个拥有各种潜能的胚芽碎片在胚胎“场”中发生的适当反应，以及它在特定“情境”下的行为，并非一种普通的化学反应；而是这些发育过程，如同所有生命过程一样，就其相互关联性而言，与我们所知的任何东西都无法相比，就像我们最熟悉的生命过程，即精神过程一样。它旨在表达我的观点：即使抛开所有哲学结论，仅仅为了精确的研究，我们也不应该错过我们处于两个世界之间所赋予的机会。这种直觉目前正逐渐显现。我希望通过这些实验，在实现新的崇高目标的道路上迈出几步”（汉斯·施佩曼，《胚胎发育与诱导》，纽黑文，1933 年，第 371 页。我擅自将 II.3 和 13 中的“psychical”一词替换为“mental”，相当于德语的“seelisch”，我相信施佩曼想到的是这个词）。

Hans Spemann, expresses this eloquently. There still remains an explanation (he writes) which I believe I owe the reader. Again and again terms have been used which point not to physical but to mental analogies. This was meant to be more than a poetical metaphor. It was meant to express my conviction that the suitable reaction of a germ fragment, endowed with the most diverse potencies, in an embryonic “field”, its behavior in a definite “situation”, is not a common chemical reaction, but that these processes of development, like all vital processes, are comparable, in the way they are connected, to nothing we know in such a degree as to those vital processes of which we have the most intimate knowledge, viz. the mental ones. It was to express my opinion that, even laying aside all philosophical conclusions, merely for the interest of exact research, we ought not to miss the chance given to us by our position between the two worlds. Here and there this intuition is dawning at present. On the way to the high new goal I hope to have made a few steps with these experiments’ (Hans Spemann, Embryonic Development and Induction, New Haven, 1933, p. 371. I have taken the liberty of replacing in II. 3 and 13 the word ‘psychical’ by ‘mental’, the equivalent of the German ‘seelisch’ which, I believe, Spemann had in mind).



361KZLorenz ，《形式方面》，LLWhyte 编辑，伦敦，1951 年，第 176-178 页。

361 K.Z.Lorenz in Aspects of Form, ed. L.L.Whyte, London, 1951, pp. 176–8.



362上文已列举了即使存在解剖损伤，功能仍保持稳定的例子。KSLashley（《脑机制与智力》，芝加哥，1929年）发现，即使是大面积的脑切除，动物的智力表现也几乎不会下降。在1951年的希克森研讨会上，KSLashley、Paul Weiss、Ralph Gerard和Lorente de No基于这些理由以及部分类似的理由，对数字计算机模型提出了反对意见。（但没有人反对我在第335页引用KSLashley所言的基本信念，即思维生物是自动机。）

362 Examples of such functional stability despite anatomical lesions were given in the foregoing section. The discovery that even extensive brain ablations produce little reduction in the intelligent performances of animals is due to K.S.Lashley (Brain Mechanisms and Intelligence, Chicago, 1929). Objections against the digital computer model were raised at the Hixon Symposium (1951) on these and partly similar grounds, by K.S.Lashley, Paul Weiss, Ralph Gerard and Lorente de No. (But no one dissented from the fundamental belief, for which I quoted K.S.Lashley above on p. 335, that thinking beings are automata.)
